loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is an 18-year-old single man. In 2008, he decided to start his own business by opening a small mini market specialized in buying chicken and beef. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a refrigerator and additional merchandise in order to attract more clients.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and additional merchandise

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.en:
B. Gulmurod is 41 years old, has a secondary school education, is married, and has 4 children. Gulmurod has been farming for 6 years. He learned this occupation from his father. He has land where he plants wheat, onions, and potatoes. Gulmurod will use his loan to fertilize his land and to purchase seeds for planting. After harvest, local residents will be able to purchase wheat, onions, and potatoes at a lower price than they would pay at the market. At the day of our visit Gulmurod was gone to the market and instead his wife and daughter were pictured. Gulmurod will pay back the loan on time and he thanks everyone supporting him. The well-being of this family is in your hands.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fuel and lubricants, seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Sinuon Chhat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of sixteen people, each of whom will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Sinuon C., the village bank president, was selected by all of the members. They live in in Veay Chhneah Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land on which she grows rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chan Doeurn Hav, is a furniture maker in Phnom Penh. This family does not earn much income, although they try to work hard in their businesses. 

Thus, to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sinuon C. decided to request a loan to buy some piglets for breeding. With the rest of the loan, she would like to buy pig food. She is a mother of two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Dionisio Salvador

texts.es: Don Dionisio vive en el barrio Villa Libertad en la capital de Managua, ha trabajado en diferentes actividades, trabajo de operador de maquinas industriales, en construcción y actualmente se dedica al servicio de taxi, pues para el ha sido difícil pero no imposible salir adelante con su familia, tiene 55 años de edad, junto con su esposa procrearon 4 hijos de los cuales solo el menor esta estudiando, tiene veintiún años de taxiar y las dificultades que ha tenido es cuando se le descompone el vehiculo que es su fuente de ingreso día  a día. Y no tiene el capital de dinero para repararlo. Con este préstamo dará mantenimiento a su taxi en tapizar los asientos y llantas para seguir dando el servicio a sus clientes, y andar en mejores condiciones para evitar un accidente. Sastifecho por el beneficio de estos préstamos pues han sido para el de gran utilidad para su trabajo como para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Dionisio lives in the neighborhood of Villa Libertad in the capital city of Managua. He has worked in a number of different jobs as an industrial machine operator, a construction worker, and now as a taxi driver. Although life has been difficult for his family, it hasn’t been impossible for them to get ahead. Dionisio is 55 years old, married, and has four children, with the youngest one in school. He has been a taxi driver for 21 years and has encountered difficulties whenever his vehicle breaks down because it is his source of daily income. However, he does not have the money needed to make repairs.

With this loan, Dionisio will be able to maintenance his taxi, reupholster the seats, and replace the tires so that he can continue providing service to his customers. A vehicle that is in good condition will help him avoid an accident. He is satisfied with the benefit of these loans because they have been useful to his job and have helped him support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance his taxi, reupholster the seats, and replace the tires

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed K. is a driver and a local food market supplier.  He owns two vehicles, which he uses to transport local foodstuffs from the farm to the city of Freetown.  He is married and has acquired 20 years of business experience in both driving and trading.  Mohamed want to purchase foodstuffs, lubricant and spare parts for his truck to effectively transport his goods. He hopes to use the proceeds of his loan to construct a house on already-purchased land and to pay his children's tertiary fees.

loans.use: To buy local foodstuffs and spare parts

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is 24 years old and married with one child.  Jonas is known for the business of selling a variety of goods in his shop.  Those goods include body lotion, cooking oil, cylinders, watches, batteries, etc.  This is his third successful year in this business, and he is open from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

Jonas is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that he can expand his business through adding foodstuffs to his shop, as they are highly demanded.  Those foodstuffs include rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, beans etc.  With these additional goods for sale, Jonas hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to create some other sources of income by reinvesting some of his profits.  In doing so, he will be able to create jobs for the people from his community.

loans.use: The purchase of rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, beans etc.

loans.name: Ubumwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Cassilde N. est une mère âgée de 56 ans. Elle habite dans la Commune de Rugombo (Province Cibitoke).   Son mari est un vieux cultivateur ; elle vend du mazout qu’on utilise pour éclairer les ménages dans le milieu rural avec des lampes à pétrole. C’est un métier qu’elle a commence depuis une année alors qu’elle vivait de l’activité de ses champs en tant que cultivatrice.  Elle est sortie du métier lourd de cultivateur grâce au crédit de Turame.

Elle est mère de 8 enfants; 3 filles et 5 garçons dont deux sont déjà maries.  Trois d’entre eux étudient mais aussi elle prend en charge 2 autres enfants dont un orphelin de sa famille pour lesquels elle paie les frais scolaires. Elle a l’espoir que ses enfants finiront leurs études avec succès pour lui venir en aide dans son âge avance. 

Elle compte, avec le crédit Kiva, augmenter son capital et son business en achetant de grandes quantités de mazout pour augmenter ses revenus et ainsi faire face a ses dépenses régulières de ration alimentaire, frais de scolarité et autres frais d’entretien de son ménage. Du fait qu’elle donne son produit à crédit à quelques uns de ses clients, elle affirme que des fois elle fait face aux retards de paiement.  

Elle salue beaucoup l’initiative de Turame et Kiva parce qu’aucune garantie n’est exigée pour avoir son crédit contrairement aux banques et autres IMFs. 

Elle est membre du groupe Ubumwe II, qui veut dire en français « Unité » et fait son deuxième cycle avec Turame.
texts.en:
Cassilde N., 56, is a mother. She lives in the commune of Rugombo (Cibitoke Province). Her husband is an elderly farmer; she sells kerosene which is used in many rural households for kerosene lamps. This is a business that she has been in for one year, whereas she just lived from farming before that. She was able to rise above the physically demanding work of farming thanks to Turame. Cassilde is the mother of 8 children, three daughters and five sons, of whom two are already married. Three of them are students, but she is also responsible for the school fees of two other children, one of whom is an orphan from her family. She hopes that her children will be able to finish their studies successfully so that they can help her when she is old. With the Kiva loan, she is counting on adding to her working capital and her business, by buying kerosene in bulk to grow her income and thus be able to cover her day-to-day expenses for food, school fees, and other household costs. Since she sometimes sells on credit to some of her customers, she affirms that she sometimes has trouble with late payments from these customers. She is very grateful for Turame's and Kiva's initiatives since no collateral is needed in order to request a loan, contrary to banks and other microfinance institutions. She is a member of the Ubumwe II group, which means in translation "United", and she is on her second loan with Turame.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of kerosene used for lighting houses with kerosene lamps

loans.name: Alaine

texts.en:
Alaine S. is 20 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture of handicrafts.  Alaine has 2 years of experience in this business.  Alaine needs a loan of 1500 talas to purchase paints, brushes and carving equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or about US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Alaine joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Alaine's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase paints, brush and carving equipments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of foodstuffs and staple goods

loans.name: Cartas

texts.en:
Cartas is 42 years old and is a widow. She owns a shop selling a variety of goods. She has owned this shop for about three years and the hours of her business are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Cartas is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of goods to sell. She hopes that, through these additional goods, she will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business and start saving for a better future.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her store such as rice, different types of flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Fany Narcisa

texts.es:
Fany de 49 años, ella vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil un lugar urbano donde esta la mayor parte de la gente de bajo recursos económicos. Ella tiene una taller de costura en su casa. 

Para tener su taller de costura ella tuvo que trabajar por muchos años cociendo para comprar su primera maquina de coser. Hace 5 años atrás ella pudo comenzar con el taller de confección en la sala de su casa. Ahora trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 19h00pm. 

Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar telas, hilos para su taller de confección. En el futuro quiere tener un ayudante para su taller de confección.
texts.en:
Fany is 49 years old and lives in Guasmo in Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are of limited financial resources. She has a sewing workshop in her home.

In order to start this business, Fany had to work many years as a cook so that she could buy her first sewing machine. Five years ago, she established her workshop in the living room of her house. She now works from 9am until 7pm.

With this loan, Fany wants to buy fabrics and thread for her sewing workshop. In the future, she wants to hire an assistant for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Rosa Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa T. es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo reconocida esta ciudad por su belleza arquitectónica, los 4 ríos que la bañan, su gente que es calida, amable y por su gastronomía.

Nuestra socia se dedica a atender un salón de comida y una tienda que son de su propiedad, la cual ya tiene un año y medio, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 7 a.m. hasta la 1 a.m.
 
La Señora Rosa tiene 58 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes tiene las edades de 30, 28, 25 y 20 años, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientemente, y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en la universidad, su esposo trabaja en una carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo realizando los créditos en la fundación, fue invitada por su sobrina,  el nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda como son gaseosas, cervezas, y víveres para realizar sus platos.

Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa T. is a member of the Communal Bank “El Arenal” (The Sandpit). She lives in the city of Cuenca which is known for its beautiful architecture, the four rivers that surround it, the warmth and friendliness of its people, and its cuisine.

For the past year and a half, Rosa has been managing a diner and a store that are on her property. She works from Sunday to Sunday from 7am to 1am.

Sra. Rosa is 58 years old, married, and has four children (ages 30, 28, 25, and 20). The two older children are married and live independently, while the two younger ones are university students. Her husband works as a carpenter. She does not have a home of her own, so she and her family live in a rental property.

Rosa is participating in her third loan cycle with Fundación ESPOIR. She was invited by her niece to become a member. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of more products for her business such as sodas, beer, and ingredients for preparing her dishes.

Her dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, beer, and ingredients for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.en:
Najmiddin has got a minivan and run a transportation service. His usual itinerary is the Isfara-Khujand-Isfara route. Have been in this business for 2 years he has gained significant experience. Initially he rented the car, but a little time, after making enough savings, he bought his own minivan with the support of his father. The business is now stable and generates the main income for Najmiddin’s family allowing them all to improve their living conditions. Currently his minivan needs some repairs, so he needs a loan of 7500 Somoni.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the spare parts in order to repair his minivan.

loans.name: Joseph Odhiambo

texts.en:
Joseph has been in auto repair, operating in Naivasha town, for the last twelve years. He is 32 years old, is married to Mary Odhiambo, and they have two children.

Joseph was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 2nd loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 15,000 well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy new equipment for his garage which includes a grinder and a battery charger.

Joseph is planning to open a shop from which he will sell mobile phones and their accessories.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for his garage

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Zaib Muhammad Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Zaib lives in Khanewal, a small town located near the city of Multan, Pakistan. Khanewal is famous for its shrines. She lives in a two-roomed brick house with her family, and she moved here with her family 30 years ago. Zaib is 56 years old, married to M. R., and the mother of five children – three sons and two daughters. Her four children are receiving an education except her eldest son who completed his education until 10th standard and couldn't continue further studies due to financial constraints. He now works as a property dealer in a company.
Zaib's husband is a rickshaw driver. He has been in this business for the last five years and it enables him to manage his children's education expenses. His eldest son contributes financially to his family as well in order to keep things running smoothly. Zaib has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband because he has problems driving his rickshaw. With the loan, he will repair its engine and give it a new look by replacing the old seat covers with new ones. Zaib thinks that a fully repaired rickshaw will allow her husband to work with more efficiency.
Zaib is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her third loan cycle. In previous years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client who attended every meeting and paid her installments on time.
Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Zaib.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw and replace the old seat covers

loans.name: Maryana

texts.en:
Maryana makes a living selling clothing in the town of Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. She is married and has a 3-year-old daughter. She has been in this line of work for the last eight years, and today runs a store which is located in the heart of town. She currently makes about 25,000 Grivnyas a month, and her profit comes to about 7,000 Grivnyas. 

Maryana is seeking a loan of 7,000 Grivnyas to buy assorted men’s and women’s clothing. She is a determined entrepreneur with a clear vision for her business, and hopes to open a second location in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Mrs. Tong S. (in the photo), is a silk weaver. Her husband is a farmer and raises cows at home. They have been married since 1960 and have six children; three sons and three daughters. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Tong has made Kiva loans several times already. She now is requesting another loan of $600 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence E. is from the town of Surallah. He is 34 years old. To make a living, Laurence owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Laurence also raises pigs for breeding. He works hard to help his family financially.

Laurence joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laurence has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Laurence is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and pig feed. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and pig feed.

loans.name: Beatrice Esi Amosiwah

texts.en: Beatrice Esi Amosiwah E. sells cooking utensils and shoes at Asenadze near Abura. She moves from one area to the other with the shoes. Beatrice has attained junior high level of education. She is single. She has been selling shoes for some time now. Her loan will enable her to buy more shoes to expand her business. She hopes to build a shop from her profit.

loans.use: buy more shoes to expand her business

loans.name: Les Phares Group

texts.en:
Michel is the coordinator of his group Les Phares, which translates from French to "The Lighthouses". He makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and seven children, ranging in age from 2 to17 yrs. old. He says that his most difficult challenges are in the transportation of his merchandise to the various towns and communities where he sells. The roads are bad, and because the markets are outside, the rain can really disrupt the sales.

Michel is excited to be taking his 1st loan with Esperanza after having heard about the success of others and the growth of their businesses. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business of footwear sales both in nearby Dajabon, Dominican Republic, and other communities in Northern Haiti. He will use the profits to continue to grow his business and help pay for the education and benefit of his family. In the meantime he plans to continue enjoying the work that he does in his church and community.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients generally. His group is located in Ounaminthe, which is the town on the border of Haiti and the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of Haiti, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Boxes of both new and used shoes

loans.name: Joseph Letuwuon

texts.en:
Joseph, who is 25 years old, was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last five years and now he wants to diversify; thus, the reason for borrowing this loan. He will buy 15 sheep that he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, he hopes to run a profitable business so that his family may live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep that he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beef

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert M. is 62 years old, married, and has six adult children. He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya and has been in the farming business for over 30 years.  He employs three casual laborers. Robert sells his farm products at the local market. He also earns income from his posho mill in the same region.

Robert has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable his family to meet their basic needs and improve their livelihood. He plans to acquire more land in the future that will enable him expand his farming activities. He faces the challenges of drought, which affects his production, and bad debtors, which affects his cash flow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz lives in a small village called Mukhrani, located in one of the agricultural area of the country – Kartli. He is 28 years old, unmarried and lives with his parents and brother. Nikoloz’s mother is a housewife and his father is a taxi driver. Nikoloz’s contribution to his family’s income is very important - approximately 65%. 

Nikoloz runs a car washing facility in the village. In addition to this, Nikoloz recently constructed a building for a grocery shop. The building is next to the car washing box. With this loan Nikoloz plans to renovate the building and open the shop to the first customers. According to Nikoloz’s estimations the shop will have a sufficient number of clients and will be profitable. A part of the profit received from the retail trade will be used for expansion of the car washing facility.

loans.use: To purchase materials for grocery shop renovation

loans.name: Lesbia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lesbia Del Carmen tiene 34 años, se dedica a la venta de leña y sal. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que han sido de gran apoyo a su negocio. Su esposo contribuye en este medio de vida pues él se encarga de realizar la distribución de estos productos, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están contentos por la buena calidad y el servicio. Mantener este negocio es muy importante para ella, pues es la única fuente de empleo para mantener el hogar.
texts.en: Lesbia Del Carmen is 34 years old and earns her living by selling firewood and salt.  She is an enterprising person who has managed to get ahead.  This is not the first time she has received financing since the loans have been a great help to her business.  Her husband contributes to their livelihood by delivering the products.  Most of her customers are always satisfied because of the good quality and the service she provides.  Maintaining this business is very important to her because it is the only source of employment by which she is able to support her household.

loans.use: Operating capital for her business selling firewood & salt

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua D. has made her living by selling porridge (made from millet and corn )for 10 years, at Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. She is divorced and depends on her income make ends meet. 
Her goal is to grow her profits by boosting the volume of porridge she sells. The loan she needs will allow her to buy more ingredients to make more porridge. She intends to reinvest the profits into her business for further growth. 
In this picture, Ekua is showing the soaked millet she is getting ready to be milled to prepare the porridge.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make more porridge.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old married man and has 3 children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working in car painting since 1995. He has chosen this occupation because it is a good business market. His work consists in repainting cars and delivering them to customers with excellent outside looks. He is thankful for his business income because he is able to provide a good living conditions to his family in addition to paying for his children's schooling. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his tools and improve his business. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to renew his tools

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

He deals in the sale of maize and has been in this business for the last five years.

However, he has a challenge of labor and transport. 

He dreams of educating his children and becoming a large-scale maize dealer.

Benon needs the loan to buy maize for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize to resell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina nació en la provincia de la ciudad de Chumvilicas y tiene 31 años de edad. Actualmente, Valentina se dedica a la venta de pasto de forma ambulatoria y también se dedica a la crianza de animales. Ya es un año que se dedica al negocio y le va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. Valentina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar queso y carne de la ciudad de Chumvilicas.  

Valentina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Valentina was born in the province of the city of Chumvilicas and is 31 years old. Presently, Valentina sells pasture from place to place and also breeds animals. She has been doing this for a year with excellent results thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

She is requesting the loan to buy cheese and meat from the city of Chumvilicas. Valentina is a responsible person and is a member of the Communal Bank ‘Sumac Purisisun’ of the Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy cheese and meat from the city of chumvilicas.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Antonia vive en Santa Cruz hace más de un año, ella antes vivía en el departamento de La Paz, por motivos de salud es que se vino a Santa Cruz, ella ahora se dedica a la venta de comida en la pensión que tiene en la casa que alquila por la zona Villa 1ro de mayo, ella se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable ya que todos los días esta atendiendo su pensión, para eso se levanta muy temprano todos los días para comprar carne y verduras para la comida y así atender a los clientes que día a día asisten a su pensión, por le momento ella necesita del crédito para poder comprar los abarrotes al por mayor y así no tener que ir todos los días al mercado y comprar un frízer para conservar la carne. Su hijo mayor se vino con ella de La Paz para acompañarla y también poner su negocio junto al de ella para estar juntos, la Señora Laura tiene como sueño aumentar su capital para poder convertir su pensión en lugar más grande ya que quiere comprarse su casita para así no vivir en alquiler y tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Mrs. Antonia has lived in Santa Cruz for more than a year. Before this she lived in La Paz. She had to move to Santa Cruz for her health. She sells prepared food in her rented house in the Villa Iro de Mayo zone. She is a responsible person and works at this business each day. She gets up early in order to buy meat and vegetables for her prepared food. Each day she serves her meals to her customers. She is requesting a loan in order to buy wholesale priced groceries. By purchasing food in this manner, she will not have to go to the market each day. She would also like to buy a freezer for the meat. Her oldest son came with her from La Paz and has his business with her so that they can be together. She dreams of growing her capital in order to obtain a larger workplace as she wants to buy a small house so that she doesn’t have to pay rent and can have her own house.

loans.use: to buy wholesale groceries such as rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Julia se dedica a la venta de flores. Julia compra: claveles, gladiolos, pompos en Uchuypampa y los vende en su puesto de flores en el mercado Nery García, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de flores variadas.
Julia ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una socia, le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por los ahorros. Con sus ahorros está construyendo su casa y tambien ahorra para la educación de sus hijos.
Su sueño es llegar a ser mayorista y que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Agua Viva community bank.  She is 54 years old, married, and has 7 children.  Julia sells flowers.  She buys carnations, gladioli and 'pompos' in Uchuypampa and sells them on her flower stall in Nery García market.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying a variety of flowers.

Julia joined FINCA Peru through an invitation from an existing member.  She enjoys her community bank meetings because of the savings.  She is building a house with her savings and also saving for her children's education.

Julia's dream is to become a wholesaler and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Aïssa

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssa est âgée de 35  ans, mariée et  mère  de 2 enfants. Elle  vit avec son mari  et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle au  quartier Secoura de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Enseignante de profession, elle fait également le commerce depuis des années afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Aïssa excelle dans la fabrication de jus de fruits, de la glace alimentaires, des boissons fraîches etc. 
Dans le dessein de diversifier son activité, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle  est en relation avec  Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 60 mois après 4 prêts solidaires et  3 prêts individuels bien remboursés.  Elle est à son 4 ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, un congélateur.  Elle  s’approvisionne sur place. Madame Aïssa vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes parmi ses clients figurent quelques hommes qui sont des boulangers.
 Avec ce prêt, elle  envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, ce qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de continuer son activité.  
Son ambition est de pérenniser son activité et d’avoir plus de financement.
texts.en:
Ms. Aïssa is 35 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in a traditional family in the Secoura district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A teacher by profession, she has also had a business for years to support her family. She excels in making fruit juices, ice, cold beverages, etc. 

With plans to diversify her business, Aïssa turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with which she has had an association for 60 months. Her four solidarity loans and three individual loans have all been repaid. She is on her fourth individual loan, which she intends to use to buy a freezer. She gets her supplies locally. Accepting cash or credit, she sells to a customer base composed mostly of women, although a few of her customers are men who are bakers. 

With this loan, Aïssa envisions making a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA. This will enable her to repay her loan and to continue her business. Her ambition is to keep her business going indefinitely and to obtain more financing.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Mrs. Hout, age 32, is married with one child who attends school. She has been a local farmer for years. She and husband earn additional income by running a small vehicle washing business inside her home. She provides this service to her neighbors and other travelers. Her husband also repairs motors.

Mrs. Hout usually generates a profit of around $5 a day to meet her family's needs. She is seeking a loan to buy two cows to assist her in the field. Since cows can also be used for breeding purposes, the couple can raise the offspring.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 31 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta mochilas, ella vende los sabados y domingos en el baratillo que es un lugar donde venden ropa, zapatos entre otras cosas, también la socia se dedica a realizar manualidades en cerámica en frio, ella hace diferentes trabajos como muñecas, animalitos  entre otros trabajos, ella trabaja para contratos, por medio de estos trabajos la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de mochilas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mochilas y materiales para hacer la cerámica.
                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Yahuar Maqui” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She is 31 years old, single and has a son.  She alternates her daily chores with the sale of backpacks.  She sells every Saturday and Sunday at the "Baratillo” which is a place where they sell clothes and shoes, among other things.  She also makes unbaked ceramics.  She makes different items like dolls and little animals, among others.  She works with contracts and these jobs help her support her son.  She wants to expand the backpack selling business and is asking for the loan to buy backpacks and supplies to make ceramics.

She is happy with the loan and committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy backpacks and supplies to make ceramics.

loans.name: Ulziihutag

texts.en:
Ulziihand is 52 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a house in the Dornod province of Mongolia. She manages a cafe in her town with the help of her husband and daughter. She started her business in 2000 having worked as a cook for several years. Since then her business has been quite successful. This enabled her to buy a house for her family in 2002. She plants a variety of vegetables and flowers in her backyard. Now she employs 5 more workers at her cafe. She is planning to have her own building for her business operations. 

She is a polite and kind woman who possesses good managerial and accounting skills. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase tables and chairs for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sabenty” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata. Aminata is age 42. She was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman. One of her children is attending primary school and three are in secondary school. Aminata has been a petty businesswoman for 10 years now. She sells milk, mayonnaise, butter, sugar, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy milk, mayonnaise, butter, sugar, etc. in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Danila

texts.en:
Danila is 49 years old and the single mother of two children. Her children are 16 and 24 years old. They currently still live with her while they attend school. 

Danila sells leather products, on the street, such as purses, small bags, and coin purses. She works everyday selling her merchandise in all parts of the city of Cusco. Danila greatly desires to add to the variety of products she sells. She is asking for a 300 dollar loan in order to purchase a wider variety of leather products to sell. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more leather products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and vegetables in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 42 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy alegre, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 19, 14 y 10 años, juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. El trabajo de Rosa consiste en la venta de ropa, es así que se dirige a los caseríos en busca de clientes para ofrecer su producto y algunos accesorios de vestir. Tiene 7 años realizando este negocio, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para disponer de su horario, y eso le hace ser una mujer independiente, por ahora su objetivo es consolidarse en su negocio. Este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, y está muy agradecida pro la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito para crecer su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más ropa, con el fin de tener variedad de mercadería y pueda ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosa is 42 years old. She is a self-starter and has a positive attitude. She lives with her partner and their three children, 19, 14, and 10 respectively. The family has their own house. Rosa's business is selling clothes. She travels to various neighborhoods looking for clients and selling them her clothing and accessories. She has been running this business for seven years. Her favorite thing about this job is that she can control her own work schedule, and this makes her feel like an independent woman. Her current goal is to strengthen her business. This will be her eighth loan with MFP, and she is very thankful for the opportunity to have access to credit. She will purchase more clothing with the loan in order to offer more variety to her clients.

loans.use: purchase more clothing to increase inventory for her clothing store.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 56 years old and married. She is a hardworking businesswoman who is blessed with four children. For the last five years, she has been operating a green grocery to make a living. Beatrice earns additional income from dairy farming. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become financially stable.

Beatrice is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy cabbages, onions, and cereals to sell. In the next five years, she would like to expand her business into wholesale.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, onions, and cereals to sell

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 52 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alita has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Alita is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evan Nicolas

texts.en:
Evan Nicolas is a 54-year-old man. He is married with two grown children. The family settled in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Evan Nicolas owns and operates a motorcycle transport business for a living. He has been running a route around routine destinations for over five years. His wife works abroad to provide for better living conditions for their family. Evan Nicolas depends mainly on his transport business income to buy everyday household necessities. This transporting job allows him to earn PHP 5,000 each month. He has borrowed PHP 22,000 from GDMPC to purchase vehicle spare parts and resume his quality business.

Evan Nicolas became a GDMPC member earlier this year. In the future, Evan Nicolas hopes to expand seating capacity and improve further the services offered to attract more passengers. He expect another loan from the cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Martha Veronica

texts.es:
Martha tiene 30 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en Ibarra. Se describe como una persona buena, responsable y honesta.

Martha trabaja sola en la confección de sacos de lana. Es la primera vez que trabaja con fodemi y el crédito que solicita es para la compra de lana para poder incrementar su producción debido a que le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas e ingresos con lo cual mejorará su calidad de vida de su familia.

Su sueño es tener un local grande para poder emplear personal en su negocio, también tiene la necesidad de acabar su casa.
texts.en:
Martha, 30, es married and has three children.  She lives with her family in Ibarra.  She describes herself as a good, responsible and honest person.

Martha works alone making wool coats.  This is the first time she works with Fodemi and the loan she’s requesting is to buy wool to increase production which will help her increase sales and income thus improving her family’s quality of life.  Her dream is to have a large locale to employ people in her business; she also needs to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years. He is 42 years old, married to Mary, and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

In future, Jeremiah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Allaoui

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married, and the father of one child.

Allaoui is carpenter. Since 2006, he has owned a workshop where he makes and sells furniture. He has more than ten years' experience in this field, a good reputation, and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He is well known in the surrounding area. 

He is requesting a loan of $3000 to purchase woodworking machinery. He is aiming to earn more profits so he will have the opportunity to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase woodworking machinery.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Alicia compró su maquina collarin e inició su propia línea de producción de prendas com fajas reductoras, bodys etc. En la actualidad está aplicando a su segundo credikiva con el cual comprará una máquina fileteadora y otra de collarín para mejorar el acabado de las prendas y aumentar la producción, para satisfacer su demanda que proviene de Ibagué  y desde Sincelejos. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores: "Gracias por la confianza que me han dado para crecer con mi taller y con mi familia.
texts.en:
With her previous Credikiva, Alicia bought an industrial sewing machine, and started her own production line of clothing such as shapewear and body slimmers.  

Currently she is applying for her second Credikiva, which she will use to buy a serger and an industrial sewing machine. This is to improve the finishing of her clothing, and increase production to satisfy the demand coming from Ibagué and Sincelejo. 

She sends the following message to the lenders, "Thank you for the trust you have given me, so that I can grow with my workshop and my family."

loans.use: To buy a serger, and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana, D. 64 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía D. su esposo Celso, con quien se casó desD. hace 44 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con una D. ellas en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad D. Ataura.  A pesar D. su edad, es una mujer que no descansa. Sufrió la pérdida D. uno D. sus hijos, para ella fue muy triste, pero sabe que tiene que luchar por los que aún viven. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, siembra papa, maíz, trigo, alverja, habas y alfalfa. Ya tiene 24 años dedicándose a esto, sus principales cosechas los comercializa a la ciudad D. Lima, Oroya y Jauja, “depenD. del precio en el mercado”, afirma. En todo este tiempo pudo adquirir 5 hectáreas D. terrenos productivos, animales como vacas, terneras y cuyes; que le generan un dinero extra. Ahora aprovecha la llegada D. una empresa importante D. telefonía, a quienes prepara los alimentos del día a cambio D. un pago mensual, por lo que ahora está obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos para el hogar. Ella pertenece al bA. comunal “hacienda” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donD. se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo D. todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Viviana D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos D. maíz y papa “yungay” que recién sembrará.
texts.en:
Viviana is 64 years old and a working woman. She lives with her husband Celso and they have been married 44 years. They have 5 children, but only one lives with them, in their own house, located in the town of Ataura. Despite her age, she is a woman who does not rest. She suffered the loss of one of her children, and was very sad, but she knows that she has to fight for the ones that are still alive. 

Her main economical activity is agriculture. She grows potatoes, corn, wheat, peas, beans and alfalfa. She has been doing this for 24 years. She sells most of the crops in Lima, Oroya and Jauja, “depending on the market price”, she says. During this time she was able to buy 5 hectares of productive land, and animals such as cows, calves and guinea pigs, which bring in extra income. Now she is taking advantage of the arrival of an important telephone service, preparing daily food in exchange for a monthly payment, so now she is saving money on her household expenses. 

She belongs to the community bank “Hacienda” and this is the 3rd loan with MFP, where she feels happy, because she receives the help of all of you, permitting her to go on with her business. Also, she promises to be punctual in her loan payments, as the community bank is maD. up of responsible and caring people. Upon receiving help she will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spread about her corn and yungay potatoes (similar to a yellow potato) that were recently planted.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 34 years old, married with no children. He runs a carpentry workshop and has been in this business for 7 years. He is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital to purchase raw materials. His business goal is to expand his business into new markets and his personal goal is to build a permanent residential house.
Justus needs a loan to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.use: to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a divorced woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing a shop to sell clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS NIEVES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julio Cesar; el tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en la liga de basket, ella trabaja en el área administrativa en arbitraje, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es tener su propia academia donde pueda enseñar basket. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un equipo de sonido para implementar su casa.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Virgen de las Nieves" Communal Bank. This bank is located in the distruct of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.
This is Mr. Julio Cesar. He is 28 and single. He shares his daily activities with his work with the basketball league as a referee. He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. He wants to get ahead through this work. His dream is to have his own academy where he can teach basketball. He is requesting this loan to buy sound equipment for his home.
He is happy to have this loan and promises to repay his quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for his home.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 8 children. 

Rosalinda has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & candies. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy more snacks, beverages & candies to sell.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & candies

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: He is 39 years old married and is blessed with two children.He has been in business for ten years now.He has borrowed loan to purchase  plumbing stock hoping this will generate income.His hopes and dreams in future is to expand his business, pay school fees and have a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his used clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nayioma wants to buy 4 medium size steers.

loans.name: Serhan

texts.en: M. Serhan is a dislocated person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh since 1993. He is 34, married and has 3 children. He has applied for $1200 USD loan to purchase wheat for growing.

loans.use: To purchase and grow wheat

loans.name: Mirzomiddin

texts.en: Mirzomiddin S. is 26 years old and lives in the Yavan district. He has a paraprofessional medical education. He is married and has 1 child. He worked as nurse in a local hospital. The salary was too low to take care of his family so he started his own business.  He has a store in a central market of the Yavan district where he sells sport clothes and footwear. He has had this business for 6 years. For the loan amount for $750 Mirzomiddin is going to increase the range of goods he has to sell.   Sport clothes are very popular among youth and now they would the opportunity to obtain them in a local market.   Mirzomiddin is going to pay off the loan amount in 12 months.

loans.use: to obtain new range of sport goods and footwear

loans.name: Ravy

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Ravy learned to weave from her mother in1982 and then started weaving silk at home. One of her daughters also weaves silk at home with her. Her husband has been a potato farmer since 2004. They married in 1983, and have 5 children, 3 sons and 2 daughters.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times before. Now she is asking for a loan of $300 to expand her silk production. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom. She would also like to buy more potato seeds for her husband's farm.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: “To support my family standards of living, I sell provisions, drinks, and recharge cards at my shop” says Ruth O.. Ruth is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. Ruth is looking for a loan of $250 to provide a wider range of products to sell at her shop, and better support her family and children.

loans.use: To buy more provision, drinks & recharge card for sale

loans.name: Faustina Natividad

texts.es:
Mrs. Faustina Nautividad is 57 years old and the mother of six children, only one of which is still a dependent. Faustina completed primary school and currently lives in the Carabamba district of the Julcan province in the state of La Libertad.

At a very young age Faustina learned to bake bread from her parents and began her career as a baker. Currently Faustina sells bread and other basic products such as sugar, rice, and oil in the small store which shares space with her home. In addition to managing this business, Faustina also raises animals including cattle, sheep, and swine which she sells in the local fairs.

After being invited by her sister-in-law to join, Fuastina became a part of the Communal Bank “Alfa and Omega.” From this bank she received her first credit of S/. 300.00 ($100.00). In order to best benefit from the loan she used the funds to purchase soda and beer, which she sold in the city-wide party which occurred soon after the date see received the funds.

This loan of S/.1,200.00, which she will repay in four months, will be used to purchase sacks of flour, butter, sugar, and six loads of firewood. Faustina’s dream is to have an electric oven so that she can bake even better bread.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Faustina Natividad, tiene 57 años de edad, estudió primaria completa y tiene 6 hijos, pero sólo uno depende de ella. Vive en el distrito de Carabamba, provincia de Julcán, departamento de La Libertad.

Desde muy pequeña aprendió de sus padres a preparar pan y a eso se dedica. Ahora vende el pan que prepara en una pequeña tienda ubicada en su domicilio, aunque también vende otros productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Aparte de tener este negocio la señora Faustina también cría animales como vacas, carneros y cerdos, los cuales los vende en las ferias de su pueblo.

La señora Faustina ingresó al Banco Comunal “Alfa y Omega” por invitación de su cuñada. En su banco comunal recibió su primer crédito de S/.300.00, con el cual compró cerveza y gaseosa porque la fecha en que lo recibió estaba cerca a la fiesta de su pueblo y tenía que aprovechar estas fiestas para vender estos productos.

El préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará sacos de harina, manteca, azúcar, seis cargas de leña, etc. Su sueño es tener un horno eléctrico para elaborar un pan de mejor calidad.

loans.use: Purchase of baking supplies: sugar, flour, butter, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Groupement Mokpokpo

texts.fr:
5 women founded the grouping of Mokpokpo in 2004. This grouping’s work is the purchase and resale of Kola nuts. With this loan, the grouping would like to put in place means of preservation in order to tackle the decay (of the Kola nuts). These funds will also allow them to increase their area of involvement in order to buy more products for resale.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Le groupement Mokpokpo est fondé en 2004 par 05 femmes. Ce groupement opère dans l’achat et la revente à l’extérieur des colas. Ce groupement désire par ce crédit mettre en place les moyens de conservation en vue de lutter contre la détérioration. Ces fonds leur permettront aussi d’élargir leurs zones d’interventions pour acheter plus de marchandises pour la revente.

loans.use: Installation of their preservation store and growth of their working capital.

loans.name: Subhoniddin.

texts.ru:
Subhoniddin H. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married, has 4 children, is 39 years old and works in agriculture. Subhoniddin plants potatoes and other vegetables and will use his loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. He has been in this business for 5 years, supporting his family and providing local markets with ecologically clean vegetables. He will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанов Субхониддин проживает в районе Рудаки.Женат , имеет 4 детей. Возраст 39лет .Занимается сельским хозяйством. Посадкой картофеля и других овощей. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить семена картофеля и удобрений.Занимается этим бизнесом клиент 5 лет, тем самым обеспечивая свою семью , а также рынки города экологически чистыми овощами.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Sự is 35 years old. Her husband 37. They have 4 school age children and live in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. She’s been with the TYM Fund 5 years now. She takes out loans to finance her livestock and learns how to manage her money from the fund. The result is her family’s fine economy. The monthly income is 170-200USD. She would like to apply for a loan of 525USD to buy young cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Sự năm nay 35 còn chồng chị 37 tuổi. Anh chị có 4 người con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Họ đang sống tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Cho đến nay chị Sự đã tham gia Quỹ được 4 năm. Vốn vay được chị sử dụng chủ yếu cho việc chăn nuôi. Sau khi vào Quỹ không những có thêm vốn làm ăn, chị Sự còn học được cách tiết kiệm, chi tiêu hợp lý. Luôn sử dụng vốn đúng mục đích nên hiệu quả kinh tế mang lại rất tốt. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình chị Sự khoảng 170-200USD. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 525USD để mua bò.

loans.use: Buy young cows

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 36 years old. He has 4 children. He works and lives with his family in Tyre in southern Lebanon. Mahmoud is in the construction business. He wants to buy materiA. to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en: M. Tolibjon is 38 years old, is married and has 4 children. Mr. M. Tolibjon was born in a simple rural family and has worked with the livestock for 20 years. He is very experienced and he has the special skills in livestock care that helps him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock and sells meat and milk. He wants to buy one more milk cow so he applies to KIVA for a loan of $625 for 8 months.

loans.use: to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.name: Yossi

texts.es:
Yossi is a very talented woman whose creativity has led her to start an embroidery business in her small home. She starts work early in the morning each day. Her great and original finished pieces have brought her popularity, which is why there is a high demand for her work. Now she would like to increase her capital in order to fill her customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Yossi, es muy talentosa y su creatividad la ha conducido a implementar un espacio de bordados en su pequeña casita. Diariamente y desde muy tempranas horas se dedica a desarrollar esta actividad y sus grandes e ingeniosos acabados le han dado popularidad, por esa razón ha obtenido una gran demanda y ahora desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para cumplir con cada una de las solicitudes de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Martha Odile

texts.es:
Martha C. is 48 years old, and the single mother of 4 adult children who are now independent of her. Martha has a store in her home where she supplies part of the Casimiro Sotelo neighborhood with products of basic consumption, such as clothing and cosmetics. She has had this business for 7 years and found it very difficult to count on the small amount of capital she makes for investing. Her initial sales were of firewood and soft drinks, but her business has since grown. Martha desires to improve her standard of living with this business. With this loan she will try to invest in basic grains, packaged clothing and cosmetics in order to obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Martha C. tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos que ya son independientes a ella. Martha tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación donde abastece a parte del barrio Casimiro Sotelo de productos de consumo básico, así como también ropa y cosméticos. Tiene 7 años de tener este negocio, en el cual ha encontrado la dificultad de contar con poco capital para poder invertir. Sus ventas iniciales fueron de leña y refrescos, pero ahora su negocio ya ha crecido. Martha desea mejorar su nivel de vida con este negocio. Con el préstamo pretende invertir en granos básicos, paca de ropa y cosméticos para adquirir más ganacias

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, packaged clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Nurhon

texts.en: Nurhon E. was born in 1979 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married, has two children, and works two jobs: she is a part-time school teacher who also makes clothing that is especially prized in her area. Nurhon applied for her first loan from MicroInvest earlier this year and immediately impressed us as a serious and reliable client. She used her loan to successfully improve her clothing-making business by buying dyes needed to make special socks that are popular with her customers because are very warm and part of the national dress. She has made socks for 10 years, and is very experienced and skillful at what she does. Nurhon is now applying for her second loan, which she will use to buy a computerized yarn-making machine. She will repay the loan in four months.

loans.use: To buy a computerized yarn-making machine.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: This is the third time that Mrs. Leng C. N. has taken out a loan to improve her business activity. She sells fruit in the local market, which is located in Ponlai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Since her business is doing well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to meet her customers' demands. Her husband, Mr. Vath Sovvan, assists her with her business. Mrs. Leng C. N. is 48 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending school. Previously, Mrs. Leng C. N. obtained a loan from AMK to start her business. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit

loans.name: Denis Jose

texts.es:
El señor Denis T., tiene 32 años de edad, es acompañado, le tienen dos hijos, con edades de 7 años y 4 años, uno cursa el primer grado de primaria y el otro hijo el tercer nivel de preescolar, su compañera de vida se desempeña como ama de casa, este señor se dedica al comercio de curtiembre o teneria, actividad que va relacionada a la venta y procesamiento de cuero para calzado, mochilas, fajas, para lo cual se le otorgo un credito.
Don Denis T., tiene mas de 16 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual se da como herencia familiar ya que su padre se dededica a este negocio, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio debidamente legalizado, el señor compra a la Teneria Bataan, el cuero y posteriormente  limpia y procesa hasta su comercializacion en el mercado, el credito fue dirigido para la compra de mas cuero, por consiguiente adquirir mayor inventario ya que asi lo demanda su clientela los cuales son dueños de zapaterias del departamente de leon, chinandega, masaya, granada entre otros departamentos donde comercializa.
texts.en:
Mr. Denis T. is 32 years old, has a live-in partner and 2 children, ages 7 and 4. One child is in 1st grade, while the other is in preschool. His life partner is a homemaker, and he is in the tannery industry, a business in which he sells and processes leather for shoes, satchels, and belts, which is why he was given a loan.

Mr. Denis T. has been working in this field, which is a part of his father’s heritage, for over 16 years. His business is located inside his home and he has all the proper licenses. He buys leather from Teneria Bataan (Bataan Tannery), then cleans it and goes through with the tanning process. After that, he sells the leather in the market. The loan will be used to purchase more leather so that he can expand his products according to customer demand. His clientele is comprised of shoe store owners in the departments of Leon, Chinandega, Masaya, and Granada, among other departments where his leather is sold.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Christiner

texts.en:
Christiner F., 26 years old, is from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two children, 2 and 7 years old.  

Christiner owns a business that sells kanga and vitenge, traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women. Kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a piece of cotton fabric with wax print, printed using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

Currently, Christiner needs a loan of US$125 in order to start a new business venture by opening a stand that would sell Coca Cola and other drinks that are popular even in the most remote villages in Africa. The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; therefore, selling them has become a popular business venture. Chistiner thanks everyone for their support.

ABOUT SELFINA: 
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Investment in a new business venture

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mr. Sam S., age 48, is a widower, and lives in Lvengreusey Commune, Siem Reap Province. He is a rice farmer who has three children; one is married, and one daughter, Ms. S. Ny, 20, works together with her father. To earn additional income, Sam would like to ask for a loan to purchase small ducks to raise, and also purchase feed for them. The loan will increase his family income and help to cover his whole family's expenses and provide more stability. (Mr. Sam's daughter is pictured because he was not available at the time.)

loans.use: To purchase small ducks to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To open a shop for selling metal products

loans.name: Praing

texts.en:
Mrs. Praing H. is a villager in Tang Roleang village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectar of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a big obstacle, because her field is far from an irrigation system, which is of course bad for her crops. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to buy a pump machine to water the field.

Her husband, Mr. Souy Kin, is a fisherman. Mrs. Praing H. is 35 years old and the mother of four children. Three are attending the local school, and the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine in order to irrigate the field.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en: Saada S. Nganila  is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. A business woman who buys and sells scrap by the ton as industrial raw material. Her business is licensed. She works in collaboration with her husband. They have two purchasing stations. One that she runs and the other is run by her husband. They buy and sell more than four tons of scrap to industries per month. The business is located at Vingunguti and Matumbi in Dar es Salaam and have been in operation for ten years. Their business is profitable and also helps to keep the environment clean. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,500,000 to increase her monthly purchases and sales.

loans.use: To increase business by buying more scrape

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has owned a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 3 years. She belongs to Wema group loan (Group code 2006). Every day she works at her business. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to increase her current stock. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Ana is married, and has three children: ages 18, 16 and 8.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her current stock

loans.name: Doina

texts.en:
Doina’s main business is agriculture, a field she has worked in for more than six years. Last year Doina inherited six hectares of arable land from her parents, so she decided to work the land, believing this activity to be more profitable than growing cereals. The business is located in Cimislia district, where the demand for agricultural products is quite high even in the current economic crisis.

The married mother of two children, both pupils in the village lyceum, Doina is assisted in her business by the children, but takes very seriously her responsibility to support them and ensure their futures. To that end, she is now requesting a loan to purchase potato, tomato, eggplant, cabbage and onion seeds for sowing.

loans.use: Purchasing of vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Maleha Group

texts.en:
Maleha is the group leader of Maleha group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their business.

Maleha wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. Aynedine wants to take a loan for his business, a general store. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Fazylah wants to take a loan for her husband’s pottery business. He wants to buy materials for pottery.

They want to say this loan is very useful for each one of them because it can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses, become stronger in their businesses and in life. This group wants to thank this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: They want to buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Prisons B Afeku Getrude Group

texts.en: Getrude A. is twenty-five years old and married with two children, one boy and one girl. She has been selling food stuffs like tea and madasi (a flour made from dried peas) for two years. She is using the loan to broaden her business with a purchase of more sugar, tea leaves, wheat flour and peas for making madasi. Her dream is to purchase a motorcycle for a motorcycle-transport business, which will generate more income.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Leonida Auma

texts.en:
Leonida is a 43-year-old single mother of four children, ages 9-21 years. Her first child is already in university. Leonida was married, but her husband's family was upset that she did not give birth to more boys and chased her from her home in Nairobi. She is now suing him.

Leonida now lives in Manyatta slum, but she works in Nyamesaria. She runs two businesses, a beauty salon and a tailoring shop. Her challenges right now are too few customers. Her hopes for the future are to help her children so that in the future they can help her too. She likes running her own business, because when she makes a profit, it's hers and hers alone. She thinks women make better entrepreneurs because men often use the profits for drinking and being idle, a common refrain amongst many of the K-MET borrowers.

In this video, you can hear me (Kiva Fellow) greet Leonida saying "Idhi Nade," which is Luo for "How are you?" Leonida responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as President Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo, saying "Asante sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you," and "Erokamano," which, in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are those of people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

loans.use: materials for tailoring, chemicals for her salon, hair extensions

loans.name: Laja

texts.en:
Laja Slender is currently in the business of selling maize flour and is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour to sell. Laja is 29 years old and married; her husband is a nurse. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more flour to sell

loans.name: Gina Helen

texts.en: Gina Helen E. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 41 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Gina Helen owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Gina Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Gina Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Poderosas Group
