texts.es: El grupo “Poderosas” esta representado por la señora Ana y conformado por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales se encuentra un parentesco familiar entre la señora Ana y el señor Alberto que es su sobrino, ambos poseen ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no representa un riego para el grupo. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. productos como la comida, zapatos, ropa, cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y al servicio D. soldadura. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá generar un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Poderosas" is represented by Mrs. Ana, and comprised of 12 members including Ana's nephew Alberto. Ana and Albert, like the other group members, have small businesses with individuals incomes. The majority of the group members have businesses that incluD. cosmetic sales, food sales, groceries, shoes and clothing sales, and a soldering service. The business competition in the commercial atmosphere is quite high, but the dedication and drive to work help these women exceed the competition. The final destination of this financing is for the acquisition of merchandise for the new season, and to improve and expand their sales stands. This will allow them to proviD. their families with a higher standard of living. In general, all of the group members have experience, thanks to previous financing from similar organizations like Agrocapital Foundation, who know about the responsibility and compromise required to receive economic support for businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Ada

texts.en: Ada is 35 years old and has one child. She has a store where she sells provisions, cosmetics and drinks. She has been in the business for the past seven years and she is very happy with the growth of her business. Ada is very hardworking even if she is limited to small capital, and she is very optimistic about her business and the prosperity of her family. She lives in Lagos State. She hopes for the loan amount of $650 USD to purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, cosmetics and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Oeurn Mak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of thirteen people who are located in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province. Mrs. Oeurn M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.

Mrs. Oeurn M. raises pigs. She also owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. For this plantation, she needs a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

Mrs. Oeurn M. is 49 years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband, Mr. South Chorn, is a policeman.

Mrs. Nget P. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Vending of dishwashing liquid and detergent soap is the business of Concepcion T.. She is 44 years old and married to Pepito T.. The couple is blessed with three children namely: Carla Joy, 23 years old and a college graduate; Jayson-21 years old and also a college graduate; the youngest is Jaypee who is only 19 years old. 

	

Concepcion’s business is improving but she still needs to continue what she has started to sustain the needs of her family. In connection to that, she would like to request a loan amounting PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders. She would be glad if her loan request will be granted. According to Concepcion, sacrifice is necessary for her business to prosper.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette M. is a widow, 46 years old. She has one child, 20 years old.

Antoinette has been in the business of public secretariat for five years working eleven hours a day by employing two people.

Antoinette is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more equipment and repairing some of the damaged ones.

Through accessing this new loan, Antoinette hopes to earn more profit than before and, through that profit, she plans to send her child to university.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more equipment and repairing others

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 42 años, está casado y tiene 8 hijos; de los cuales, uno de ellos aun vive con él y su esposa. Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la siembra de frutas cítricas como la naranja, el tanhielo y tanyarina. Estos productos le han resultado ser muy rentables, sobre todo en los tiempos de verano cuando son muy demandados en la ciudad capital, Lima. Para ello prepara en cada viaje de 40 a 50 cajones y los vende desde 12 a 15 soles cada uno, así acumula muy buenas ganancias. Es por ello que para estos meses trata de tener bien cuidadas sus plantas cítricas, puesto que gracias a ellas pudo educar a sus numerosos hijos sin que les falte nada. Jorge se siente muy orgulloso de proveer sus mejores cítricos para la capital y ahora está planeando para el próximo año renovar sus plantas para que de ese modo sus cosechas no mengüen.
Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y a medida de sus préstamos consecutivos ha venido creciendo poco a poco con sus cultivos y eso le hace muy feliz. Con el dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de 1500 plantitas de cítricos, en aras de renovar dichos cultivos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 42, is married and has eight children. Only one child still lives with him and his wife. Since he was very little he has been planting citrus fruits like oranges, tangelos, and tangerines. These products are very profitable for him, especially in summer time when they are in great demand in the capital city of Lima. Therefore, for each trip he prepares 40 or 50 boxes to sell. He sells them for 12 to 15 soles per box. That is how he gets very good earnings. Thanks to that, he was able to educate all of his many children; they lacked nothing. Jorge feels very proud to provide the capital city with his best citrus fruit. He is now planning to revitalize his plants for next year so that his harvest does not diminish. This is his third loan with MFP. Through his consecutive loans his crops have been growing little by little. This makes him very happy. With the money he is now asking for he will buy 1,500 citrus plans in order to revitalize his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy citrus fruit plants

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly M. is 34 years old and is married with three children aged between 3 and 9 years. She lives in Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Nelly has had a dispensary since 2007. She operates 24 hours every day, serving her community’s health needs and emergencies. She employs three nurses in her dispensary.

Nelly is now requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva for the purpose of renewing and updating some rooms of her dispensary. This, in turn, will make her dispensary more effective and modern as well as more attractive. By this method, she hopes that her dispensary will grow through adding some other new medical services and serving additional clients as well.

loans.use: To renew and update her dispensary rooms

loans.name: Mainka

texts.en:
Mainka is 22 years old and married with a two-year-old son. He has a shop in Kitengela, a small town near Nairobi. He sells unga (flour), milk, fat, and oil. He has had his business for three years and employs two people. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to expand and restock his shop.

He describes himself as hardworking, innovative, and self-driven. He hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the future and have a full supermarket.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Jenny Katerine

texts.es: "La Sra. Jenny, tiene como actividad  la venta de Cds los cuales comercializa en el puesto de su suegra en la Av. Buenos Aires y Stadium, es cliente puntual actualmente esta es su segunda operación bajo este programa. La unidad económica familiar esta compuesta por su esposo, su hijo recién nacido y ella, es una pareja joven el esposo trabaja como empleado asalariado quien también ayuda con la manutención del hogar.La cliente fue recomendada por su suegra ya que la misma es cliente de nuestra institución."
texts.en:
Jenny sells CDs at her mother-in-law's stall located on the streets Av. Buenos Aires and Stadium. She is a punctual client and this is her second operation using this lending program. Jenny's family unit is composed of her, her husband and newborn son. They are a young couple and her husband works as a salaried employee who also helps with the maintenance of the household. Jenny was recommended for this program by her mother-in-law who is also part of this loan institution.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital for business operations (purchase of merchandise)

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
Ceferina, de 44 años, es una mujer muy sincera y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos: Nely de 23, Abel de 21 y Nelly de 9 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Su tienda de abarrotes está ubicada en el barrio La Capilla (barrio importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), su tienda es una de las más surtidas del lugar, motivo por el cual es muy concurrida. Ceferina se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes, ya que sus principales compradores son los vecinos de la zona y ellos entran muy temprano a trabajar.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace por las mañanas cuando abre. 
Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Ceferina con MFP y está muy feliz de haberlo obtenido, sabe que tiene que invertir el dinero en su negocio para que sea más productivo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa. Con los dos mil soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Ceferina, 44, is a sincere, cheerful woman. She lives in her own house with her three children: Nely, 23, Abel 21, and Nelly 9, who are the motivating force in her life. Her grocery store is in the La Capilla neighborhood (an important neighborhood in the city of Juliaca). Her store is one of the better stocked stores in the area so it is very busy. Ceferina rises very early to tend to her customers since her main customers are residents of the area and they all start their work days very early. What she likes most about her work is chatting with her customers and learning about the goings-on in her neighborhood. She has been in this line of work for 15 years and feels that the hardest part of the job is withstanding the intense cold common in the mornings when she opens up for business. For later in the future, she would like to enlarge her store so that she can offer better customer service. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very happy to have gotten it. She knows that she must invest the money in her business so that it will be more productive. She is a very active member of her communal bank. The two-thousand soles requested will be used to buy items to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items.

loans.name: Romulo C. S

texts.en:
Romulo C. S M. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 50 years old. Romulo C. S is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Romulo C. S plants, harvests and sells rice. Romulo C. S has been engaged in his business for over twelve years and earns approximately $67 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Romulo C. S joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Romulo C. S has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Romulo C. S is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 5th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mary Kim

texts.en:
Mary Kim D. P. is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 24 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Mary Kim owns and operates a business raising fish for sale (she has a fishpond). She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mary Kim joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mary Kim is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Nelanie

texts.en:
Nelanie M. is from Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Nelanie owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp in the local community.  Nelanie has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nelanie joined ASKI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Nelanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI to purchase products to sell.  Nelanie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering.  This loan will be her second from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 
-------------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase new items to sell.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mr. Tha R., age 52, and his wife, Mrs. Phan Khorn, age 48, have been married for 30 years and have 8 children, four sons and four daughters. Four of them have full-time employment and other four are in school. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Tha was not in the photo, but his wife was available instead.

Tha has been a construction worker for 20 years. He sometimes works in his village and sometimes in a nearby village. Because Tha’s children commute to work far away, they take a motor taxi very often. Taking a motor taxi a work is expensive for the family. Therefore, Tha is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.name: Azucena Gioconda

texts.es:
La señora Azucena, se dedica al ramo de la belleza y venta de ropa, calzados y otros, todos los días abre su negocio desde tempranas horas de la mañana para recibir a su clientela, su tramo esta ubicado en el mercado la terminal.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de cosméticos, productos de belleza, ropa, calzados y otros.
texts.en:
Azucena sells beauty products and she also sells clothing, shoes and other items every day. She opens for business very early in the morning to start receiving her customers; her stand is in the La Terminal market. She will use the loan to buy cosmetics, beauty products, clothing, shoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, beauty products, clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es: Oscar Manuel tiene 41 años, su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos naturales. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. El dio inicio porque no tenía un trabajo estable para mantener a sus 2 hijos que son lo más importante para él. Ya que el vende sus productos de manera ambulante por lo que recorre muchos lugares para ofrecer sus productos los que más demandan sus clientes son los refrescos de naranja y mandarina, pues estas fuertes temperaturas hacen que los refrescos naturales hidrate nuestro cuerpo, pues Oscar es muy trabajador. Es por esto que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de frutas como naranjas, mandarinas, melones, mango y piña. Su deseo es que sus hijos tenga una educación digna y que no les falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Oscar is 41 years old and sells natural refreshments (drinks). He’s been doing this for more than 20 years. He started this business because he did not have steady employment with which he could support his two children, who are very important to him. He sells his products on foot and walks through many areas offering his merchandise. The most popular flavors are orange and mandarin orange. These natural refreshments hydrate our body in these harsh temperatures. Oscar is a very hard worker. He is asking for this loan so that he can buy fresh fruit, such as oranges, mandarin oranges, cantaloupes, mangos and pineapples. He wants his children to receive a sound education and that they are never in need of their daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Arlen Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Arlen D. Sánchez, es casada tiene dos hijos menores de edad vive detrás de Camanica, ella trabaja atendiendo un Bar de Una Escuela Ubicada en su misma comarca.

La señora Arlen solicito el crédito para asegurar mejor su casa ya que sus paredes son de zinc, y lo tiene bien deteriorado para asegurarle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, lleva dos años trabajando con Ceprodel y ha demostrado ser muy responsable y una mujer muy emprendedora.
texts.en:
Arlen D. Sánchez is married and has two dependent children. She lives outside of Camanica and works at a snack bar in a school located in the same area. Arlen is requesting this loan in order to improve her home, which has walls made of zinc sheets and has deteriorated greatly. She wants to renovate it in order to provide better living conditions for her children. She has been a client of Ceprodel for two years, and she has shown herself to be a very enterprising and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying zinc, nails and wood

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria Pérez vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz. Con sus dos hijas.
La señora Hilaria tiene un puesto de venta de abarrotes en el mercado de su zona, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una cocina, para la instalación de gas domiciliario y el alcantarillado de su vivienda.
Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Hilaria Pérez lives with her two daughters in her own home in the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz. She has a stall where she sells groceries in the market in her neighborhood. She supports her family with the earnings from her stall. The loan she is requesting is for the construction of a kitchen, for the installation of a gas line and sewer system for her home. This is the fourth time she has requested a loan. A socioeconomic analysis that was completed scored her favorably, and she can receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of construction a kitchen, a gasline and sewer system for her home.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, 56, is a rice farmer in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She also owns a sari-sari store as additional income for her family. She is a mother of 3 children, her eldest is 17 years old. She started her business in 2008. She's now requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for 15,000 PHP. This will enable her to buy farm supplies and groceries for her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and farm supplies.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es: Flor de María A. G. de 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 7, 11, y 15 años de edad, con los cuales reside en el pequeño pueblo de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Desde hace 7 años que Flor trabaja en su propio puesto en el cual vende productos los cuales son muy necesarios en el hogar, tales como: papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, shampoo, pasta de dientes, y así mismo productos comestibles como: sopas instantáneas, sardinas, salsas, aceite y otros más. El puesto esta ubicado en el mercado Sagrado Corazón, en la zona del centro de San Salvador, lugar al cual la mayoría de personas comprar por mayor los productos para abastecer negocios más pequeños como tiendas entre otros. La posición de su negocio es muy buena así mismo la amabilidad de Flor le ha permitido contar con muchos clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, todo por mayor para surtir a sus clientes con todo lo necesario, de esta manera Flor espera mejorar sus ventas y sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que ella es la única que vela por el bienestar de ellos.
texts.en:
Flor de María A. G. is 32 years old, and lives together with her 3 children of 7, 11 and 15 years old. They live in the small village of San Martín, located in the San Salvador department. For 7 years Flor has had her own stand where she sells necessary household goods, such as toilet paper, sanitary towels, shampoo, toothpaste, and comestibles such as instant soups, sardines, sauces, oil among other things. Her stand is located in the Sagrado Corazón market, in the central zone of San Salvador, a location where the majority of people purchase most of their products to then stock smaller shops. The business is in a very good position, and Flor's amiability means she has many customers. She is seeking a loan to purchase a greater quantity of products, mainly to provide her customers with everything they need. In this way Flor hopes to improve her sales and improve her childrens' situation, as she is the only one who looks after their well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase household goods

loans.name: Mayela Del Socorro

texts.es: Mayela Del Socorro tiene 45 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos. La señora tiene en su casa el negocio de venta de carnes variadas, principalmente carne de pollo y res. Ella ya tiene 2 años y medio de tener este negocio, cabe señalarse este negocio ella lo empezó en una época en que estaba desempleada, actualmente ella tiene trabajo sin embargo ha luchado para mantenerlo pues ha brindado muchas ganancias a la familia. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de invertir en la compra de carnes principalmente de pollo, ya que se acerca la fecha del 30 de mayo celebración para el di de la Madre, que son épocas buenas de ventas y es lo que desea aprovechar. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener un supermercado grande, en la cual no solo venda carnes sino de todo tipo de artículos, a buenos precios para ayudar a las personas.
texts.en:
Mayela Del Socorro is 45 years old, single, and doesn't have children. She runs a business out of her house, where she sells meat, especially chicken and beef. She has already had this business for two and a half years. It should be noted that she started this business during a time when she was unemployed. Now she has work, though she has struggled to maintain it, and it has brought many gains to her family. She hopes to invest this loan in the purchase of meat, especially chicken. The May 30th Mother's Day celebration is soon and it is a very good time for sales, so she would like to take advantage of that. Her dream has always been to eventually have a large supermarket where she would sell not only meat but all types of items, and at good prices to help other people.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat (especially chicken) to sell

loans.name: Las Kiwis Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA LOS KIWIS ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE JALOXTOC, MORELOS, MEXICO, EL GRUPO ESTA FORMADO POR 5 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN Y SON VECINOS Y SOLICITAN SU PRIMER PRESTAMO EN FUNDACION REALIDAD, LA SRA. ZENAIDA  TIENE UN PUESTO DE DULCES, LA SRA. ELIZABETH VA INICIAR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE ZAPATOS, LA SRA. MARGARITA VENTA DE ZAPATOS, LA SRA. SARA A LA VENTA DE ROPA Y LA SEÑORA MARLEN DEPOSITO DE REFRESCOS

LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO ES LA SRA. SARA  J. V. TIENE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 2º. AÑO DE PRIMARIA, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA PARA DAMA, ESTA SOLICITANDO SU PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCANCIA COMO SON PANTALON DE MEZCLILLA, BLUSAS Y PLAYERAS,   TIENE 6 AÑOS EN EL NEGOCIO  Y CON EL CREDITO  PIENSA  AMPLIARLO, TENER VARIEDAD DE ROPA PARA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES Y ASI SUS GANACIAS SE INCREMENTEN

LA SRA SARA ESTA MUY CONTENTA Y AGRADECE A LOS PRESTATARIOS DE  KIVA LA CONFIANZA QUE DEPOSITAN EN ELLA Y EN SU GRUPO.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called The Kiwis and is located in Jaloxtoc, Morelos, Mexico. It has 5 members who know each other and are neighbors. They are asking Fundación Realidad for their first loan. Zenaida has a candy stand, Elizabeth is going to start to sell shoes, Margarita sells shoes, Sara sells clothing and Marlen has a soft-drink depository. The group representative is Sara J. V., 45. She finished 2nd grade and she sells women’s clothing. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as denim trousers, blouses and t-shirts. She has been in business for 6 years and plans to use the funds to expand it by having more stock available for her customers thereby increasing profits. Sara is very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the trust they place in her and her group.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy denim trousers and ladies' blouses.

loans.name: Ma. Lily

texts.en: Ma. Lily P. is from the village of Pangalalan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 56 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ma. Lily operates a business buying and selling paper or junk materials. Ma. Lily has been engaged in her business for 17 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Ma. Lily joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Lily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase junk materials to sell. Ma. Lily is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Ma. Lily from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy and sell junk or used materials

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 45-year-old married man living in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and four children. Ali is a specialized table carpenter, which he believes is an art in itself. Ali is recommended for his high quality of work as a carpenter and designer by many furniture showrooms. This is Ali’s fourth cycle with Al Majmoua with a good repayment record.

Ali has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy extra wood to increase his designs and income. At the same time, Ali believes that he has to stay up-to-date with global designs to capture new customers and maintain his level or advance to a better one. He hopes to be known all over Lebanon and improve his machines in the future.

loans.use: To buy extra wood

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom C. and her husband, Mr. Kimseng Chour, have been married since 1986 and have nine children--two sons and seven daughters. Six of them are married and live outside the family home and other three are in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sarom is a silk weaver. She is older but she is still strong enough to work. She is asking for a loan of US$ 200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: God First Group

texts.en:
Albertha W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God First. She is 29 years old, married and has three children who range in age from eight months to twelve years. She also cares for two siblings. Albertha was only able to attend school through ninth grade due to a lack of financial support. She describes herself as a determined woman.

For six years she has been selling fish in Thinkers’ Village outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 14,000 LRD portion of this 70,000 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of fish. Her goals are to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Chanthavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthavy T., pictured here with her husband, Mr. Vichet Meas, lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1992 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. 

Mrs. Chanthavy Teo and her husband are farmers of jasmine flowers. They also buy some jasmine flowers from their fellow villagers for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. 

Chanthavy has asked for a Kiva loan one time previously. She is now requesting another loan of $300 to pay school fees for her children. She hopes they all will have a good job when they finish their studies.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 48 años de edad, está divorciada y  tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en el poblado de Triboline, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Lidia se caracteriza por ser una persona humilde y carismática; actualmente está dedicado al rubro agrícola, específicamente a la producción y comercialización de cacao y café, donde ya viene laborando desde hace 20 años. Recuerda que sus primeras ventas no lo fue tan bien, ya que había días en donde solo le alcanzaba para el sustento familiar. Pero la perseverancia hizo que continuara en esta actividad. Hoy es una de las mejores agriculturas de su valle, debido a que produce productos de alta calidad, además le brinda buenos ingresos económicos. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, sin embargo cuando es temporada de cosecha, tiene que contratar mano de obra para que le ayuden a extraer su producto final. Ella anhela en un futuro cercano adquirir más terrenos de cultivo con la necesidad de que pueda ampliar su producción y a la vez mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está contenta con su banco comunal, debido a la responsabilidad y compromiso que tienen cada unos de los socios con dicha institución. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en los gastos educativos de sus cuatros hijos.
texts.en: Lidia is 48 years old, divorced, and has four school-aged children.  They live in the town of Triboline, located in the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own wooden house.  Lidia is known as a humble and charismatic person, and currently works in agriculture.  She specializes in the production and sale of cocoa and coffee, and she has been doing this work for 20 years.  She recalls that her first sales did not go very well, and there were days when she only made enough money to pay for her family’s basic needs.  However, her perseverance made her continue in her work.  Today she is one of the best farmers in her valley, due to the high quality of her produce, and her work provides her with high earnings.  She normally works on her own, but sometimes her children help her, and during harvest time she has to hire people to help gather the crops.  In the future, she desires to buy more land in order to increase her crop production and improve her family’s quality of life.  This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is dedicated to repay it on time.  She is happy with her community bank because of the responsibility and commitment that each member shows.  She will invest the loan in educational expenses of her four children.

loans.use: Education expenses for her four children

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine D. V. is from the city of Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 20 years old. Josephine is single. To make a living, Josephine raises livestock. Her main source of income comes from raising pigs to sell. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be invested in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 1 child, who is not currently in school. Prossy has a business of a salon, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Prossy hopes to own a cosmetics shop.

Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning to be responsible.

loans.use: To buy braids.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PACHA ILLAIRY ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Paulino;   él tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos,  El socio es natural de Ocongate,  Él socio trabajaba como  obrero en la carretera interoceánica,  y también es  gasfitero y realiza todo tipo de trabajos el socio es muy trabajador y solo tiene primaria completa, el desde muy joven se dedico a ayudar a sus padres para poder educar y alimentar a sus hermanos, el socio ahora solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas y también quiere comprar un terrenito para poder construir su casa. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas de construcción y ahorrar para comprar su terreno.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Paulino, 33, is a member of the “PACHA ILLAIRY” communal bank located in Ocongate district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

He has a live-in partner and three children.  He is from Ocongate and works as a laborer on the Interoceanic Highway.  He is also a plumber and does all kinds of jobs; he is very hard working.  He only finished elementary school.  Since a very young age he helped his parents in order to feed and educate his younger siblings.  

He is asking for a loan to buy tools.  He also wants to buy a small piece of land to build his house.  He is asking for the loan to buy construction tools and to save up to buy his lot.

He is grateful for and values the loan granted and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy construction tools and to save up to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia J. is a 65-year old widow who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a coffee shop business. She lives in Common, Brgy. Daan Banwa, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and coffee shop businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP8,000. 

Lucia is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she could purchase more stocks to sell.  This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lucia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 27 years old married man father of two children from Bint Jbeil. Hassan has worked as a blacksmith since 2001, He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy the necessary machines for his business. Hassan has been dealing  with Al Majmoua since 2006 and is a client in good standing. Hassan is working hard on teaching his children and providing a healthy and secure living situation in addition to providing a joyful life to his family. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy the necessary machines for his business

loans.name: Sweetie Pie

texts.en:
Sweetie Pie L. is from the village of Magsaysay. She is 42 years old. Sweetie Pie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Sweetie Pie owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Sweetie Pie has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sweetie Pie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sweetie Pie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sweetie Pie is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Sweetie Pie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcia; ella tiene 36 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de medicinas (botica) multiservicios ya que también ahí vende celulares, regalitos para cumpleaños entre otros esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento y espera tal vez más adelante abrir otra botica para así poder brindarles una mejor calidad vida a sus hijos.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implemnetacion de su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: The member belongs to the Chikon community bank; this bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs Marcia; she is 36, lives with her partner, and has 3 children. She sells multi-drug medicines (she has a pharmacy) and also sells cell phones and small birthday gifts, among other items. This is her only job at the moment and she hopes to later open another pharmacy in order to offer her children a better quality of life. She is requesting this loan to stock her business. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: the member is requesting this loan for her business

loans.name: Esther Wanjiru

texts.en:
Esther  Wanjiru is 37 years old.  She is married to Joseph Muhia, who also works to contribute to the family's income.  She has three children – aged 16, 14, and 12. She has been selling cereals for a period of six years, earning an income of 10,000 KES per month. 

Esther has a very good history with KADET.   She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones well and in good time. She hopes to be a leading cereals businesswoman and become a supplier, and to give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and groundnuts.

loans.name: Salvina

texts.es:
Salvina tiene 32 años de edad, reside junto a su familia en el Caserío Tejedores del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se ubica en la Región de Piura que esta a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Salvina cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa que ha sido instalada en su domicilio. Ella ofrece productos de calidad a los pobladores y negociantes que llegan a la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella contribuye con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Ella desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio ofreciendo variedad de diseños a su clientela, quienes la prefieren por el trato amable que reciben. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una  mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Salvina is 32 years old, and lives with her family in the village of Tejedores in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone located in the region of Piura which is 4 hours from the cit of Chiclayo.

Salvina has a small business in her home selling clothing. She offers quality products to the residents and business people that come to the area.  With the income that she receives from this activity, she helps to sustain her family economically.

She wants to acquire more products to grow her business, offering a variety of designs to her clientele, who prefer her for the friendly treatment that they get.  For that reason she has thought it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 500 nuevo soles to help her achieve her objective.

She is a very hardworking woman and puts forth the effort every day to get ahead and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise and grow her business

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 46 year-old Kadiatu B.. She is married to a sick husband. She has three additional dependents who live with her to help with house work. Kadiatu owns a plastic wares business, which she began because she wanted to be self-reliant. She operates her business six days a week and ten hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,800,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to open a bigger store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils.

loans.name: Martha Carolina

texts.es: Martha Carolina tiene 45 años, es madre soltera con dos hijos y solamente 1 está a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, Inició este negocio porque sus ingresos eran pocos y necesitaba sacar adelante a su familia así fue que decidió destinar para empezar este negocio y así tener un ingreso. Martha solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y variados productos. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá mantener su negocio surtido e incrementar sus ventas y así llevar el sustento a su hogar. Su Deseo es mantener el negocio activo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Martha Carolina is 45 years old and is a single mother of two children, one of which is in her care.  She works selling cosmetics.  She started this business because she didn't earn much money and she needed to help her family succeed, so she decided to start the business and have an income.  

Martha is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise and various products.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to maintain a well-stocked business and increase her sales, and be able to support her family.  Her dream is to keep her business active so that she can succeed.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, all of whom are in school.  Irene has a business selling maize and wheat flour. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Irene   sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale. Irene has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bags of wheat and maize flour. The main business challenge(s) for Irene include drought, which hit most parts of Uganda, and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van. Irene lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert R. O. is forty years old and married. His wife stays at home to take care of the household chores, and they have four children aged between fifteen years old and ten years old to whom they hope to give good education to the university level. 

His business is located at Bukura Shopping Centre in Kakamega. Kakamega is in the western region of Kenya. It is a rich agricultural area known for production of sugarcane and commonly known as the sugar belt region. He sells mattresses, utensils, blankets and other items to the local people. He has been in business for six years now and has managed to give employment to one person. Herbert says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 to add more mattresses for sale. He hopes to grow his business and in the future make sales of over kes 50,000. He describes himself as focussed and intelligent.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses for resale

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Libertad, está conformado por la señora Ana Bertha  va a comprar con su crédito lencería, la señora Alma Rosa va a comprar cosméticos, la señora Rosa María va a comprar aceite, jabón, azúcar, refrescos, la señora Mayra Nayeli va a comprar zapatos y catálogos de temporada, la señora Aleida va a comprar dulces. La señora Ana Bertha tiene 40 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de la secundaria, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos Karina de 11 años de edad estudia el 6º. Año de primaria, Ángel Felipe tiene 4 años de edad está en la guardería y Kimberli de 5 meses de edad, ella tiene su negocio de comida, jugos y licuados, ella ofrece a sus clientes tacos de suadero, tacos de arroz, tortas, jugos, licuados, yogurt, cóctel de frutas, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años por necesidad por querer ayudar a la familia y progresar, con los créditos que le dieron fue comprando los utensilios y todo lo necesario para la cocina, ella trabajaba en un negocio de comida y ahí aprendió a preparar los alimentos y ahora ya tiene su propio negocio, a ella le gusta preparar los alimentos con mucho amor ya que este negocio le ha ayudado mucho económicamente en los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, sus planes y esperanzas son sacar adelante a sus hijos que estudien para que sean personas de bien y con una carrera y un buen trabajo. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias por ayudarnos en nuestros negocios y que no nos cobren mucho interés”.
texts.en: This group is named Liberty, and it is made up of Mrs. Ana Bertha, who will use her loan to purchase underwear, Mrs. Alma Rosa, who will buy cosmetics, Mrs. Rosa Maria, who will buy oil, soap, sugar, and beverages, Mrs. Mayra Nayeli, who will buy shoes and products from seasonal catalogues, and Mrs. Aleida, who will buy candies. Mrs. Ana Bertha is 40 years old, and she completed her third year of high school. She is married and has three children: Karina an 11-year old 6th grade student, Angel Felipe a 4-year old who is in daycare, and 5-month old Kimberli. She runs a food stand selling meals, juices, and shakes. She sells beef tacos, rice tacos, tortas (sandwiches), juices, shakes, yogurt, and fruit cocktails. She began her business three years ago to help support her family and improve her life. With the loans she has received she has purchased cookery and utensils. She previously worked in a restaurant and that is where she learned to cook, and now she has her own business. She likes to make her food with a lot of love because her business has been a great help in covering school fees for her children. Her hope and plan is to help her children study and become good people with careers and good jobs. The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and the Reality Foundation (Fundación Realidad), "Thank you for helping our businesses and charging us a low interest rate."

loans.use: compra de carnes, verduras y frutas para surtir su negocio

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen  V. García, vive el barrio de san francisco, de Copainala Chiapas, ella es cada  con el seños Adán López Hernández, y con quien procreo  cinco  hijos  quienes cuatro  ya están casados y una está a su responsabilidad, Jorge Amín,  Soraida, Irma, Jesús Antonio,  y la más pequeña es Laura patricia de  diesi nueva años  quien trabaja como instructora de conafe.

     Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos de granja  para liego venderlo  aliñado en el misma  barrio, es esta actividad comenta que le va bien ya que le ha estado dejando buenos ingresos que le han hecho comprar más pollos para que  no esté limitada y le ofrezca un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

     Su motivo a este trabajo es para tener su propio dinero y solicito el préstamo para apoyarse con sus gastos que realiza en la compra de los pollos por reja.

     Su más grande deseo es que Dios le siga prestando vida, para seguir trabajando para ahorrar y así apoyar a su última hija que desea seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Mrs. María del Carmen V. García lives in the San Francisco neighborhood of Copainalá, Chiapas.  She’s married to Mr. Adán López Hernández with whom she had five children four of whom are married and one is still in her care: Jorge Amín, Soraida, Irma, Jesús Antonio and the youngest, Laura Patricia, 19, who works as a Conafe instructor.

She buys free range chickens that she then butchers and sells in her neighborhood.  She comments that she does well with this activity since it’s been producing good income that has made it possible to buy more chickens so that her supply isn’t limited and she can offer better customer service.

The reason behind this work is to have her own money and she asked for the loan to cover expenses incurred in buying crates of chickens.

Her greatest wish is that God will continue providing her with life so that she can continue to work to save up and support her youngest daughter who wants to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy crates of chickens to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a married woman with two boys, one is attending school while the other is still too young.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and clothing. 

For the past 2 years, Carolyne has been operating a business selling cookies from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality and competition from other sellers in the area. Carolyne dreams of establishing a tailoring business in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 15,000, Carolyne wants to open a tailoring shop.  She needs to purchase cloth materials for this new business. 

Carolyne decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to start a tailoring shop

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with 7 children, 3 have graduated from school while 4 still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mwanamisi has been operating a poultry business, selling her products from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a fresh water selling business, which contributes as her other source of income.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a big supplier of poultry products and also wants to incorporates other products like fish in the future.

With this loan for 20,000 Kshs, Mwanamisi wants to purchase a water pump for her water distribution business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy a water pump

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es:
Juana, vive con sus hijas y su esposo en casa familiar, ella vende meriendas desde hace 5 años, con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos atiende el negocio todos los días.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para la preparación de la venta, utilizando el fondo en aceite, condimentos, carnes, materiales plásticos, bebidas, esta inversión será la fortaleza para el negocio, ya que incrementara la producción.
Su objetivo es continuar en el negocio, dándole un buen mantenimiento, ofreciendo a los clientes mayor variedad de alimentos, con el fin de mejorar los ingresos y ganancias del hogar.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her children and her husband in the family home. She has been selling snacks for five years. With the help of her husband and her children, she attends to the business every day.

She is applying for a loan to buy ingredients for the preparation of the food she sells. Together with her stock of oil, condiments, meats, plastic goods, and drinks, this investment will be the strength of the business, since it will increase her production.

Her goal is to continue the business, maintaining it well, and offering her customers a greater variety of food, with the goal of improving her income and the household earnings.

loans.use: to buy oil, condiments, meats, plastic goods, and drinks.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Elna has a retail shop that sells biscuits, breads & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & breads to resell.

Elna is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & breads

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, 50, is a married father of three children who lives with his family in Qana. For 20 years, he has worked raising bees, a business he took from his father, and most of his clients are loyal as they dealt with his father and now come to him for the good quality of honey they serve.

Mohamad provides his customers with summer honey, which he considers the best, unlike others who serve spring honey. He is an expert in his domain and a man with a good reputation. He seeks perfection in his business, which is why he's requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools and medicines for his business. Mohamad also plans to help his son to continue building his house as much as he can.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and medicines for his business.

loans.name: Pedro Dimas

texts.es:
Pedro, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 2 y 5 años de edad, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 10 años de trabajar, aprendió el proceso de la agricultura por su padre, todos los días atiende las labores de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente Pedro se encuentra sembrando la milpa y también frijoles, para ellos solicita un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, dicho préstamo le ayudara a tener los insumos necesarios para tratar el cultivo, garantizándose la buena cosecha a través del buen cuido.
Para él ayudar a sus dos hijos es el objetivo que persigue cada día de trabajo, proveyendo para ellos lo necesario en alimentación, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Pedro lives with his wife and their two children, ages 2 and 5.  He grows corn and beans.  He has been working for ten years, and he learned the agricultural process from his father.  He attends to his work every day from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.

Pedro is currently planting corn and beans.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for those crops.  The loan will help him have the necessary supplies to treat his crops.  This will guarantee a good harvest from the good care of the crops.

Helping his two children is the objective he pursues every work day.  He works to provide them with what they need in food, health, and education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his bean and corn crops.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30, and together with his wife Monica, they are blessed with a child.  Joseph owns a butcher shop where he slaughters bulls for sale.  He has been in this business for the last six years and earns an income of KES.15,000 per month.

Joseph is applying for his second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, and he plans to buy bulls for slaughter and sale.  He will use the anticipated profits to invest in his business and help give his child access to education.  Joseph hopes to have fresh meat everyday, and a wonderful family free from poverty.

loans.use: To buy bulls for slaughter and sale.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La señora  Celia es cliente  nueva D. la institución, será la primera secuencia D. su crédito, la  cliente  es viuda y vive en la zona el tejar La Sra. Celia se dedica a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, ella confecciona uniformes para médicos  tiene clientes en clínicas, hospitales, el crédito lo destinara en  la compra D.  telas por mayor ya que le hicieron un pedido granD. para confeccionar uniformes para la carrera D. medicina  D. una universidad, es una persona muy trabajadora, con ganas D. seguir adelante y  hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Celia is a client of the new institution and this will be her first loan cycle. She is a widow and she lives in the region of El Teja. Celia makes articles of clothing, especially medical uniforms for her clients in clinics and hospitals. The loan will be used to purchase fabrics in wholesale to respond to a large order that has been placed. She will produce medical uniforms for the medical school in a university. She is a very hardworking person who is eager to move forward and to make her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics in wholesale.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 15 years old.

Anabelle is engaged in farming. She plants rice and corn crops on her land. Anabelle earns enough to buy her family's basic needs. She said it is hard to sustain her children's education, especially now that tuition fees get higher every year.

Anabelle is requesting a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and one liter of insecticide. She hopes to earn better and be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and one liter of insecticide.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married 47-year-old woman. She has four children, two are married, one in college, and one employed.

She has been working as a retailer of charcoal for one year while her husband is a farmer. With her charcoal sales business she is able to provide for the financial and daily needs of her family. Cecilia would like to increase her income because of the expenses of her child who is a college student. In this matter, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P8,000 to be used to buy additional charcoal due to the many orders of her buyers. She is glad because she doesn't have any difficulties in selling her products due to the many consumers of charcoal. Now, there are so many consumers of charcoal because of the high price of shellane (a fuel that can be used for cooking, heating water, and refrigeration). That's why some of her neighbors and people from other villages prefer to use charcoal for cooking their food. She hopes that she could increase her profit through the continued support of financial assistance to her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married. She lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines with her five children and husband. 

Teresita owns and operates a specialized retail store at home to earn a living. She sells canned goods, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, bath and laundry soap, school supplies, candles, etc. She has been running the store for over five years. Each month, Teresita is able to generate an approximate total income of PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional goods to sell. 

In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC. She took out several loans from the cooperative and expects to take more in the future and maximize the use of it for business expansion and development.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Mauro Adolfo

texts.es:
Mauro tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo, viven juntos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Morropón, una zona agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra situada en el departamento de Piura.

Se gana la vida brindando servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior, la actividad que realiza lo hace durante la mañana y tarde, a pesar de la competencia trata de obtener los ingresos necesarios para solventar su necesidades familiares.

Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su moto en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir sacando adelante a su familia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Mauro is 28 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives together with his family in his own home.  The only basic service his home receives is electricity.  It is located in Morropón district, a region where people farm and raise livestock, which is located in Piura department.

Mauro earns a living providing a passenger transport service in his motorcycle taxi.  This is a vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin inside which passengers are carried.  He carries out his business during the mornings and afternoons.  In spite of the competition that exists, he tries to make the income he needs to cover his family's needs.

Mauro would like to use his loan to have his motorcycle taxi serviced and repaired.  He needs to keep his motorcycle in good condition so that he can continue offering a good service to his customers.  With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his income and continue supporting his family.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to have his motorcycle taxi serviced and repaired so that he can provide a good service

loans.name: Cristina Lyne

texts.en: Cristina Lyne is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells fish like sardines, mackerel and salmon. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fish to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cristina Lyne hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a single 27-year-old man. He runs a general store where he sells food items, detergents, and beverages. His business is located at the busy Masaai Lodge area in Ongata Rongai. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is insufficient funds. He has been in the business for three years now. He is using his loan of KES 50,000 to buy more stocks of food items like sugar, flour, and cooking oil. His future dream is to own a supermarket. He describes himself as honest and patient.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food items like sugar, flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Santos Sotera

texts.es:
La señora Santos tiene 53 años D. edad, es V. y vive con sus siete hijos.

Ella es una mujer V., que lucha y se esfuerza por dar el sustento diario a sus siete hijos. Hace más D. 35 años sus padres le enseñaron ha elaborar hamacas, matates, carteras y también se dedica a sembrar maíz y fríjol.

Santos compra hilo D. seda, poliseda, manquillos en la ciudad más cercana, viaja cada 15 o 22 días a comprar, el viaje dura aproximadamente una hora y lo hace en compañía D. uno D. sus hijos para que le ayuD. a trasladar el material hasta su casa.

Ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra D. 48 hilos D. seda. Con esto ella tendrá material suficiente para elaborar hamacas, matates, carteras, ya que tiene bastante demanda y más en esta época es la que más venD. en las plazas D. la ciudad. Santos necesita tener variedad D. mercadería y comenta que el negocio es bastante rentable, ya que D. eso saca para alimentar a sus hijos y para otros gastos como el pago del alquiler D. la casa donD. viven.

Santos desea tener un puesto fijo donD. vender su mercadería, para que los clientes sepan donD. encontrarla. También ella les enseñara el oficio a sus hijos más pequeños, y proporcionarles el estudio para que tengan como defenderse.
texts.en:
Santos is 53 years old.  She is a widow and lives with her seven children.

Santos is a widow who works hard to feed her seven children.  Thirty-five years ago, her parents taught her to make hammocks, nets and bags, and also how to grow corn and beans.

Santos buys silk thread and poly satin thread in the nearest town.  She travels every 15 or 22 days to make her purchases.  The journey lasts approximately one hour and she makes the trip together with one of her children so that they can help her to transport the material home.

Santos is requesting a loan to invest in buying 48 lots of silk thread.  This will give her enough material with which to make her hammocks, nets and bags, as she has quite a lot of demand, even more so at this time of year which is when she sells the most in the city squares.  Santos needs to have a variety of merchandise.  She comments that her business is fairly profitable since it enables her to feed her children and cover some other expenses such as paying the rent on the house where they live.  

Santos would like to have a fixed sales location where she can sell her merchandise, so that her customers know where to find her.  She would also like teach the traD. to her youngest children and proviD. them with an education so that they are able to look after themselves.

loans.use: to buy 48 lots of silk thread to make hammocks, nets and bags

loans.name: Mayco

texts.es:
Mayco, es un hombre responsable que vive en compañía de su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Desde muy pequeño nació en estas tierras, desde entonces aprendió todo lo necesario para poder emprender por el mismo el camino como agricultor. Sus principales cultivos constan de maíz, papá, alverja y habas; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues es su principal ingreso económico. Además es conocido entre los comerciantes como; el que tiene mejor calidad de alimentos; por ello no puede descuidarse. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos sembrando más cantidad, para ello está pensando alquilar terrenos o sembrar en sociedad, pues de esa manera podrá lograr su objetivo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “hacienda” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias.
Mayco, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío.
texts.en:
Mayco is a responsible man who lives with his wife and children in their own house, located in Ataura. He was born in these lands, and since he was very young, he learned everything he needed to be able to set out on his own as a farmer. 

His primary crops include corn, potatoes, peas, and beans. He looks after these crops very carefully, as they are his main source of income. He is also known among merchants as the farmer with the best quality of foods, so he cannot be careless. Now he would like to improve his income by planting in larger quantities, so he is considering either renting land or farming jointly with others, because in this way he will be able to meet achieve his goal. 

He belongs to the “Hacienda” Communal Bank and this is his second loan with MFP, where he feels happy because he is receiving the support of all of you, who enable him to continue in his business. He also promises to be punctual in his repayments, as all of his associates are responsible and supportive people.

Mayco, upon receiving this loan, will invest the money requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers for this next planting.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Uhuru Farmers Group

texts.en:
Prochuru is the facilitator of the Uhuru Farmers group. Prochuru and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Prochuru takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Prochuru had a good maize yield, harvesting 15 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Prochuru was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Prochuru and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Prochuru will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Uhuru Farmers group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, 23 years old, is single and has no children yet. He describes himself as a self-motivated man. He sells clothes, curtains, bed covers, shower caps, etc. In addition, he provides motorcycle transportation services. He has been in this business for one year and has one employee. His challenge is limited space in his area of business operation. He will use this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy dozens of clothes and bed covers. John hopes and dreams to be a supplier of clothes in the future.

loans.use: to buy dozens of clothes and bed covers.

loans.name: Christa

texts.es:
Christa nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Ciudad del sureste del Perú ubicada en la vertiente oriental de la Cordillera de los Andes). 

Christa tiene 22 años edad y es soltera, ella estudió la carrera técnica de computación e informática en uno de los más prestigiosos instituto de la ciudad del Cusco y está trabajando en una empresa privada de envió y recepción de encomiendas, ella trabaja como digitadora de informacion sube datos a un software. Ya son seis meses que trabaja y le va muy bien. Christa y su hermana Milagros van abrir un pequeño negocio de venta de comida ya tiene todos los implementos de la pollería pero solo les falta dinero para el alquiler del local.  Su sueño de Christa es abrir otro negocio de venta de pintura. 
 
Christa es integrante del grupo “Emprendedores” lo conforman 12 socios que viven en la ciudad de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Christa was born in the city of Cusco (a city in southeast Peru, along the eastern slope of the Andes mountain range).

She is 22 years old and unmarried.  She studied a technical career in computer science in one of the most prestigious institutes in Cusco.  Christa now works in a private company that sends and receives parcels, where she is a typist who inputs data to their software.  She has been working at the company for six months, and it is going very well.

Christa and her sister, Milagros, are going to open a small business that sells chicken.  She already has everything needed to operate the business, but requires only the money to rent the premises.  Christa's dream is to open another business that sells paint.

Christa is part of the group "Emprendedores" ("Entrepreneurs"), which is comprised of 12 partners that live in the city of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To rent a premises for her small business.

loans.name: Kasanga Thuyikulhaye Group

texts.en: Gorretti is a thirty-seven year-old married woman with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Her family goals are educating her children and building a permanent home.  She has been running a retail shop for four years, after starting with capital of five hundred thousand (UGX) only.  The main hardships are: price fluctuation, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock.
