However, she has goals of buying land to grow crops and of moving the business to a more permanent location. Gorretti needs the loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.  One of the group members did not take the loan, but as per policy he had to guarantee the others.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells sweet potatoes and cosmetics at Asebu Ekroful. She is married and has 2 children. Ama has been selling sweet potatoes and cosmetics for 3 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more cosmetics and sweet potatoes to sell. With the new profits, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi sont des hommes mariés ayant en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Fofanabougou un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante des hommes de la zone. 
Pour l’utilisation de ce prêt, BOURAMA, debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 2 hectares environs de maïs.
La production est vendue au niveau de Fana, Marka-Coungo après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 300 000FCFA après la campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi group are married men, on average 43 years old with four children, and live mostly in traditional households in Fofanabougou, one of the towns in the Fana commune in the Dioïla prefecture, the 2nd administrative region of Mali.
They are on their fourth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their rainy season businesses. They cultivate maize exclusively, which remains the dominant crop grown by men in the area.
With this new loan, Bourama, standing in the middle, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and to pay for labour to maintain about 2 hectares of maize.
The produce is sold in the city of Fana, Marka-Coungo after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. Bourama intends to realize an average profit of about 300,000 FCFA for this cycle. This profit will allow him to repay his loan and also help his extended family with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing, and small equipment.

loans.name: Safari

texts.en: Safari is 34 years old and is married. He operates a retail shop for now five years.He started this business so that his family never lacks a thing. He is a hardworking and very innovate man which can be evidenced from his stock. However he is faced with a challenge of limited capital. At the moment, Safari would like to add foods stuffs like matooke, Irish potatoes, tomatoes among others. He is requesting for a loan facility to buy food stuffs like matooke, tomatoes and others for sell and he believes, nothing can stop him from paying back.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs like matooke, tomatoes and others for sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy wants to buy a dairy cow and renovate her cow shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Milka intends to purchase onions, tomatoes and totatoes to sell

loans.name: Shehergul

texts.en: Shehergul A. is 63 years old. She was born in and has lived in Sabirabad since childhood. She has a very big family of seven children. She sells women`s clothes in the Sabirabad city bazaar. Mrs. A. borrowed a $1200 USD loan to enlarge her small business and she plans to use this loan from Agroinvest CU to make it even bigger.

loans.use: Mrs. Abbasova would like to enlarge her women's clothing store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of motor bike

loans.name: Valin

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Valin is a widow with 4 children, 2 sons and 2 daughters. She learned to sew clothes from the trainer in the village, and then she started to sew for the villagers, going from one village to another. Her sewing improved every day.

Then in 1992, she began her business in sewing clothes at home. She has expanded her sewing business by buying more sewing machines and employing the young ladies in her village. Her youngest daughter also sews clothes at home.

This is Mrs. Y.'s first application for a loan from MAXIMA. She requests a loan of $1,000 to buy one more sewing machine for her employee.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine for her employee.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.en:
Marco Antonio is a hard working person, always dedicated to give the best to his family and assuming his role as a responsible and devoted father. For years, he has been working in factories that produce roofing tiles, but not too long ago he decided to start his own business. Because of this, now he buys tree trunks that he chops by himself with an ax and then sells them as bulk wood in a market in the area. He works hard everyday, not only for supporting his five children, but also as an honest effort in order to provide his family with a safe and comfortable home. Marco Antonio is a good example of a responsible father, always looking after his family’s welfare. He is not satisfied with what he gives them, he wants the best. This is why he is asking for a loan in order to buy more trunks and, with the profits, keep providing for his family. Help Marco Antonio so he can continue his efforts in order to give the best to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Marco Antonio, es una persona muy trabajadora, siempre se ha empeñado por dar lo mejor a su familia, asumiendo responsablemente su rol tan abnegado de padre, desde hace años se ha dedicado a trabajar en fábricas de elaboración de tejas, pero hace poco se decidió a tener su propio negocio y es por ello que ahora se dedica a comprar troncos de madera para luego él mismo cortarlas con un hacha a fin de venderlos como leña al por mayor en el mercado de su zona.Cada día trabaja esforzadamente porque no sólo quiere mantener a sus cinco hijos sino darles un buen ejemplo de trabajo esforzado de manera correcta para adquirir en un futuro con este esfuerzo un terreno para otorgarles una morada segura y cómoda a sus hijos.Marco Antonio es un buen ejemplo de padre responsable que siempre busca el bienestar de su familia y no se conforma con darles lo que tiene, quiere darles lo mejor, es por ello que solicita un préstamo para comprar más troncos y con las ganancias seguir sosteniendo a su familia.Apoya a Marco Antonio a seguir adelante con sus anhelos de darle lo mejor a su familia.

loans.use: Increase capital for obtaining additional tree trunks in order to supply wood for food cooking from his demanding clientele.

loans.name: Claudia Beatriz

texts.es:
Mrs. H. lives with her husband and child their families home in the town of Lourdes. She has spent about two years selling clothing, a business which has helped the family to continue to move forward after her husband went unemployed for several months. It is grown into their main source of support. The loan will be invested in additional items of women’s clothing such as shirts, skirts and other items that are in style. Mrs. H. is very confident in this investment and use it to expand her reach into other sectors.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. H. vive en una colonia de Lourdes, su negocio es venta de ropa, actualmente vive con su esposo y un hijo en casa familiar, tiene aproximadamente dos años de dedicarse a esta venta el cual le a ayudado para poder salir adelante cuando su esposo se a quedado sin empleo por meses, ya que es la fuente de ingreso de la cual se alimentan , el crédito lo invertirá en comprar ropa de mujer como camisas faldas y otros que están de moda ella se muestra convencida de invertir y así ampliarse a otros sectores

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for men, women and children.

location.town: Col. Las Arboledas Pasaje 2 Casa numero 17

loans.name: Cristobal Rommel

texts.es:
Cristobal is a young man who lives in the neighborhood of Milgaro de Dios (God's Miracle). Due to the lack of job opportunities, he found himself in search of something that would bring income to his family. From this need and from his love of computers, a business idea was born. He attends churches to record songs they make there, which afterwards, he edits the sounds to make CDs or DVDs for sale. When he can get free time, he also fixes computers for his neighbors. The loan he requests is to start building a recording studio.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator. Cristobal es un joven que habita en el barrio Milagro de Dios, debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo se vió en la necesidad de buscar una actividad que le diera el ingreso de su familia. Es de ahí y de su gusto por la computación como nació la idea de su negocio, él se dedica a asistir a las iglesias a grabar los cantos que ahí se hacen, para después por medio de su computadora limpiar el sonido y grabar los cantos ya sea en cd o dvd, para después venderlos a la gente que se los solicita. En el tiempo que logra tener libre también se dedica a dar mantenimiento de computadoras a sus vecinos. El préstamo lo necesita para empezar las inversiones para hacer su estudio de grabación que en el momento son sus aspiraciones.

loans.use: to build a recording studio

loans.name: Fotima.

texts.ru:
Fotima A. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 38 years old, is married, has 4 children and has a high school education. She sells dairy products and owns a trading point in her region. Fotima purchases products from residents and sells them at the market. She would like to get a loan to increase her inventory. This business is the main source of income for Fotima’s family. In addition her business helps locals to purchase fresh dairy products at affordable prices. Fotima will pay back the loan during a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуллоева Фотима проживает в районе Шахринау.Возраст 38 лет Замужем ,имеет 4 детей.образование среднее. Занимается торговлей молочных продуктов. Имеет торговую точку в том же районе. Она скупает товар у населения и реализует на рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот .Ее деятельность является основным источником дохода ее семьи.Кроме того торговля в селе позволяет населению покупать молочные продукты свежие и по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Mrs. Noun S., 37, is a widow with three children who works selling groceries at home earning around $3 a day of profit. Two of her children work as garment workers with salaries of $40 each a month. Her other child is a student.

She needs a loan from Kiva to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 44 years old and is married with 4 children. Her children are 25, 23, 18 and 16 years old. Fatuma owns a small restaurant, which she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items (chairs, tables, milk, sugar) for her restaurant

loans.name: Sumarsih

texts.id:
Sumarsih’s daily work is selling cakes/cookies. This work has already been carried out since 8 years ago. Cakes/cookies of several varieties were made, ranging from cakes pre-prepared to fresh cakes. Each day, from 1 am, she must already prepare ingredients for making cakes, makes dough/batter and fries cakes for sale. After that, she gets ready to sell them at 6 am. She brings the finished cakes by the nearby market for sale by the shops. By mid-day, she takes a break then carries out her household work like cooking, washing and others. Sumarsih desires to grow her business. She hopes to achieve this with the aid of this funding. Currently Sumarsih lives alone as her husband had already passed away. Both her children are already married and have families of their own. Currently the families are healthy.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha sehari-hari Sumarsih adalah sebagai penjual kue. Usaha ini sudah ditekuni sejak 8 tahun yang lalu. Kue yang buatnya bermacam-macam, mulai dari kue kering sampai kue basah. Setiap hari, mulai jam 01.00 dini hari dia sudah harus menyiapkan bahan untuk membuat kue, membuat adonan dan menggoreng kue yang akan dijualnya. Setelah itu, dia akan siap menjualnya pada jam 06.00 pagi. Dia membawa kue buatannya keliling pasar terdekat dan menitipkan diwarung-warung. Pada siang harinya dia beristirahat dan nelakukan pekerjaan rumah tangga lain seperti memasak, cuci pakaian dan lain-lain. Sumarsih berkeinginan mengembangkan usahanya. Oleh karena itu dia sangat berharap diberi bantuan modal. Saat ini Sumarsih tinggal sendiri karena suaminya sudah meninggal. Kedua orang anaknya sudah menikah dan mempunyai keluarga sendiri. Saat ini keadaan keluarganya sehat

loans.use: Additional Business Funding (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Lài is 43 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 2002. Her family main income is from farming and raising pigs. Right from beginning, she and her family invested all her loans in raising pigs. They started small. Round after round of loans, their operations had expanded. They have rebuilt the pig pen and the whole installation. Today they have 20 pigs, each weighing 40-50 kg. Their living condition has improved markedly. They are able to buy all the necessary goods for the household. Mrs Lài has 3 children: 2 are still in school and the oldest one is working making 1.500.000 VND a month. Her family income is 3.500.000 VND a month. This time she is requesting 16.000.000 VND to continue investing in her pig raising business

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lài 43 tuổi , tham gia Quỹ năm 2002, nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình là nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi, từ khi tham gia Quỹ cho đến nay các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị chủ yếu tập chung vào chăn nuôi lợn thịt, từ những năm đầu với vòng vốn nhỏ gia đình chị chỉ chăn nuôi với mô hình nhỏ, các vòng vốn của Quỹ được tăng dần theo hàng năm, việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị cũng được mở rộng hơn, chuồng trại của gia đình cũng được tu sửa hiện nay gia đình chị đang co 20 con lợn từ 40kg đến 50kg, việc đầu tư vào chăn nuôi của gia đình chị rất thuận lợi kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình, chị có 3 con, 2 con đang ở độ tuôi đi học, 1 con đã đi làm và thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 16.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình: 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Amador

texts.es:
Amador is the humble father of 3 children who depend on him economically and who are his driving force in life, Don Amador leases farming land for seasons, since he does not own land, he cultivates his crops and then sells them, but his profit decreases due to the land payments. Therefore, Amador wishes to quickly acquire his own land, where he can sow his crops calmly and improve his revenue at home. To make that a reality, he needs to increase his production and especially the quality of his products to make them more profitable in the marketplace. This will bring better profits and then will be able to acquire a plot of land. The amount required by Amador at the moment is 600 soles for the purchase of fertilizers and compost; we hope that you will be of great help to this hard working father.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Amador es un humilde padre de 3 hijos quienes dependen de él económicamente y quienes son su motor en la vida, don Amador arrienda terrenos de cultivo por temporadas, ya que no cuenta con tierras propias, cultiva sus productos y luego les vende, pero la ganancia es recortada por el pago del terreno. Por ello, Amador desea adquirir prontamente un terreno propio, donde pueda sembrar con tranquilidad y mejorar los ingresos en su hogar. Para que esto se haga realidad, necesita incrementar su producción y sobre todo la calidad de sus productos, para que sean más rentables en el mercado, esto le traerá mejores ganancias, para luego adquirir un terreno propio. La suma que requiere Amador en estos momentos es 600 soles para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos, esperamos que usted sea de gran ayuda para este padre trabajador.

loans.use: Purchase compost and fertilizers to improve the quality of his products, obtain better earnings and power to buy his own land.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en: Mutabar Y. is 60 is years old. She’s a hard worker, married and has three children. Her husband receives a very low wage that does not cover all of the family's expenses. That's why Mutabar went into business selling foodstuff in her own grocery store. She has been running this business for two years. The business is stable and has allowed her to improve her family's living conditions. Today, Mutabar is asking for a loan of $575 that she will use to expand her business, offer a better service to her customers and improve various aspects of her store. She promises to repay the loan in 12 months, and wishes to extend her thanks to everyone who chooses to help her..

loans.use: To buy additional food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah A. is married and has one child. She received schooling through senior high. At Elmina, Hannah sells bread that she bakes herself. She started baking bread in 2004. Her husband is a fisherman.

Hannah uses her income to pay for food to feed the family, utility bills and her child's school fees. Hannah plans to use the loan to purchase more flour, sugar, and other ingredients for making the bread she sells. With the increased profit from her expanded business, Hannah plans to help her husband build the family house.

loans.use: Purchase more flour, sugar, and other ingredients for making bread to sell

loans.name: Dolibe

texts.es:
La señora Dolibe pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas 2”, ubicado en la Av. 21 D. Octubre Nº 530 P.J Micaela Bastidas, del Distrito D. Callería del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 56 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, 3 mayores D. edad y 1 depenD. aun D. ella, es casada, su esposo trabaja en la U.N.U, como “Ayudante D. Medicina Humana”. Dolibe con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/.300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. dulces. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el Banco. 

En la actualidad ella continua con el negocio “venta D. dulces”, usualmente se levanta temprano para realizar las actividades del hogar, para luego en las tardes preparar los deliciosos dulces caseros y salir a vender a sus clientes.

Con el  préstamo D. S/.2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará: 1 saco D. harina, 1 saco D. azúcar, 2 cajas D. aceite, 3 barras D. mantequilla, 1 caja D. huevo, manteca, etc.

Dolibe agradece al Banco D. Manuela Ramos porque gracias a ello su negocio ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Señora Dolibe belongs to the "Galactic Women 2" Communal Bank located on 21st of October Ave. Nº 530 P.J Micaela Bastidas, of the District of Callería of the Department of Ucayali. She is 56 years old and is a mother of 4 children; 3 of legal age and 1 still dependant on her. She is married. Her husband works in the National University of Ucayali, as an "Assistant for Human Medicine". With the first loan received from Manuela Branches of 300 soles, Dolibe decided to invest in the sale of sweets. She has worked with the Bank for 4 years.

Currently she continues with the business of selling sweets. She usually rises early to carry out the activities of the home, in order to later prepare the delicious homemaD. sweets and to leave to sell to her clients.

With the loan of 2,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: 1 bag of flour, 1 bag of sugar, 2 boxes of oil, 3 sticks of butter, 1 box of eggs, lard, etc.

Dolibe thanks the Bank of Manuela Branches because, thanks to it, her business has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies wholesale for making sweets, such as flour, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina K. is 33 years old and married with 2 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is carrying her baby in this picture.  She sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs.  She will use the loan amount of N52,000 ($450 US) to purchase more drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs to sell.  She is grateful to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget J. is 40 years old and is married with four children. Bridget sells second hand clothes for both men and women. She purchases the second hand clothes from Lagos State to sell in Benin City. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist.

Bridget needs a loan in the amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more second hand clothes to sell to those that cannot afford new clothes. She would like to thank everyone that has made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn T., 48, makes rice cakes and sells them in her village. She is the leader of a group of three women seeking loans. She is married to Mr. Touch Phanny, 50, who works as a photographer at wedding parties and other special occasions. She has nine children, three of whom are married. Two of her daughters are wedding decorators and help support the family and pay expenses for the four children still in school. To expand her husband's business and improve the service they offer, Soeurn T. is asking for a loan so that her husband can buy photographic supplies. 

The group also includes the following two women: 
Soeurn L., 40, sells cooked foods and raises pigs. She would use the loan to buy ingredients for the dishes she sells.
Nop N., 42, carves wood and sells her carvings. She would use the a loan to expand her business. The women in this group live in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase photographic supplies

loans.name: Mi

texts.en: Mrs. Mi M. is a villager in Sdok Thom village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Bin Maing, are farmers. They now have problems because their field is infertile, so Mrs. Mi M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel to support the field to make her crop more productive. She has seven children; one is a driver, two are laborers, three help on their parents’ farm, and the youngest attends the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase of seafoods and woodland products

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
A. Theresa is 24 years old. She is married and the mother of three kids. She lives in Bekwai Zongo community with her husband. Her husband is a cleaner at the public toilet at the community. Zongo is a place which is dominated by Muslims.

A. Theresa is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernels. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain palm kernel oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish, making local soaps, and pastries. She produces and supplies oil to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side as a result of low working capital to afford a machine for processing.

A. Theresa wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm kernels, three additional pots, and an electric milling machine to reduce the drudgery of using manual effort to help produce oil in larger quantities. She believes the loan will enable her to save more toward her children's education.

A. belongs to a village bank called ‘Bamali Allah’ which means ‘It is only God who can do it’. She hopes to receive GHS 600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bags of palm kernel, three big pots, etc.

loans.name: Reconnaissance Plus Group

texts.fr: Josée L. vend en détail la farine de maїs, du riz ainsi que du petit poids. Son capital actuel est de $230. Elle a commencé son affaire avec un capital initial de $ 30 qui lui avait permis d’acheter 1 sac de maїs en 1991. De 1991 à 1997, son affaire a prospéré en augmentant le nombre de sacs à 20 totalisant un capital de $600. En 1998, elle tomba sérieusement malade de la fièvre typhoïde et de la malaria qui causèrent une baisse très sensible de ses activités réduisant son capital à $100. Elle  les relança pendant la même année en achetant 1 sac de manioc, de maїs ainsi qu’un bidon de 20 litres d’huile de palme. De 1998 à 2008, Josée travaillait avec détermination et une bonne gestion jusqu’à intégrer l’un des groupes de Hope dénommé « Reconnaissance » en février 2008. Aujourd’hui, Son affaire génère $40 de bénéfice par semaine. Josée a 57 ans, veuve et mère de 9 enfants âgés de 14 à 39 ans dont quatre sont déjà indépendants, trois font des activités commerciales et deux sont élèves. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un dépôt de maїs pour revendre aux détaillants et un service de location des chaises. C’est le bénéfice généré de ses activités qui nourrit et supporte sa famille. Ses activités sont localisées dans la partie Est de Kinshasa.
texts.en:
Josée L. retails maize flour, rice, and peas. Her present capital is at US$ 230. She began her business with an initial capital of US$ 30 which allowed her to purchase 1 sack of corn back in 1991.

From 1991 to 1997, her business prospered, increasing the number of sacks to 20 representing a total capital of US$ 600. In 1998, she contracted a bad case of typhoid fever and malaria, which caused a noticeable reduction in her business activities, reducing her capital to US$ 100.

She got going again during the same year, buying 1 sack of manioc and some maize, as well as a jerry can of 20 liters of palm oil. From 1998 to 2008, Josée worked with determination and good management, and at that point she joined one of the groups of HOPE, a group called « Reconnaissance » (recognition) in February 2008. Today, her business is generating US$ 40 in profit per week.

Josée, 57, is a widow and the mother of 9 children, aged between 14 and 39, of whom four are already independent, three are engaged in commerce, and two are students. Her ambition is to open a maize depot so as to be able to sell to other retailers and also a business renting out chairs. It is the profit generated by her businesses that feeds and supports her family. Her businesses are localized in the Eastern district of Kinshasa.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital by buying 5 sacks of maize

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Махмудова Мухаббат проживает в городе Турсунзаде, в возрасте 35 лет.Замужем в данный момент разведена имеет дваих детей, образования среднее. Клиент занимается торговлей одежды в городе Турсунзаде, на рынке Саховат уже более 2-ух лет.На получившие деньги клиентка хочет увеличить свой товар. Занимаясь этим видом деятельности, клиентка содержит семью.
texts.en:
Muhabbat Mahmudova lives in the town called Tursunzode. She is 35 years old, has secondary education, divorced, and has 2 children. She has been in the business of selling clothing at a market for the past 2 years. This activity helps her sustain her family. Muhabbat would like to obtain a loan so she could increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Amida owns a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. She works at her business for 12 hours every day.
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.
Amida is 30-years old, married, and has three children: ages 12, 10 and 4. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Nancy, who has her own small business selling fish in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items to add her current stock

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es: Cleofe es de la ciudad de Lima, dentro del núcleo familiar trata de esforzarse al máximo, siendo ayuda para su pareja; consejera y amiga para sus hijos. Cada mañana, inicia su turno como vendedora de verduras en el puesto que tiene en el mercado de su localidad, comenzó su negocio con algunos productos que compraba en el mercado central de la ciudad, hasta que un día decidió asociarse con las personas que distribuían a los mercados, resultando ser una alternativa para ahorrar tiempo y dinero. Hoy, ya son más de 4 años ganando aproximadamente 1800 soles cada quincena, siendo la única vendedora que ha logrado posesionarse en la venta de verduras, sobretodo del zapallo. Cleofe por ahora está dedicada solo a la venta, pero ha tomado la decisión de conseguir un camión en un futuro cercano para trabajar como mayorista en los mercados de su ciudad, para realizar este sueño trabaja hasta muy tarde, sacrificando algunas horas de descanso, pero junto a su pareja saben que lograrán el progreso de su negocio. Este es su octavo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y con su banco comunal han trazaron metas para mejorar su funcionamiento y organización. Con los 3500 soles que solicita realizará pedidos al por mayor de sus productos, incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cleofe is from the city of Lima. She tries to put maximum effort into her family, as a helpmate to her partner and advisor and friend to her children. Every morning, she begins her shift selling vegetables at a stand that she has in the neighborhood market. She started her business with products that she bought in the city's central market, until one day she decided to partner with the people who distribute to the markets, which turned out to be an alternative that saves time and money. It has now been 4 years that she has been making approximately 1800 soles every two weeks, as she is the only person selling vegetables, in particular, pumpkins. Currently, Cleofe only does sales, but she has decided to get a truck in the near future in order to work as a wholesaler in the city markets. In order to achieve this dream she works very late, sacrificing some hours of rest, but along with her partner they know that they will make progress with their business. This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she has outlined goals with her communal bank to improve her operations and organization. With the 3500 soles that she is requesting, she will take wholesale orders for her products, increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Neidi

texts.es:
La señora María Neidi A. M. tiene 42 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene  2 hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la Elaboración de peinados, ondulaciones y cortes de cabello también a la crianza de animales como cuyes, patos, este negocio se inicio hace15 años, su negocio se desarrolla dentro de su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como liquido para ondulaciones, tintes.
El crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra productos como  liquido para ondulaciones, tintes y un espejo para su salón de belleza.
María  tiene como sueño tener su Salón de Belleza para crecer como microempresaria
texts.en:
María Neidi A. M. is 42 years old, and lives in the Víctor Raúl II settlement of the Porvenir district of La Libertad, Perú. She finished her Secondary School education, and has 2 children that rely on her for financial support. María dedicates herself to styling, perming and cutting hair, as well as to raising livestock such as cuyes (guinea pigs) and ducks. She has had this business, which she runs out of her home, for 15 years. She invested the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from her cooperative bank Leaders in Action II into buying hair products such as perm solutions and hair dyes. The loan of 800 soles will be invested into more such products, as well as a mirror for her beauty salon. María’s dream is to open a beauty salon so she can grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair styling products such as perm solutions and dyes, and a mirror for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Odiwo

texts.en: F. is 33 years old, a widow, and has two children. She has been in business for the past seven years after two years' training. She is requesting the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị S. (130302096), a 54-year-old married mother of four adult-aged children, lives in the town of Hưng Nguyên where she raises cows for sale.  Engaged in this business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 3000000 VND a month.

In 2002, Mrs. S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Having fully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund that was used to purchase breeding livestock, she is now requesting a new loan of 12000000 VND to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  This will be her sixth loan from TYM Fund, and Mrs. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

loans.name: Antonio Simao

texts.pt:
Antonio tem 25 anos de idade nasceu em vilanculos num distrito da província de inhambane, estudou ate 7 classes. Maritalmente e é pai de uma filha de apenas 2 anos. 

Antonio sai de vilanculos com o seu tio este que vive no município da vila namaacha uma vila na fronteira com a Swazilandia a procura de emprego. Trabalhou para o seu tio durante 2 anos onde só ganhava mensalmente um valor de 150mt, valor este que não chegava para custear as suas despesas. Em 2002, Antonio resolve fazer o seu próprio negocio com o dinheiro que havia coletado e sai da casa do tio e aluga uma dependência onde ele vive ate então pagando mensalmente um valor de 500.00MT. Actualmente é dono de um estabelecimento de venda de eletrodomésticos (cita no mercado central da vila do município de namaacha) a mais de 7 anos tem como melhor mercadoria rádios, discos e recargas para celulares adquiridos na cidade de maputo a 1.000.00mtx5 cada, a 35.00mtx50 cada e revendidos a 2.200mtx5 e 75.00MT respectivamente. Tem tido de lucro um valor de 5.000.00MT e consegue poupar por mês um valor de 1.000.00MT. É responsável pelos seus dois irmãos que vivem com ele em sua casa e tem um empregado que aufere mensalmente um valor de 1.200.00MT e encontra se a construir a sua própria casa, pois este muito ansioso em viver na sua própria casa porque viver de aluguer não e nada fácil.


Este e o quarto empréstimo de Antonio na hluvuku e terceiro com kiva. Esta confiante que vai pagar o empréstimo sem nenhum problema, estes 15.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria e fazer a conclusão da sua obra. Os primeiros créditos foram todos para comercio (5.500,00MT; 7.000,00MT e 10.000,00MT). Ele agradece muito a hluvuku e kiva por lhe terem financiado e concretizado o seu grande sonho, pois nos finais deste ano estara a viver em sua própria casa.
texts.en:
Antonio is 25 years old. He was born in Vilanculos in a district of the Inhambane province. He attended school through the 7th grade. He is married and has a 2 year old daughter. Antonio moved out of Vilanculos to search for work with his uncle who lives in Namaacha, a town on the border with Swaziland. He worked for his uncle for 2 years where he only earned around 150,000MT per month, an amount that didn't cover his expenses. In 2002, Antonio decided to start his own business with money he had saved. He moved out of his uncle's house and rented a place where he still lives for 500,000 MT per month. He is now the owner of a shop that sells electrical appliances (located in the central market of Namaacha). For 7 years his best merchandise has been radios, disks and cellphone rechargers acquired in Maputo for 1,000,000 MT x5, and 35.00MT x50 and resold at 2,200,000MT and 75.00MT respectively. He has earned a profit of 5,000,000 MT and is able to save 1,000,000 MT per month. He supports his two siblings who live with him in his home and he has an employee who earns 1,200,000 MT per month. He is building a house, as he really wants to live in his own home because renting is not at all easy. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku and his third with Kiva. He is confident that he will pay back the loan without any problem. The 15,000,000 MT will be used to increase his merchandise and finish building his home. The first loans were all for his business (5.500,00 MT; 7.000,00 MT and 10.000,00 MT). He is very grateful to Hluvuku and Kiva for having provided the financing to bring his great dream to reality. At the end of this year he will be able to live in his own home.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and Sell electrical goods

loans.name: Akouavi Louïse

texts.fr: Akouavi Louïse est née le 21 Juin 1961 au BENIN. Louïse est veuve et mère de 6 enfants, à sa charge. C’est du charbon de bois que Louïse vend. Mais Louïse achète le charbon à crédit et rembourse son fournisseur après avoir fini de vendre. Louïse ne veut plus acheter de charbon à crédit, mais aller à la source en acheter afin de faire plus de profit. C’est pourquoi Louïse sollicite le crédit d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Akouavi Louïse was born on the 21st of June, 1961 in Benin. Louïse is married and the mother of 6 children, whom she cares for. Louïse sells charcoal. But Louïse purchases the charcoal on credit and repays the supplier after she completes her own sales. Louïse does not want to purchase the charcoal on credit; she would like to go to the source to purchase it, in order to increase her profits. This is why Louïse is requesting a loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 32 year old woman, she is married and a mother 1 child. Her child is 3 year old.

Stella has owned a food business selling chips, chicken, banana for 7 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings. 

This is Stella`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more cooking oil, banana, potatoes for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from  the use of this loan, Stella hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil,potatoes,banana

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean claude H. is 25 years old, single and he owns a photocopy machine since 2008.

He employs 3 people in his services; Jean claude  starts working from 7h30’ A.M to 21:00 P.M
He is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a for the purpose of expanding his business through buying as new photocopy machine as possible in order to make a high profit.

By receiving this loan, Jean claude expects to save for his future and creating more jobs than before.

loans.use: purchasing new photocopy machine

loans.name: Khasbat

texts.en:
Khasbat B. is 56 years old and is married with five children.

Khasbat has been running her own small business for seven years already. She has a place in the local market for selling products such as macaroni, sweets (candies), tea, sugar, and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 8:00 p.m. Her husband and son help her in the store, registering the stock and serving the clients. Khasbat and her son are very friendly and polite, which allows them to keep their clientele.

Now, Khasbat is requesting a loan of 1607 AZN. She is planning to spend the loan on purchasing more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of her stock. She thanks everybody who has decided to support her.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora es casada, tiene un bebe de 2 añitos de edad, su esposo trabaja como taxista en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea,  y asume los gastos familiares, viven en la colonia san Antonio a 28 kilometros de Nueva Guinea, está solicitando su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente de primaria en la Escuela Diriangen desde hace 7 años,  actualmente Teodora esta estudiando una licenciatura en la Universidad URACAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño es seguir estudiando, trabajo, salud y poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad para que su hijo crezca en un ambiente comodo y agradable.
texts.en:
Teodora is married and has a 2 year old baby. Her husband works as a taxi driver in the urban zone of Nueva Guinea and is responsible for the family’s expenses. They live in San Antonio colony, 28 miles from Nueva Guinea. They are asking for their 7th loan to invest in improving the home (construction of another room). She has currently been working as a primary school teacher for 7 years. Teodora is studying for a degree at the University URACAN campus, Nueva Guinea. Her dream is to continue studying, working and having good health; and little by little to improve her home to have better living conditions so that her child grows in a comfortable and pleasant environment.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a new room in the home

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es: El grupo “25 D. Julio” esta representado por la señora Albina y conformado por 13 miembros D. las cuales una gran mayoría se dedican a venta D. productos como la venta D. comida, tienda D. barrio, ropa, comida, empanadas verdura y entre los varones al servicios públicos D. transporte y la construcción D. viviendas. En cuanto a la competencia no es alta debido a la gran demanda D.  productos ya que las socias cuentan con puntos D. venta estratégicos en la zona. El  crédito esta destinado al incremento D. su capital D. trabajo con la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas que faciliten más su trabajo para lograr obtener un mayor ingreso ya que D. ello depenD. el bien estar D. sus familias.  En cuanto a informes crediticios  las socias  presentaron las referencias correspondientes  para acceder al crédito otorgado por nuestra institución por lo que cuentan con la experiencia en grupos solidarios y están muy satisfechos por la confianza D. la fundación Agrocapital y sobre todo por el apoyo económico brindado para el progreso D. cada uno D. los miembros del grupo.
texts.en:
The “25 D. Julio” (July 25th) group consists of 13 members, represented by Albina, who, for the most part, are engaged in sales of various products like prepared meals, neighborhood grocery store, clothing, food, turnovers, vegetables. Among the male members there is public transportation service and housing construction. Competition isn't too high because the products the members offer are in high demand and they are located in strategic sales points in the area. The financing will be used to purchase merchandise, raw materials, and tools that will make their work easier to obtain better earnings since their families depend on this income. The members presented the required credit reports and references to be eligible to receive financing from our institution since they have experience working in cooperative groups and are very satisfied with the trust of Fundación Agrocapital, especially the economic help offered for the progress of each and evey member of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sepoima

texts.en:
Sepoima T. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Puleia. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Sepoima owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Sepoima has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sepoima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sepoima is requesting a loan from SPBD for the first time. Sepoima is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. Sepoima plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee, de 36 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos, y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

Su puesto de ventas está ubicado en el mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática. Además, Haydee aprovecha las ferias de las localidades aledañas y viaja mensualmente a la ciudad de Cuzco llevando su mercadería.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los fardos de ropa hasta los lugares donde los vende, puesto que le resultan muy pesados. 
Con el tiempo, Haydee espera tener una tienda de ropa en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa, por lo cual es muy querida por sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Haydee, 36 years old, is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her 3 children and what she wants most is to get ahead in life. Her sales stand is located in the Tupac Amaru market (the most important market in the city of Juliaca). She sells clothing and is a very cheerful and charismatic salesperson. In addition, Haydee takes advantage of the markets in nearby town and each month travels to Cuzco with her merchandise. What she likes most about her work is talking with the sellers that work next to her, since this makes the long working days more pleasant. She has been doing this work for 4 years and what she thinks is the most difficult part is transporting the bundles of clothing to where she sells, since they are quite heavy. In time, Haydee hopes to have a clothing store where she can provide better service to her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she is ready to make her repayments on time, as she would like to have access to other loans later on. She is a very active member of her communal bank and is well-liked by her colleagues. With the one thousand new soles she is requesting she will buy more clothing so that she can better stock her selling stand.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve working conditions.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy E. sells fresh groundnuts (peanuts), tins of tomatoes and other food supplies at Ataabazi near Elmina. Nancy has received no formal education. She is married and has four children.

Nancy has been selling groundnuts and tins of tomatoes, etc., since 2003, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more groundnuts and tins of tomatoes in larger quantities for resale.

Nancy hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts and tins of tomatoes in larger quantities for resale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian A. O. is 24 years old, married and has one baby girl of 2. She sells clothes to the people of Kisumu, something she has been doing for three years. Specifically, she sells pants, clothes and shawls. She is taking a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more stock to expand her business. Her major challenge is weather changes, i.e when it rains she is really affected due to the fact that she sells her products in the open air. There are also so many people in the area engaging in the same kind of business as hers and so there are no loyal customers as they are spoiled for choice. 

In the future she wants to own a boutique and she dreams of buying herself a car and building herself a permanent house. She is hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel A. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan De Oro City. He is 37 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Roel owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products, such as glasses, watches and other ready to wear (RTW) products, in the local community. Roel has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2010, Roel joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad C. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Natividad is married and has 2 adult children. Natividad owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as canned goods, milk, milo, eggs, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 32 years and earns approximately 30,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Natividad from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for retail store.

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "SAN CARLOS"

"Uno pueD. caer, pero con esfuerzo y el apoyo D. la familia se pueD. levantar nuevamente”.

Filomena tiene 52 años y 3 hijos D. los cuales solo uno es independiente, es la tesorera D. la alcancía comunal “SAN CARLOS”, que trabaja con EDAPRSOPO-PROSPERIDAD por casi 1 año y 5 meses.

El negocio D. Filomena es la fabricación D. zapatillas, se dedica a ello por más D. 15 años, actualmente su negocio es pequeño aunque no siempre fue así, Filomena nos cuenta que años atrás con la iniciativa D. su esposo deciden asociarse con un señor, amigo D. su esposo, para abrir el negocio D. la fabricación D. zapatillas, ya que el amigo D. su esposo sabia del negocio, sin embrago después D. un año D. su asociación se separan, fue así que deciden continuar solos, teniendo algunos conocimientos del negocio en el mercado, pero las cosas se pusieron difíciles cuando la municipalidad exige que formalicen su negocio, entonces el municipio solicitó los papeles correspondientes, papeles y trámites que exigían mucho tiempo y dinero, pero lo consiguieron, luego ya formalizados tenían que pagar un sueldo mínimo, pagar gratificación, seguro, etc. gastos D. los que no estuvieron preparados y provocaron el quiebre D. su negocio.

Teniendo una mala experiencia se mudaron y comenzaron nuevamente, ahora ya sus hijos ayudarían con una pequeña labor pero significativa, en el trasporte D. sus maquinas, materiales, etc. a su nuevo taller, “ella está convencida D. que uno pueD. caer, pero con esfuerzo y el apoyo D. la familia se pueD. levantar nuevamente”.
Filomena también para tener un ingreso extra alquila el primer piso D. su casa.

Sus planes a futuro son los D. costear la carrera D. sus hijos, terminar D. construir su casa y darle los acabados, también hacer crecer su negocio y sueña que algún día su marca D. calzado sea reconocida en el mercado.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "SAN CARLOS" (San Carlos Communal Bank) “One can fall, but with effort and support from one’s family, one can rise again.” Filomina is 52 years old and has three sons, one of whom is independent. She is the treasurer of the ALCANCIA COMUNAL "SAN CARLOS," which has been working with EDAPRSOPO-PROSPERIDAD for nearly one year and five months. She has been making slippers for more than 15 years. Her business is small now, but it has not always been this way. Filomina tells us that two years ago, on her husband’s initiative, they decided to associate themselves with a friend of his. They were going to open a shoe making business, since her husband’s friend knew something of business. Unfortunately, the partnership broke up after one year, so they decided to continue on their own, since they also knew something about doing business in the marketplace. Things got a bit difficult when the city compelled them to formalize their business and they required papers and permits that took much time and money to obtain, but they got them. Once formalized, they were required to pay minimum wage, tips, insurance, etc. They were not prepared to pay these costs, so the business went broke. Having had a bad experience, they moved and started over. Their children helped with a small, but significant amount of labor. They helped them move their machines and materials to their new shop. She is convinced that, “One can fall, but with effort and support from one’s family, one can rise again.” Filomena also rents out the first floor of her home to earn an extra income. Her plans for the future are to pay for her children’s career education, to finish building her house, along with fixtures and finishing touches, and also to grow her business. She also dreams that her brand of shoe is one day known around the world.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Davi

texts.en: Davi K. is married and has six dependents. She has no educational background. Davi sells roasted plantain at jukwa. Her husband is a farmer. Davi uses her income to support her husband in the upkeep of the home. Davi will use the loan to buy extra quantities of ripe plantain to roast for sale. She also plans to employ someone to sell some of the roasted plantain in Abura market. With the new profits from her extended business, Davi plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Davi will use the loan to buy extra quantities of ripe plantain to roast for sale.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. Luren.
Magdalena es casada, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos, Magdalena viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra animales que luego venD. en la feria D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además venD. carne D. casa en casa.
Magdalena necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado ovino.
Los sueños D. Magdalena son mejorar su casa y comprar un terreno para sembrar.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the Señor D. Luren Communal Bank.

Magdalena is a 52-year-old married mother with 5 children. She travels to the different open air markets throughout the region to purchase animals, which she then sells at the Ayacucho market. She also sells meat from door-to-door.

Magdalena needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing sheep. She dreams of home improvement and of purchasing a plot of land for growing crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en: Aiza is 26 years old, supporting three children in the family. She has a business of rice farming in Agusan Del Sur. She sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to access a loan. She will use the loan to buy the pesticides and seeds necessary for her farm. Having pesticides for her farm will help her make a good harvest. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP. This amount will help her sustain her family and her business.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 50 años, ella comparte su vida con su esposo Emilio de 46 años y sus 3 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace algunos años trabaja como maestra en la escuela de una amiga, actividad que le gusta realizar por la mañanas y durante las tardes se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, de esa manera aprovecha su tiempo libre para generarse un ingreso extra a la economía de su familia. María se siente muy contenta con los trabajos que posee, ya que gracias a la escuela pudo conocer buenas amigas y colegas, quienes le hacen algún pedido de los productos que vende. En un futuro desea mejorar su negocio comprando más mercadería para tenerla en stock y así generar muchos mas ingresos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos y no defraudar a su grupo solidario. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará material didáctico para brindar una mejor enseñanza a sus alumnos y además comprar productos de belleza para cubrir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old, and lives in her own home with her 46-year-old husband, Emilio, and her 3 children. For some years, she has been a teacher in a school run by a friend. She enjoys this activity in the morning, and afternoons she spends selling beauty products. She thus takes advantage of free time to generate extra income for her family. She is happy with the work she does. Through the school, she has met good friends and colleagues, who sometimes place orders for the products she sells. In the future, she would like to improve her business by purchasing merchandise to have in stock and thus generate more income. This is her third loan with MFP, and she commits to making payments punctually, and to not jeopardizing her group. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy educational materials to provide better teaching to her students, and also buy beauty products to respond to customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy educational materials to offer better teaching

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
N. Zam highly values that adage that says “hard work pays”. It’s the sole reason why she is always rising with the lark early in the morning to diligently shoulder the duties associated with her produce sales business in Senyi Center, Lugazi.

For the last five years, this happy-go-lucky married mother of five has been selling primarily bananas to earn her livelihood. What has additionally played into her favor is the fact that she has a farming background. She employs men to help her off-load her matooke (green bananas) like she appears in the photo.

Before becoming an individual client, Zam was a member of Kyakuwa Women's Group until her business was booming highly and she graduated to become an individual client. With this loan, she says she wants to inject financial momentum into her business. She wants to buy substantial bunches of bananas that she will later resell to her increasing clientele.

Zam has future plans of becoming a wholesale supplier of matooke in Senyi Landing Site and, so far, she has also managed to build rentals for more income.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Amalia Kaamiño's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Amalia K., 43 years of age and married, is a resident of Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Amalia is the leader of a three member group accessing a loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Amalia K.’s Group". Amalia is blessed with four children, of whom three are now in their teenage years and the other one is an infant. To make a living, she decided to run a sari-sari store. She is also working as a Barangay Health Worker and she is receiving support from her husband who works as a government employee. For the past 10 years, she has been able to maintain her business and now she is earning an average net income of not less than 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month which is very helpful to secure their family income. Upon learning of the good news of Paglaum MPC being awarded the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Awards 2006, she full-heartedly joined the cooperative in the year 2009. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People), a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP as her third loan to be used for additional capital for her sari-sari store and for a new line of business which is rice retailing. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions of her family and to meet their basic needs, as well as for loan repayments to PMPC, her child’s education and for possible business expansion. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store and rice retailing business

loans.name: Kamisa

texts.en: Kamisa I. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets, trousers and dresses at the market  and is requesting a loan to stock saddles and shoes to sell. Kamisa is 29 years old and is married to a driver. She has one child who does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock saddles and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 28 year old married woman with one young child from Lebanon. In order to help with the family expenses, she has been working as a private teacher since 2003. And she also works in a local school. She works hard in different times to help her husband in the household, especially as they have a little child and they need to satisfy all his needs. She has arranged a special room with all the education materials to receive students. Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 to purchase a desk and a variety of children's books for the library.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase a desk and a variety of children's books for the library.

loans.name: Anselme

texts.en:
Anselme was born in 1976. He is not yet married and he takes care of his sister. He has a hair salon and he is requesting a loan to buy other hair-cutting equipment. He has done this business for seven years and this has helped him earn a living.  

He hopes to build up the equipment in his salon to service more customers and generate more income.

loans.use: Hair-cutting equipment

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Elvira joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Cristalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cristalina está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzada y emprendedoras una de ellas es Idalina del Socorro S. V. de 25 años propietaria de una pequeña pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio hace cuatro años vendiendo gaseosas, meneítos y pan en la actualidad gracias a los préstamos ha aumentado su negocio. Ella sueña con tener una pulpería grande, surtida con variedad y cantidad de productos.

Los otros integrantes son Julia de los Ángeles Leiba S. comerciante de ropa y calzo negocio que inicio con unas cuantas piezas y pares de zapatos y Ramón Francisco B. A. es agricultor el siembra maíz, pipián, ayote
texts.en:
The Cristalina group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising members, one of whom is Idalina del Socorro S. V.. At 25 years of age she is the owner of a small general store. She started this business four years ago selling soft drinks, chips and bread. Thanks to previous loans, she has been able to expand her business. She dreams of having a large general store filled with many and varied products. The other members are Julia de los Ángeles Leiba S., a dealer of clothes and shoes who began with just a few items of clothing and pairs of shoes, and Ramón Francisco B. A., a farmer who grows corn, pumpkin and squash.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pulses, dairy products and yoghurts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Payment of college tuition

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 42 years old, married with three children who are 7, 10 and 12 years old.  Martin has owned a motorcycle since 2008.  He starts driving from early in the morning and continues until late in the evening.  In other words, he works hard in order in order to get the basic needs for his family.

Martin needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a second motorcycle which will hopefully allow him to increase his income.  If successful, that is, if his income increases, he will improve the lifestyle of his family and in addition to that, he will try to create some other sources of income as well as creating jobs for people from his community.

loans.use: the purchase of a second motorcycle

loans.name: Edier

texts.es: Edier B. Sánchez, tiene la edad de 48 años, es casado, vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar abonos para la asistencia del tiquizque y obtener una buena cosecha. Además, el cuenta con el terreno apto para este proyecto con 2 hectáreas y media sembradas de tiquizque las cuales quiere asistir. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer y a su vez generar más ingresos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no tiene problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de que sea una finca productiva y genere más producción. También, el ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El tiene como metas generar  ganancias para su propio bienestar al igual que el de su esposa y a la vez ir creciendo como un productor cada día más.
texts.en:
Edier B. Sánchez, 48, is married and lives with his wife who is his greatest priority.  He wants to buy manure for his tiquizque (a starchy tuber) crop in order to have a better harvest.  He has a field that is appropriate for this project with two and a half hectares planted with tiquizque to care for.

He has been a farmer for several years and wants to grow and generate more income.  This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has no problems with his property but does want it to become a productive farm generating more production.

He has had other loans with State-owned banks but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

His goals are to produce his own wellbeing as well as his wife’s while growing more each day as a farmer.

loans.use: To buy manure for the Tiquisque (a starchy tuber) crops.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo  solicito 700 $us, se dedica a la compra de cuero en bruto y su posterior curtido y comercialización, vive junto a su hermana  y su madre, en la zona villa Tunari de la ciudad de El Alto.
 Con el crédito comprara materia prima  al por mayor. Este es  el segundo crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Alfredo is requesting 700 US dollars. His business is buying raw leather and then tanning it and selling it. He lives with his sister and mother in the Villa Tunari area in the city of El Alto.
With the loan he will buy the raw materials wholesale. This is his second loan with IMPRO, and his first with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy raw leather in order to tan it and then sell it to companies that make leather clothing.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en: Armenuhi P. has been trading in children’s clothing since 2004. She started her business to support her big family of 5 members. Armenuhi is very much devoted to her work, enjoying working with her little clients and their parents. Having children as clients is doubly demanding, making it necessary to satisfy the children as well as their parents, and this is why Armenuhi tries to keep a good variety of clothing. Armenuhi has applied for the loan to bring exciting new children’s clothing in for the holiday season.

loans.use: To bring in holiday season children's clothing.

loans.name: Fenny

texts.en:
Fenny is a single woman with two children who have graduated from school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling from her home to her neighbours.  Fenny faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She hopes to expand and operate a wholesale shop in the future.

With 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase kitchen utensils (jugs, cups, plates) for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils (jugs, cups, plates) for resale.

loans.name: Balcon Florido Group

texts.es: “Balcón florido”, es una Alcancía Comunal conformada por 8 personas muy emprendedoras ellos se dedican a distintas actividades como la agricultura la ganadería y el comercio minorista.  Tal es el caso D. Clinda quien es la presidenta del grupo, ella tiene 65 años D. edad es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos que ya son mayores D. edad, Clinda se dedica a actividades como: la ganadería (vacunos) y venta D. quesos, ella realiza esta labor gracias a la enseñanza D. sus padres, con su esfuerzo y dedicación compró un pequeño terreno para criar vacunos. Clinda solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar comida (concentrado) para los vacunos que cría. Ella sueña con comprarse un terreno más granD. y adecuarlo para criar especialmente  vacunos. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a todos los integrantes del grupo quienes están contentos con el préstamo y por supuesto  son personas muy responsables.
texts.en:
“Balcón florido” is a community bank which has 8 very enterprising members who work in a number of different business activities such as crop farming, livestock farming and retail sales.

Clinda is the president of the group.  She is 65 years old and a single mother with 5 grown-up children.  Clinda carries out a number of activities such as: livestock farming (cattle) and cheese selling.  She was taught this work by her parents and, through hard work and commitment, she bought her own little plot of land on which to raise cattle.

Clinda is requesting a loan from EDAPROSPO to buy feed (concentrate) for the cattle that she raises.  She dreams of buying a larger plot of land and adapting it especially for raising cattle.  In the photo we can see all the members of the group who are happy to be receiving their loans.  They are, of course, very responsible people.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed (concentrate)

loans.name: Moses Macharia

texts.en:
Moses is 35 years old and is married to Rahab Wanjiku.   They have  two children.  He has been farming for a period of 14 years, earning an income of about KES. 10,000 per month.  His wife supports him with his farming activity.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD.  He intends to use it to buy fertilizer and spray, and to pay for the labour. He hopes to  give his children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & sprays, and pay for labour

loans.name: Huch

texts.en:
The smiling woman shown in the picture above, Huch T. is a 35-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Tom province. She raises   pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She then sells her pigs to a slaughterer in four-month cycles. Beside this work, she has also been planting the rice crop that is her annual business. Her husband works as a policeman. 

Huch T. is looking for a loan in order to buy wood for repairing her old house. This loan will provide her and her family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy wood for repairing her old house.

loans.name: Ivonne Monica

texts.es:
Ivonne e socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celetes, es conviviente, tiene 32 años y tres hijos de 13, 3 y 1 año.
Se dedica a la elaboración de llaves. Ivonne y su esposo tienen un puesto en el parque de la Magdalena, de elaboración de llaves para carro, casa, chapas de puerta, carro, caja fuertes, etc.
El préstamo que solicita, es para la compra materiales como: llaves, chapas para puertas y carros y  máquina para la fabricación de las mismas.
Ingreso a Finca por la invitación de una amiga, le gusta porque le enseñan,  practican los valores y puede ahorrar.
texts.en:
