Ivonne is a member of the María Celetes communal bank.  She’s 32 years old, in a committed relationship, and has three children who are 13, 3 and 1 year of age.

She makes keys.  Ivonne and her husband have a stand in the De La Magdalena Park where they make keys for cars, houses, door locks, cars, safes, etc.

She will use the requested loan to buy materials like: keys and locks for doors and cars and a machine to make them.

She joined Finca invited by a girl friend.  She likes it because they teach her, practice values and she can save.

loans.use: To buy keys and locks for doors and cars.

loans.name: Ninoska Elena

texts.es: Ninoska Elena tiene 47 años, este es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado con Fundación pues por la responsabilidad del pago de sus cuotas. Esta emprendedora Señora tiene más 3 años de tener este negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y los derivados del cerdo, ella tiene muchos clientes que le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de cerdos pues tiene que recorrer diferentes lugares. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Ninoska Elena is 47 years old and this is her first loan with the Foundation for the responsibility for the payment of her installments.  She is enterprising.  She has had her business for more than three years.  She sells tamales and other pork products.  She has many customers who order a variety of products.

She is asking for this loan to purchase pigs since she has to travel to different places.  She wants to improve the quality of her products.

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Yahir

texts.es: La señorita Yahir  trabaja en el llenado de formularios y trámites para universitarios; el crédito lo necesita para pagar el costo de defensa de grado para optar el título de Auditora en la Universidad y así poder conseguir un trabajo en su profesión. Yahir vive con sus padres en casa propia en la zona de San Sebastián de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Miss Yahir works in completing forms and processing documents for university students.  She needs a loan to pay the costs of defending her degree and thus, to receive the title of Auditor in the University and be able to pursue work in her profession.  

Yahir lives with her parents in her own house the the San Sebastian zone of the city of La Paz.

loans.use: TO PAY THE COST OF HER EXAMINATION FOR HER AUDITING DEGREE

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es: Gricelda tiene 43 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edmundo de 63 años y sus 6 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los largos días de trabajo que tiene Gricelda en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, sus cultivos están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde que era niña, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Pichanaki. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono y fertilizantes, para hacer más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Gricelda, 43, is a cheerful, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Edmundo, 63, and their six minor children who are the reason behind all her efforts.

The long hours Gricelda spends in her fields have turned her into a very knowledgeable farmer.  Her crops are very well taken care of and she always gets good prices when she sells her products.  What she enjoys the most is cultivating the soil because this is the activity she’s done since she was a little girl.  She’s been in this line of work for 11 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be transporting the products all the way to the Pichanaki market.  In time, she hopes to buy more land to increase production.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is saving up to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause any problems for her fellow communal bank members where she feels very happy.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy fertilizer and manure to make her fields more productive.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase clothing to sell in shop

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Rugiatu from Kissy in Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children, ages 11 and 20. Both of Rugiatu’s children attend school. They also take care of three relatives.

Rugiatu runs a general merchandise store. She sells rice, drinks, television, and DVDs. She has been running this business for six years. Rugiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase rice and cement. The extra income from this loan will allow her to rent a big store. In the future, she plans to be a supplier to other business partners.

loans.use: to purchase rice, drinks and cement.

loans.name: Hipólito Rafael

texts.es:
A la vivienda de señor Hipólito Rafael le está haciendo falta las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas de su casa.
Solicita un préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar las protecciones y colocarlas en la vivienda. 
Desea que su familia este segura y protegida, mientras el se encuentra trabajando. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fabrico, ya que este es la fuente de ingreso que tiene. Su esposa la señora Kenia se dedica al cuidado de los hijos.
texts.en:
Hipólito Rafael's home needs some protection on the windows and doors.  He is requesting a loan so that he can pay somebody to make the bars and fit them.

Hipólito would like his family to be safe and well protected while he is out at work.  He plans to repay his loan with part of the wage that he earns from his work in a factory which is his source of income.  His wife, Kenia, takes care of their children.

loans.use: to fit bars at his windows and doors

loans.name: Parvana

texts.ru:
Parvana 43 qoda. Ona zamujem imeyet 2 detey. Parvana yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i dvuma ochen umnimi,poslushnimi detmi. 
Parvana zanimayetsya pechkoy nacionalnoqo xleba "Tandir" uje 8 let. Ona s malix let uchilas u svoyey mami kak ispech samiy vkusniye "Tandir". Parvana dolgo ne zanimalas etim delom tak kak ona vishla zamuj i u neyo rodilis deti, no koqda yeyo deti uje podrosli ona reshila nachat ispekat "Tandir" chtobi uludshit yejemesachniy doxod semyi.  Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye produkti(muka,razrixlitel, moloko i t.d)dlya toqo chtobi pech "Tandir".
texts.en:
Parvana is 43 years old. She is married and has two children. Parvana is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her husband and her two smart, obedient children.  
 
Parvana has been baking the traditional bread called "tandir" for eight years.  From a very young age, she learned from her mother how to bake the most delicious tandir.  Parvana did not bake for a long time after she married and had children. but after her children got older, she decided to start baking tandir again to bring in additional income for the family.  Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy necessary ingredients (such as flour, leavening agents, milk, etc.) to bake tandir.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to bake bread.

loans.name: Miriam Judith

texts.es:
Miriam Judith tiene 28 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Miriam se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. No enfrenta desafios muy importantes. Su sueño es tener un terreno propio para construir la casa.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del recinto y bailar.
texts.en:
Miriam Judith is 28 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

This Communal Bank is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) and located in the neighborhood of Recinto Cachely Grande, which is in the canton of Ventanas.  The members of this Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  

Miriam is a farmer who specializes in growing corn, rice, and beans.  She buys her supplies at the Olivos Brothers Shopping Center each month and then sells her goods at the fair in the same location.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and compost for her crops.  With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies.  She does not face any major challenges.  Her dream is to acquire her own land for building a house.

Miriam enjoys celebrating the neighborhood festivals and dancing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Riza provides manicure & pedicure services. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials for her  pedicure & manicure service.

Riza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy pedicure & manicure supplies

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 45, is a married father of six who has been working in the agriculture sector since he was 25. He is well known in the region and is specialized in raising cattle and selling them to dairy products factories.

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time in order to buy necessary food and medicine for his cattle. He also plans to build an extra room in his house to give extra space to his children.

Ali gives priority to his family's safety and needs, working hard to be ready for any request they have. He hopes to increase his number of cattle in the future, which will definitely lead to an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy necessary food and medicine for his cattle.

loans.name: Betty Betzayda

texts.es: La señora Betty , es habitante del municipio de Masaya , junto a su esposo  e hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan ser unos profesionales , doña Betty desde hace  varios años se dedica a la costura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un ingreso suficiente para ir mejorando su vivienda , agradece Afodenic ya que atrávez de fondo Kiva , su condición de vida va cambiando poco apoca ya que en financiamientos anteriores logro realizar el baño y otras mejoras de la vivienda , ahora quiere el financiamiento para la compra de cerámica , puerta , inodoro , etc. .
texts.en:
Sra. Betty is a resident of the town of Masaya. She lives with her husband and children. Her plans for her family are to improve their living conditions and support her children so that they can become professionals. Doña Betty has been a seamstress for several years. Her greatest difficulty is not having enough money to make improvements to her home. She is grateful that AFODENIC is making Kiva funds available.

Her living conditions are gradually changing since her previous loans where used to install a bathroom and make other home improvements. At the moment, she needs a loan to buy ceramic tiles, a door, a toilet, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase ceramic tiles, a door, a toilet, and other items.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a divorced woman with one child who graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a juice-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a juice parlor in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fruit to sell

loans.name: Lisonia

texts.en:
Lisonia, a 49-year-old-woman, is married. Her family humbly settled for a living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Addressing daily needs of her five grown children or the whole family is not an easy thing to do and think about every day. She engaged in farming activity to answer those demands and to augment her spouse's irregular means of income. She started plowing and cultivating this land 4 years ago. At the end of the month, she gets PHP 5,000 total of income.

Lisonia is a GDMPC member, joining this year 2011. She begins her loan transaction with the cooperative by borrowing PHP 5,000  which she intends to use to purchase farm fertilizers to elevate production. She hopes that with this input, she can bring in a good return on her investment. Lisonia also plans to work on other farm fields as a tenant and buy a weeding tool when she gets adequate income after this or subsequent periods of production.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizers to elevate production.

loans.name: Luz Aldirian

texts.es:
A sus 32 años de edad Luz sueña con tener un café Internet muy reconocido en su comunidad, y sabe que hasta ahora esta sembrando semillas pues comenzó prestando el servicio de Internet a sus vecinos y actualmente tiene algunos computadores para alquilar, su propósito es ampliar el negocio y lo primero que debe realizar es comprar mas equipos, pero hoy en día no cuenta con el capital para dicha compra, es por esto que solicita un crédito y comenzar ese progreso que sueña y necesita, no sólo por su bienestar, si no también por su hijo a quien espera ofrecerle un mejor futuro. 

Luz es conciente que poco a poco su negocio irá creciendo y posteriormente espera vender productos cosméticos como otra opción para generar ingresos y proporcionalmente ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 32 years of age, Luz dreams of having a well-known Internet café in her community. She knows that she has planted the seeds to begin providing Internet service to her neighbors. At the moment, she has a few computers available for rent. Her goal is to expand her business, but first she needs to buy more equipment. However, she does not have the capital to make such a purchase.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can make progress with her dream. Not only will she be able to provide for her own welfare, but also for her son so that he can have a better future.

Luz is aware that her business will grow gradually, so she hopes to begin selling cosmetics later on as another option for generating income to help improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and a computer desk.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona lives in the village of Etseri. She is 57 years old and married. She and her husband Otar have one a 26-year-old son named Irakli.

Madona has three milk cows and a calf. On average, she produces 60 kg of cheese per month, and sells it at the local market. The family grows corn on a one-hectare plot of land they own. The feed most of the corn they grow to the cows.

Otan and Irakli are car mechanics. They purchase old, broken cars and repair them in their workshop. After repairs are finished, they sell the cars for a higher price to make a profit. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Georgian laris. 

Madona plans to use part of this loan to expand the shed where the cows are kept, and also to use part of the loan to buy an additional cow and more calves. Some of the loan will be used to buy a broken car, which will be repaired by Otar and Irakli. The family hopes to get additional income from both activities and put any extra profit they realize towards improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to expand a cattle shed

loans.name: 040905-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thực operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to catch fish.

Thực is 27 years old and married with three children. 

She is the leader of a six-member group, the 040905 Liên Minh Hoằng Trường solidarity group. 

Thực lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Thực joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thực has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thực has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thực hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase tools to catch fish

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en:
Mr. Thuch and his wife have four lovely children who are living under their care. Some of the children are studying at a local senior high school. Mr. Thuch wishes to send them to a good university in Phnom Penh after they finish high school. Thus, Mr. Thuch and his wife have to work hard and save some money for payments to the university in the next few years. 

Mr. Thuch lives in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. He earns a living by breeding cows, both for meat and offspring. He has been in this business for 13 years with his wife, who always assists him on their farm. His wife also shares her time raising some piglets at home for more income. This conscientious couple works tirelessly towards their dream of having a good quality of life. Together, they earn around $15 US per day for the household expenses. 

Mr. Thuch would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy more cows for breeding. With the rest of the loan, he will purchase some feed for fattening his pigs.

loans.use: to buy more cows for breeding and to purchase some feed for fattening his pigs.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

Arceli has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, soaps & sugar per kilogram. She has had this business for  five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, soaps, toothpaste & sugar per kilogram.

Arceli has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arceli hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps, toothpaste & sugar per kilogram.

loans.name: Anthony Joseph

texts.en:
Antony is a 41 year old married man.  He is married to a business woman and they have 5 children whose ages range between twenty seven and eighteen years old. 

He runs a pharmacy and sells medicine to the local people. His business is located at the busy Maasai lodge area in Rongai. He has been in this business for five years and employs one person. He requires a loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more medicine to boost his stock. His future dream is to run a clinical pharmacy which is fully stocked with a variety of medicine. He describes himself as very honest and straight forward.

loans.use: To add stock of medicine

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
Sanu  is 36 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 18, 12 and 6.  In 2002, she established  her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy foods for her business.  

In the future, Sanu  plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called "chiya pasal", these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy foods for her tea shop business.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Ida de 45 años es una mujer viuda. Hace 2 años que tuvo que tomar las riendas de su familia. Tiene 5 hijas, 4 de ellas son independientes y vive con la menor de 19 años en el anexo de Ricrican en el distrito de Palcamayo.  Los suelos fértiles de su comunidad, las lluvias, y las enseñanzas de sus familiares y de su fallecido esposo, fueron propicios para su desempeño en la agricultura. En terrenos de su propiedad tiene sembrado papas y ollucos. A su vez cuenta con carneros, para la comercialización de compra y venta de carne. 
“Mato 3 carneros cada semana y vendo la carne en la feria de Palcamayo. Gano por cada uno algo de 50 soles”, explica. Ambas actividades son rentables para Ida, y más teniendo en cuenta que solo vive con su hija. Ahora sus planes se centran en la conformación de un negocio de abarrotes en su distrito, por que visualiza su capacidad de trabajo y cree que sus fuerzas no serán las mismas para dedicarse a la agricultura. Con su ayuda, Ida accedería a su crédito número 15 de MFP. Entidad a la que agradece la oportunidad de desarrollo, por ende se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. A su vez menciona sentirse contenta y respaldada por los integrantes de su banco comunal. Destinará el dinero del préstamo en la compra de 10 bolsas de abonos orgánicos, cuyo precio varía entre 110 y 120 soles cada bolsa.
texts.en:
Ida is a 45 year old woman. For the past two years she’s had to be the head of the household. She has 5 children, 4 of whom live on their own. She lives with her youngest who’s 19 years old in Ricrican in the Palcamayo district. The fertile soil of the area, the rainfall, and the education from her family and late husband prepared her to work in agriculture. She grows potatoes and ollucos (a root vegetable) in her fields. She also has sheep for the purchase and sale of meat. 

“I kill 3 sheep every Saturday and I sell the meat in the Palcamayo market. I get 50 soles for each one of them,” she explains. Both businesses are more than profitable for Ida considering that she lives with only her daughter. Now she plans on starting a grocery business in her district because she sees her own ability to work and she believes that her strength won’t be the same for agricultural work. 

With your help, Ida will get her 15th loan with MFP. She thanks this organization for the opportunity for development, and she thereby agrees to be punctual with her loan payments. At the same time she mentions that she feels happy and supported by the members of the communal bank. The loan money will be used to buy 10 bags of organic fertilizer, whose price ranges from 110 to 120 soles per bag.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ccmm Chickens Group

texts.en:
Siboniso is in the poultry business. With a prior loan, she purchased day-old chicks, chicken feed, and medicine for the chicks. She was able to improve her stock levels and cash flow. 

Siboniso is requesting another loan to purchase chicks, chicken feed, and medicine.  This will improve her disposable income, which is used for the benefit of her family. In the future, Siboniso hopes to own a truck to make deliveries easier.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, chicken feed, and medicine.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru: Людмила хочет взять кредит, чтобы приобрести зимний ассортимент детской и подростковой одежды - кофты- 30 шт., куртки - 50 шт., брюки -50 шт. , теплые куртки -30шт. Предыдущий кредит содействовал развитию бизнеса. Людмила разширила свою торговую точку и увеличила оборот почти в 1,5 раза. Дом, который Людмила построила вмести со свои мужем, они сейчас доделывают (проводят отделочные работы внутри) и планируют в конце следующего года переехать туда.
texts.en: Ludmila would like to receive a loan in order to purchase a selection of children's and teen winter clothing, including 30 blouses, 50 jackets, 50 pairs of slacks, and 30 winter coats. The prior loan helped her grow her business, and she has expanded her shop and increased sales volume nearly 1 1/2 times.  She and her husband are currently putting the finishing touches on the house they built (they're finishing up the inside), and they plan to move in at the end of next year.

loans.use: to broaden her selection of winter clothing.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
Vanesa, de 33 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Henry de 35 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Rosa de 15 y Jorge de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.
Vanesa posee un trabajo muy lindo, se dedica a la venta de comida, su trabajo esta ubicado en su propia casa, su puesto de comida es muy concurrido por las personas que desean servirse un delicioso platillo nocturno, siendo su especialidad es el los Juanes y el Tacacho (Platillos típicos de la selva peruana), platillos con los cuales se ha hecho muy conocida entre sus comensales, cuando empezó fue solo vendiendo ni la mitad de lo que hace ahora, pero con el tiempo fue implementando y ahora es una gran vendedora que a parte de la buena sazón tiene un trato excelente con sus clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, ya que desde muy pequeña tuvo esta afición, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos sus clientes al mismo tiempo. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner un restaurante, donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este será el sexto préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará mas ingredientes e insumos para poder seguir haciendo los platos exquisitos que están acostumbrados sus clientes, además de algunos platos y cubiertos que necesita.
texts.en: Vanesa, 33, is a very friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home along with her husband Henry, 35, and her two dear children Rosa who is 15 and Jorge who is three years old, to whom she wishes to offer a better quality of life. Vanesa has a very nice job. She devotes herself to selling prepared foods, work that she does from her own home. Her food stand is very well attended by persons who wish to avail themselves of a delicious night time meal, her specialty being Juanes and Tacacho (traditional foods of the Peruvian rain forest). She has become very well known among her fellow diners for these dishes. When she began she was only selling half of what she sells now, but over time she built up and now is a large seller who not only offers good flavor but excellent treatment to her customers. What she enjoys most about her work is cooking, as she was a fan of cooking from a very early age. She's had this business two years and believes the most difficult part is waiting on all her customers at the same time. Over time she hopes to raise enough money to set up a restaurant where she may offer better service to her customers. This will be her sixth loan with MFP and so she hopes for your collaboration so she may keep pursuing her objectives. At the same time she commits once again to making the payments as with her previous loans. In addition she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible persons who support each other a lot. With the requested amount of 3,000 Peruvian soles she will purchase more ingredients and supplies for making more of the exquisite dishes her customers are used to having, as well as some items of dishware and table settings that she needs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing food.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is 34 years old and a mother with two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a security employee at a local college who earns a decent salary, but not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past 15 years, Mervat's husband has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project.

Mervat is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Mervat is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and improve the herd

loans.name: Maria Ilduara

texts.es: Maria Ilduara ha sido una persona muy trabajadora durante toda su vida. Desde hace 25 años montó su propio taller de confección y se ha desempeñado en esta actividad desde entonces. La actividad la aprendió por unos cursos que tomó y gracias a estos buenos cursos sus trabajos tienen la reputación de ser de muy buena calidad. Debido a problemas de su salud, Maria Ilduara presenta algunos inconvenientes a la hora de confeccionar sus productos, sin embargo, espera estos problemas sean superados una vez pueda contratar a una persona para que le ayude a la confección de sus prendas. Gracias a que su negocio esta creciendo, Maria Ilduara necesita comprar insumos que le permitan atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, sin embargo, en el momento no dispone del capital necesario para la compra de los insumos que requiere; es por esto que Maria Ilduara aspira a que con un préstamo le sea posible comprar los insumos necesarios y pueda así seguir expandiendo las ventas de su negocio. Maria Ilduara afirma que con el incremento en las ventas que ha tenido en los últimos días, podrá cumplir su sueño de que su taller se expanda y pueda contratar a personas de bajos recursos económicos y les brinde la posibilidad de trabajar por un buen ingreso.
texts.en:
María Ilduara has been a very hardworking person her entire life.  She set up her own sewing workshop 25 years ago and has been working in that activity ever since.  She learned her craft taking courses and thanks to these good courses her work has the reputation of being very high quality.  Due to some health problems, María Ilduara faces some inconveniences when she’s making her items.  However, she hopes these difficulties will be overcome once she can hire a person to help her make her articles of clothing.

Thanks to her business growing, María Ilduara needs to buy more supplies so that she can fill customer orders.  However, at present she does not have the necessary capital to buy the supplies she needs.  Because of this, María Ilduara hopes that with the loan it will be possible to buy the necessary supplies to continue expanding sales in her business.  María Ilduara affirms that with the increase in sales she’s had the last few days she’ll be able to reach her dream of expanding her workshop and hiring people of low economic resources providing them with job opportunities that earn good income.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Madoudiarrabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, NENE, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debouts, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,75 hectares de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 275.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI I are married women who average 37 years of age and three children each. They live mostly in polygamous families in Madoudiarrabougou, a village in the commune of Guegneka, region of Koulikoro, the second administrative region of Mali. 

This is their 4th collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. They grow millet and groundnuts.

Nene, standing first from the right, will use this new loan to purchase inputs and small farming tools, and to pay for the cost of plowing 1.75 hectares of millet and groundnuts. After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the city of Fana to a clientele composed of men and women.

Nene expects to earn an average profit of 275,000 CFAF per season. This will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for inputs, small farming equipment and the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Okpe Oluwa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OKPE OLUWA composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marguerite (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 45 ans. Marguerite est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Georges. Le couple a huit enfants, scolarisés et quatre à leur charge. Marguerite vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Marguerite vend des condiments depuis cinq ans ; qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Marguerite s’approvisionne dans un marché et dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marguerite sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe OKPE OLUWA, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments.

loans.name: Aurela

texts.en: Aurela is 29 and a married mother of a 7 and 2 years old and they live in a city in the southern Albania. She has been working in a clothing manufacture in her city for very long time with a monthly net income of $200 whereas her husband has been working in a shoe factory in their city for a monthly net pay of $240. " I never had enough and never managed to put aside some money to take care of my mouth  and now i'm missing almost all teeth and can't eat and speak properly and very few teeth I've got, I'm having excruciating pain.I was told from dentist that 50,000 Albanian lek that I am requesting from lenders will be just enough to take case of only the feelings in my existing teeth and that is okay so that the pain stops. As far as having some denture to replace all those teeth that are missing, it would probably be another time, who knows when because the basic needs of my two young kids are in my priority list," said Aurela to the loan officer who took the interview at her home.

loans.use: to pay for dental work; she is missing most of the teeth and the very few she has need extensive work on them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy motor vehicle spare parts for her hardware business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Benedette would like to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en: Sevil A. has a dishes and tableware store. She is 55, married and has two children. She borrowed a $1200 USD loan to rent a place for her store, and she plans to use this loan from Aqroinvest CU to repair and improve it and her stock.

loans.use: Mrs. Amirova would like to repaire her store where she sells dishes and tableware.

loans.name: Bikenja

texts.en:
Bikenja has been selling children's clothes in the Kistakuz clothing market for three years. She loves children very much. She is married and has 3 children of her own. Her husband is in Russia. He sends money to his family, but it is not enough to support them, which is why Bikenja decided to start her own business. Bikenja brings her goods from the wholesale market, Panjshanbe , to Khudjand.

She is one of the active clients of Micro Invest. Her first loan was 100USD and she spent it for developing her business. Gradually she increased her working capital and expanded her inventory by including several lines of modern clothes for children. She wants to go to the Istaravshan district of Tadjikistan, to the big market there, to purchase goods. She is requesting 600USD for purchasing.

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sim has been married since 1998 and has 3 children: a son and 2 daughters. She learned to weave from her mother in 1990, and started her own silk production business that same year. Her husband has also been weaving silk at home ever since 1998 when he learned the skill from his wife. 

Mrs. S. has borrowed money from MAXIMA already three times, and is now requesting a loan of US$400. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalia is a 41-year-old single mother of three. All of her children are still in primary school. She is dedicated to farming and the sale of her crops. She learned this business from her parents who were also farmers. When she was a girl she helped her parents sell their crops in the streets with baskets.

With the money she generates from her crops, Rosalia has been able to build a house as well as invest in the education of her children. She has asked for a loan to buy seeds. She will expand her products by planting more fruit for the summer months. In the future she hopes to buy more land and expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda belongs to the Communal Bank of Valiant Women; she lives in the San Martin region, Huallaga province, Saposoa district. Her business is located at 670 Lima Avenue and she sells clothes and shoes. Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own effort she was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With the loan of 800 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy different models of shoes and a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests of her customers. Yolanda is 40 years old, she lives with her spouse, and works every day starting very early in the morning so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her two children successfully finish medical school.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Drejet, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yolanda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia Huallaga, distrito Saposoa. Su negocio está ubicado en Av. Lima No. 670 y se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y a su propio esfuerzo logró aumentar su negocio ya que empezó con poco y un local pequeño y ahora tiene un local más grande y gran cantidad de clientela. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará zapatos en diferentes modelos y tallas y ropa en variedad de modelos y para diferentes ocasiones y algunos pedidos directos de sus clientes. La señora Yolanda tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo, trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano para salir adelante y poder cumplir con la meta que sus dos hijos que están estudiando medicina terminen con éxito.

loans.use: Buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Essoham

texts.fr:
Mrs. Essoham Awèdéou is a 42-year-old widow with five children. She has been selling yams at the Adéta market for the last 10 years. She takes care of her family with the profits she earns from her business. With this loan, she would like to increase her working capital in order to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Essoham Awèdéou est agée de 42 ans , veuve avec 5 enfants en charge. Elle est revendeuse d'iggname au marché d'Adéta depuis 10 ans. Avec son bénéficie elle fait vivre sa famille Avec le présent emprunt elle compte augmenter son fonds de roulement afin de satisfaire sa clientèle

loans.use: Purchase of yams in neighboring villages for retail sale at the local market

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy U. is married with 3 children. She is 38 years old. She is from Lagos State, Nigeria. She is in business selling cloth and as a fashion designer. She has been in business since 1991 and needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more cloth and bags for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and bags

loans.name: Eoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Eoun A., 23, owns a plot of farmland growing a variety of vegetables, and makes an average of around $3 a day in profit. Her husband works selling charcoal. He transfers charcoal by cA. and sells door to door in the village making around $4 a day in profit. They have one child and he is too young to attend school yet.

This loan will be used to purchase more firewood to turn into charcoal. They also plan to send their child to university in the future. (Mrs. Eoun A. is pictured with her husband and Credit Officer)

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to turn into charcoal.

loans.name: Groupement Noviwowo

texts.fr:
The group Noviwowo is an enterprise made up of four gentlemen in the town of Adéta, Togo, a town located about 150 kilometeres from the capital. The head of the group is Mr. Atsou A., who is 20 years old, single and who sits in the second position from the left in the photo. The other members are Mr. Ayao A., who is 26 years old and single, Mr. Koffi O. who is 30 years old and single and Mr. Innocent K. who is 28 years old and married. These diligent men make furniture, chairs and beds from woods such as teak and sell them in town. A job in the wood and furniture industry is a good one to have in Togo and the group Noviwowo has been a part of this artisan community for 3 years. They are entrepreneurs, responsible and conscientious of their customer's needs. They have already benefited from two previous loans and which they have paid back on a regular basis. They are asking for a third loan to purchase more planks, rafters, saws and hammers so that they can continue with their work. With these purchases, they will be able to produce more furniture of high quality for their community and they will use the profits to meet the needs of their respective families.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Groupement Noviwowo est une entreprise des menuisiers créée par 4 hommes d’Adéta, Togo, une ville situé à environ 150 kilomètres de la capitale. Le chef du groupe est Monsieur Atsou A., âgé de 20 ans, célibataire et qui est situé en deuxième position à partir de la gauche de l’image. Les autres membres sont: Monsieur Ayao A., agé de 26 ans et célibataire, Monsieur Koffi O., âgé de 30 ans et célibataire, et Monsieur Innocent K., âgé de 28 ans et marié. Ces hommes diligents fabriquent des meubles, chaises et lits par exemples, à partir des bois locaux comme le tek, et les revendent en ville. L’exploitation du bois et la fabrication des meubles en bois est un vrai métier ici au Togo, et le Groupement Noviwowo était parti de la communauté artisane pour plus de 3 ans. Ils sont les entrepreneurs responsables et consciencieux clients, puisqu’ils ont déjà bénéficié de 2 crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers. Ils demandent ce troisième crédit pour acheter les planches, chevrons, pointes, scie et marteaux pour continuer leur travail. Avec ces achats, ils peuvent produire les meubles en bois de haute qualité pour leur communauté et ils peuvent utiliser les profits pour répondre aux besoins de leur famille respective.

loans.use: To purchase planks, rafter, saws, and hammers.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama D. lives in Vélingara, Senegal.  She is 39 years old and married.  She has been a member of the Samba 15ANS village bank for 6 years.  She is requesting this loan to improve her food business.  She will purchase corn and peanuts in bulk to resell for a profit.  <b> This loan is for a duration of 6 months and will be repaid with a single, bulk payment at the end of 6 months. <b/>

loans.use: To buy six tons of corn and 4 tons of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. L. Thi Tran, 26 years old, joined the Fund in 2002. She is very quick-minded and clever, which led her to the observation that her town does not yet have a salon or a wedding gown rental shop. In order to get this service the people have to travel to the bigger town. From this realization, she discussed her plans with her husband to go study cosmetology. After gaining the necessary knowledge and training in this field, she and her husband were determined to invest some money in opening a salon, with the advantage of being right in town and accessible to the local townspeople. After a short time her salon had become the destination for many brides and grooms in town. As the business grew, their salon also expanded in size. She has one child who is still in school. In this round of funding her family is requesting 15,000,000 VND to continue investing in the salon. Their average income is 3,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị trần Thị Liên 26 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002, nhanh nhẹn và khéo léo đó là những yếu tố quyết định sự lựa chon nghề nghiệp của chị, thấy rằng trên địa bàn xã nhà chưa có hiệu trang điểm và cho thuê áo cưới, với dịch vụ này khi co nhu cầu người dân ở xã phải lên tận huyên mới có, xuất phát từ đó chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng thống nhất chị đi học trang điểm, khi đã có kiến thức trong tay chị cùng anh quyết định mở của hiệu tại nhà. Tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn gia đình chị đều đầu tư vốn vào cửa hiệu, với lợi thế ngay trên địa bàn chẳng mấy chốc cửa hiệu của chị đã là nơi đến của bao cô dâu chú dể các địa phương quanh xã . Việc làm ăn ngày càng phát triển, cửa hiệu của chị cũng được mở rộng hơn, chị có 1 con và con chị đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào cửa hiệu. Thu nhập bình quân: 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in expanding salon

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mrs. Mean H. and her husband, Mr. Mi Pheon, are farmers in Trapaing Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, Mr. Mi Pheon transports soil by motorbike to sell in the village. They have three children, two of whom are attending school, while another is too young to work or study. Although Mrs. Mean H. and her husband have two businesses, they cannot afford a new house. Thus, Mrs. Mean H. has decided to ask for a loan to build a new house in order to live separately from her parents. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Muzaym

texts.ru:
Muzaym S. lives in Vahdat district. She is married and has a high school education. She and her husband have five children. Muzaym's business is buying and selling produce. Early in the mornings, she purchases fruits and vegetables from local farmers wholesale. Muzaym then sells the produce for a profit, allowing her to support her family. Since she already sells a wide variety of fruits and vegetables, Muzaym would like to diversify the goods offered at her market stall. She has applied for a 12-month loan to purchase additional inventory.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Савидова Музаям жительница района Вахдат. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей овощей , фруктов и зелени. Музаям рано утром скупает у местных крестьян их продукцию оптом.Затем реализует ее на своей торговой точке в розницу.На прибыль от торговли она содержить своих детей.Так как в данное время поспели все фрукты и овощи ,клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки. Музаям берет кредит срокм на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To diversify the goods for sale

loans.name: Alimurod

texts.ru: Гуломов Алимурод житель района Хуросон. Женат и имеет семерых детей. Для того чтобы прокормить такую большую семью занимается  бизнесом в сфере животноводства.Покупает бычков для откормки , а затем перепродает на базаре. Узнав, про  возможность получить кредит решил обратиться к нам за помощью. Использовать кредит планирует для покупки бычка. Это поможет ему увеличить товарооборот и помочь развивать животноводческий сектор. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Alimurod G. lives in the Khuroson district. He is married and has seven children. In order to support such a big family, he runs a business raising animals. He buys bull calves to raise to market weight , then resells them at the market. Having found out about the availability of loans, he decided to come to us for assistance. He plans to use a loan to buy a bull calf. This will help him increase sales turnover and help develop the animal husbandry sector. The loan will be paid back over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bull Calf Purchase

loans.name: Silvia Ynes

texts.es:
La señora Silvia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas 2”, ubicado en el Jr. Amazonas Mz. A Lt. 17 del Distrito de Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años y es madre de 5 hijos que aun dependen de ella, es casada su esposo se dedica a la mecánica de motos y carros. Silvia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos  de S/.300 decide invertir en la venta de especería (condimentos). Tiene 10 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal. 

En la actualidad ella cuenta con el negocio de venta de abarrotes, verduras y especería   se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para apoyar a sus hijos en casa, luego  a las 6 de la mañana   va al mercado para dedicarse a su negocio.
 
Con el  préstamo de S/.3,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará: 1 saco de azúcar, 1 paquete de fideo, 3 kilos de cominos, 2 kilos de pimienta, 4 tiras de doña gusta, verduras y otros.

Silvia manifiesta que,  Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para nosotras y para su familia, es por eso que sigue adelante y pagando muy puntual su préstamo
texts.en:
Silvia belongs to Banco Comunal, "Mujeres Galácticas 2," Jr. Amazonas Mz. A Lt. 17, Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department. She is 41 and the mother of five dependent children. Her husband is a motorcycle and car mechanic. With her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 soles, she decided to invest in condiment sales. She has been working with the Banco Comunal for 10 years. Now she depends on her grocery, vegetables and condiment sales. She gets up at 5 A.M. to help her kids and then goes to the market at 6 to work in her business. With this 3,000 sol loan, which she will repay in four months, Silvia will buy a sack of sugar, pasta, three kilos of cumin, two kilos of pepper, bouillon, vegetables and other things. Silvia says that Manuela Ramos is a support for her and her family, and that is why she can move forward and pay her loan off quickly.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various wholesale products

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana O.  lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 42 years old and married with 7 children. She owns a store where she sells drinks and wine. She needs the loan amount of N81,000 to purchase more drinks and wine to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of fifteen members is located in Moat Boeng village in Kandal Province and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sok Ra K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Aside from this business, she is a dried banana seller. Her husband, Mr. Chuon Sopeap, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Even though they have different businesses, they still earn less income than they need to support and provide a better life for their family. Thus, Mrs. Sok Ra K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to purchase tiles to make floor tiles for her house. She is 24 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To add to her savings to purchase tiles to make floor tiles for her house.

loans.name: Samreth

texts.en: Mr. Samreth K. was born in 1968, and he now lives in Trapaing Touk village in Kampong Cham province. He is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and then re-sell later at a better price. Because this business is going well, he wants to expand it. So he decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell. His wife, Mrs. Sem Limsaeang, helps him in the current business. Mr. Samreth K. has two children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the youngest one is only three years old and too young to work or study. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice to re-sell.

loans.name: Yeredon (Le Savoir Vivre) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yeredon est un regroupement de 7 femmes de  kimparana qui cohabitent ensemble depuis très longtemps. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 4  enfants vivant toutes dans de grandes familles traditionnelles.
 L’activité dominante de ces clientes est  la vente d’habillement et de produits cosmétiques
 Pour agrandir leurs entreprises, les membres du groupe Yeredon ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier prêt  qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habits en grande quantité à  un prix abordable.
Elles se procurent  de ces marchandises à Bamako (la capitale malienne) et à koury pour les revendre au village. 
N’ayant pas assez de  place pour les activités, elles sont des vendeuses  ambulantes. Elles prétendent avoir un bénéfice de 40 000FCFA pendant  ce cycle.
En dehors du remboursement des prêts, les femmes du groupe Yeredon utilisent une partie du revenu pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Yeredon is composed of seven women of Kimparana who have been living together for a long time. They average 44 years of age, are married, and have at least four children. They all live in large traditional families. The dominant work of these group members involves selling clothing and cosmetics.

To grow their enterprises, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which they are on their first loan. The current loan will be used to buy clothing in large quantities at affordable prices.

They get their merchandise in Bamako (capital of Mali) and in Koury for resale in the village. Lacking enough space for their businesses, they sell door-to-door. They aspire to having a profit of 40,000 francs CFA during this business cycle. Besides repaying the loan, the women of the group will use part of the revenues to address typical family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with a daughter. She sells women’s clothing in several markets of Kahovka and the Kherson region. Valentina started this business five years ago. Currently, she has over 13,500 Grivnas in turnover capital. Her net profit is about 2,500 Grivnas a month. 

Valentina would like to increase the assorted inventory in her kiosk and improve her sales as well. Today she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to obtain a stable source of income and continue developing her business. A committed wife and mother, Valentina works tirelessly to improve the quality of life for her family. We are hoping that her eye for market trends and customer needs will help her maintain consistent growth in her business and reach success.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: Ussif

texts.en:
Ussif S. is married and the father of three children, all females. He is thirty-eight years old. His first born child is in senior high school, and the others are in the primary school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi (a gold mining town) in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The majority of the inhabitants of Bekwai are into commercial activities. Ussif is a tailor by profession.

He buys fabrics and accessories from Kumasi and sews for retail sale. He procures the materials and sews for people who place an order, but he does not charge a deposit. His shop is situated right at the main entrance of the local market square. As a result, Ussif says he wins many customers. He has been in business for seventeen years and has trained a number of apprentices who have graduated. He has some apprentices who are still in training. Ussif says he wants a loan to buy a variety of materials in bulk. It is his dream to put up a house for his family and to give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: To buy fabric in bulk

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu M. is forty-two years old. She is married and has five children, two sons and three daughters. Her children are in the junior high school and the primary school. Her husband is a farmer. Ramatu is a food vendor. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Ramatu cooks and sells rice, stew and beans. She cooks the food in her house and sells it in front of her house in the mornings. Ramatu buys bags of rice and other ingredients from the wholesalers in her community. She has been in this business for twenty years and is very experienced. She wants a loan to buy more bags of rice and other ingredients. She hopes to sponsor her children to higher levels in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Valihon

texts.ru: Негматов Валихон житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 35 лет, женат и имеет троих детей.Занимается животноводством уже четыре года. Покупает животных для откормки и перепродажи. Хочет купить дойную корову. Поэтому он решил обратиться к нам за кредитом. На эти деньги он планирует взять породистую корову , которая в дальнейшем сможет давать породистое потомство.
texts.en:
Valihon N. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has been in animal agriculture for the past 4 years. He buys animals so he could feed them until they reach appropriate weight and then sells them at a higher price. He decided to ask for a loan so he could purchase a milk cow. He plans to use the money to purchase a good breed, so he could later use this cow for further breeding.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new goods

loans.name: Kalsoom Akhtar Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom akhtar baji is the group leader of this group of four ladies. She is a very responsible lady. These ladies handle their businesses to financially support their households. Kalsoom baji  is applying for a loan to buy material (cooking oil, lentils and spices) for her husband’s food selling business.

Of the other ladies, Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food selling business, Fozia baji wants a loan to buy medicines to sell, and Gulnaz baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food selling business

loans.name: Aterei C Aanyu Helen Group

texts.en:
A. Helen is 46 years of age. She is a widow with eight children schooling and, in addition, she takes care of three dependents. She deals in produce: groundnuts (peanuts), sorghum, etc. So far, she has been three years in her business.

Helen is using the loan to purchase more produce such as groundnuts and sorghum for sale. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is improving her farm productivity and purchasing a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase produce such as groundnuts and sorghum for sale

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda A. is married and has 12 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Matilda is a fishmonger who smokes fish and sells both fresh and smoked fish in Torkor near Kpando. She has been in this business since 2006. Her husband is a fisherman with a small canon that makes him catch fish in small quantity. 

Matilda is solely responsible for all the financial needs of herself and that of her 12 dependents. Matilda will use the loan to buy more fresh fish from other fisherman to smoke as a form of processing and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Matilda plans to reinvest.

loans.use: Matilda will use the loan to buy more fresh fish from other fisherman to smoke as a form of processing and sell

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
M. Lê Thị (616991178) is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four adult children.

M. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 1999, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

M. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 10th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Mojisola

texts.en: Mojisola lives in Lagos. She rents DVDs and also sells frozen food like turkey and chicken. She has been in business for the past five years. Mojisola has been borrowing from lapo for the past two years and she has been investing the loan in her business. She hopes for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more DVDs and frozen food like chicken and turkey to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more DVDs and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Hanidena

texts.en:
Hanidena Q. is a 57-year-old widow who lives with her four children in Pangarap Village, Caloocan City. Her husband passed away a few years back so she was left with caring for and rearing her kids.

Hanidena has a small general store in front of her house selling various religious items (scented candles, etc.). She also retails distilled drinking water in large plastic containers. She makes P 500 in a day and even more on Sundays.

Joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007 has helped her business stay afloat despite stiff business competition. Hanidena has applied for a new loan of P 8,000 to purchase more items to sell. She is now on her 8th loan.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: More items to sell

loans.name: Valdivia

texts.es:
Valdivia P. tiene domicilio propio en la calle 1 de llojeta el Vergel con su esposo e hijos, los ingresos que ella tiene es por la venta de mantas que ella misma elabora y también los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de papa, el esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil pero en diferentes pueblitos, el crédito que solicita es para la construcción de su vivienda y de esta manera dar comodidad a su familia.

Ya fue cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Valdivia P. lives with her husband and children in their home on First Street in Llojeta el Vergel. She earns money from selling hand-made blankets and on the weekends she works selling potatos. Her husband works as a mason's assistant in different villages. The loan she is requesting is for construction work on her home. These improvements will allow her family to live comfortably. She has already been a client of Impro and paid back her loan on time, so she has access to new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: Ophelia is thirty years old. She is married and has give birth to two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. She is a trader. She trades in food stuffs such as plantain. She sells at the local market and supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys her goods from nearby towns. Ophelia has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy plantain in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 26 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia, y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Aunque es muy joven todavía, Olinda sabe que ya es hora de ganar su propio dinero y salir adelante, es por eso que decidió poner una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual pueda satisfacer la demanda de productos de sus vecinos. Su tienda está bien surtida debido a la buena ubicación que tiene, motivo por el cual los productos que tiene se venden muy rápido.
Lo que más le gusta a Olinda de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Olinda con MFP y espera no fallar en los pagos de sus cuotas; en su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida y solidaria. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para su tienda de abarrotes y así tendrá un mejor stock para ofrecer.
texts.en:
Olinda is a very happy 26 year old young woman. She lives in her own house with her family. What she wants most is to succeed in life. Even though she is still very young, Olinda knows that now is the time to earn her own money and get ahead. That is why she decided to set up a grocery store. She can satisfy her neighbors' demand for products with the store. Her store is well stocked due to the good location she has. That is why the products she has sell very rapidly. What Olinda likes the most about her work is talking with her customers. She has been in this business for three years. She considers the most difficult part to be having to stay all day inside the store without being able to leave. She hopes that her store grows in the future and brings better income. This is Olinda’s fourth loan with MFP. She does not expect to fail to make her payments. In her communal bank she is a very involved and supportive member. She will use the 700 PEN she is asking for to buy more products for her grocery store. That way she will have better stock to offer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo de la Nueva esperanza acudieron a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para pedir el apoyo para incrementar sus capitales para sobresalir a la competencia ya que entre màs surtido tengan mejor venta puedan realizar  y puedan asi sacar a sus familias  ya que de ellos dependen  y ellas quieren sacar a sus hijos avantes  en sus estudios, para que no sufran como ellas y quieren tener mejorar sus sistema de nivel de vida y por ello acuden a que se le apoye.
texts.en:
The group Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) turned to the ASDIR association to ask for support to increase their capital so that they can stand out in the competition. With more supplies they can have improved sales and can help their families who depend on them. They want to move their children ahead in their studies so they will not suffer like them, and they want to improve their living standards. For all of these reasons they look for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase capital

loans.name: Mario Alexander

texts.es:
El joven Mario Alexander M. es propietario de una pulpería ubicada en el departamento de Managua donde vende diferentes tipos de productos los que son comercializados por él mismo. La pulpería se encuentra ubicada en su propia vivienda que requiere de inversión porque ha estado maltratada y es de necesidad reconstruirla para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y también para darle un mejor lugar a la pulpería

Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda y de esta manera brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes en un local amplio y agradable donde atender la pulpería.
texts.en:
Mario Alexander M. owns a mini market, which is located in the Managua department. He sells different types of products. The store is located in his own house. He needs to invest in it because it is battered and needs to be rebuilt. He needs to do this in order to improve his family’s living conditions and to make his store a better place. That is the reason that he is asking for a loan to buy construction materials for his house. This way he will give his family better living conditions. He will also satisfy his customers’ needs and have a larger and more pleasant place to take care of them in the store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Afulilo

texts.en: Afulilo L. is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Sapapalii 2. She is married and has seven adult children. Afulilo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 250 WST a month. In 2007, Afulilo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,120 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to rent land to raise additional crops. Afulilo is now requesting a new loan of 1,600 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the city of Linao Norte Tuguegarao, City. She is 49 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $112  a month as her net income from this activity.

In 2005, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo (Eleazar), de 44 años; tienen una numerosa familia con 8 hijos, de los cuales sólo 7 viven con ellos; Luz de 18, Juan de 16, Cristian de 14, Medalith de 12, Lizbeth de 10, Karen de 6 y Shirley de 4 años.

Su negocio es la venta de las verduras que cultiva su esposo en sus chacras; como habas, zanahoria, espinaca y alverja, pero para incrementar su mercadería también compra de otros agricultores. Adicionalmente, Nery vende comida en su vivienda, pues le gusta mantenerse ocupada y emprende cualquier tipo de negocio que le rinda buenas ganancias.
Sus ganancias son muy buenas y ella se animó a incursionar en el comercio porque su esposo no ganaba lo suficiente para lograr mantener a sus hijos. Por tal motivo, Nery desea crecer en su negocio y no sólo vender verduras, sino también otros productos que demanden sus clientes.

Este es el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere tener ningún tipo de problemas, además está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que es íntegro. Con el dinero que solicita comprará juguetes para venderlos en su pueblo y así aprovechar las fiestas navideñas; también adquirirá comestibles para la elaboración de las comidas que ofrece.
texts.en:
Nery is 40 years old, she lives with her husband (Eleazar), who is 44. They have a large family with 8 children, only 7 live with them - Luz 18, Juan 16, Cristian 14, Medalith 12, Lizbeth 10, Karen 6 and Shirley 4. She sells vegetables that her husband grows on their small farm; like broad beans, carrots, spinach and peas, but to increase their stock she also buys from other farmers. In addition to this, Nery sells food at her home, as she likes to keep busy and undertakes whatever kind of business that brings her good profits. Her profits are very good and she got into business because her husband wasn't earning enough to support their children. For that reason, Nery wants to grow her business and sell not only vegetables, but also other products that her customers want. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is committed to paying all her installments on time, since she doesn't want to have any problems In addition she is very satisfied with the work of her communal bank of which she is a member. With the money she is requesting she will buy toys to sell in her village and so take advantage of the Christmas season. She will also purchase foodstuffs for making the food that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment for sale of toys for Christmas

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 03 ans et a bénéficié de 06 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou N. is a 38-year old woman who is married and responsible for her three children. She has been a member of the village bank in Petit Kandé for three years and has had six loans which she has managed well and repaid. She takes a share of the responsiblity for the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Hebert Francisco

texts.es:
Hebert C. E. de 30 años de edad vive en casa de sus padres junto con su conviviente, ellos aún no tiene hijos ya que su idea es obtener primero sus bienes y poder construir un modulo de material noble en el espacio que sus padres le han brindado para darle una estabilidad al niño.
Su domicilio es en la Palma – Cercado de Ica  su trabajo lo realizan diariamente desde las 8.00 am hasta las 2.00pm en el Club del Pueblo pero tambien cuentan con equipo de sonido que lo alquilan eventualmente para ceremonias.
Ellos gozan de buenas referencias desean el financiamiento para poder invertir en su negocio de gaseosas y golosinas ya que se acerca el campeonato Interbarrio y se llevara a cabo en su centro de trabajo ellos tienen muchos sueños se les ve bastante responsabilidad y ganas de seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Hebert C. E. is 30 years old. He lives in his parents' home with his partner; they do not have children yet and their goal is that in order to provide stability for their child they first want to have some assets and be able to build a permanent construction in the spot his parents have provided them. His home is in La Palma, near Ica. He works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M. in the Club del Pueblo. He also has sound equipment which he rents out for special occasions. They have good references and want this loan in order to invest in their soft drink and candy business now that the inter-city championship is approaching.
