The championship games will be played at his workplace. They have many dreams and are responsible people who want to be able to progress further.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Mahmaisuf

texts.ru: Искандаров Махмаисуф проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, занимается торговлей. Сам Махмаисуф более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупно- рогатый скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Махмаисуф на полученные деньги хочет купить дойную корову и продавать молоко вместе с женой.
texts.en:
Mahmaisuf I. lives in the Yavan district. He is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife is involved in retail sales. Mahmaisuf has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years. He breeds cattle. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock. Mahmaisuf wants to use the money to purchase a dairy cow and sell milk together with his wife.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es:
Esta Señora solicita un crédito para mejorar su vivienda, repararla y comprar laminas de zinc, bloques, cemento, arena, madera para su casita, ya que por medio de este crédito va a poder reparar su vivienda.
Le servirá para tener una casa digna donde vivir, donde vive su familia.
texts.en:
This woman is requesting a loan so that she can improve her home. She needs to make repairs and buy zinc sheet metal, cinder blocks, cement, sand, and lumber. This will allow her to make repairs. This will give her the chance to have a dignified home where she and her family can live.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Serafina Ludys

texts.es:
Serafina Ludys M. V. tiene 42 años y vive en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio en Barranquilla. Está casada y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años. La educación de sus hijos ha sido el mayor desafío de esta admirable mujer, pues los dos padecen de enfermedades que requieren especialistas: tiene un hijo especial (a su lado en la foto) y el otro tiene una enfermedad de la piel y ella siempre está pendiente de ellos, por eso para poder atenderlos trabaja desde su casa en su pequeña miscelánea y refresquería todo el día hasta cuando el cliente lo requiera, ella ora y espera con mucha fe un milagro de Dios: la recuperación total de los dos.
Inició su negocio en el año 1994 y este es su cuarto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en los que ha demostrado su excelencia en el cumplimiento de su plan de pagos;  ella aplica por un  valor de de $2.000.000 para comprar refrescos, ropa, zapatos y cosméticos y para arreglar la vitrina. Tiene varias fuentes de proveedores de sus productos, entre otros, empresas de revistas, tiendas en el centro de Barranquilla y el camión de la Cervecería Águila, cervecería importante de tradición barranquillera. Cuenta con una variedad de clientes, que incluye vecinos, referidos, empleados, amigos y familiares y se sostiene siempre al frente de la fuerte competencia que hay en  su barrio, con atención oportuna y esmerada de sus clientes. Es más, los tres créditos que ha recibido en los últimos dos años le han permitido comprar una vitrina, pagar facturas y acreditar el negocio en mercancías pues, más adelante, sueña con tener un local con almacén bien surtido.
texts.en:
Serafina Ludys M. V. is 42 years old. She lives in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood in Barranquilla. She is married and has two children who are 16 and 14 years old. Her children's education is this admirable woman's greatest challenge. Both of them have illnesses that require specialists. She has a special needs son (next to her in the photo) and the other child has a skin disease. She is always watching over them; that is why in order to take care of them she works from her home with a small variety and refreshment store. She works all day, whenever the customer needs her. She hopes and prays with much faith for a miracle from God: their recovery. She began her business in 1994 and this is her fourth loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has demonstrated her excellence in making payments according to schedule. She is applying for the amount of $2.000.000 to buy beverages, clothes, shoes and cosmetics and to fix her display case. She has various suppliers of her products, among them, magazine distributors, stores from downtown Baranquilla and the Cervecería Águila truck. This is a very important brewery of the Baranquilla tradition. She has a variety of clients, including neighbors, referrals, workers, friends and family. She maintains the business in the face of strong competition in her neighborhood with prompt and conscientious service. In addition, the three loans that she has received in the last two years has allowed her to buy a display case, to pay bills and to accredit the business for merchandise. In the future, she dreams of having a locale with a well outfitted store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, clothes, shoes and cosmetics and to fix the display case

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. sells fried fish at Jukwa. Aba has Junior High school education. She is married and has seven dependants. Her husband works with the electoral commission of Ghana. 

Aba has been selling fried fish for some time now. She buys the fish fresh from the fishermen, comes home to dress it neatly, adds a little spice to it and later fries it for sale to her customers. She provides a helping hand in the upkeep of the entire family. 

Her loan will be used to buy more varieties of fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save in order to further her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Iron Market Group

texts.en:
Hawa T. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Iron Market. She is 60 years old, is married, and has seven children whose ages range from 22 to 45. Hawa did not have the opportunity to go to school.

For forty years Hawa has been selling hardware for construction at the Parker Paint community in Paynesville, Liberia. She sells goods that her customers want in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Hawa started selling with a small amount of funds right after the war and now has more capital. However, she faces problems with others in the market selling the same goods that she sells which makes business slow for her.

Hawa plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more hardware to sell. Her goal is to expand her business and improve her family’s living conditions.



In the photo that accompanies this profile, Hawa is the one holding the sign.  Bendu T. is inset at the lower right.

loans.use: To buy more hardware to sell

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Boldbaatar S., 44, is married and is the father of three children. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian traditional nomadic tent). His oldest two sons, ages 21 and 20, are university students; his youngest son, an 8-year-old, attends a local primary school.

Boldbaatar operates a shoe-manufacturing business with his wife. His oldest son, Bayrsaihan, helps with the business during the summer holidays. Boldbaatar has been operating his business since 1996, and has steadily expanded his business. He manufactures shoes at his home, and sells them in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. With his earnings, he has been paying his two sons' university tuition fees and providing money towards his family’s expenses.

Boldbaatar is an experienced shoe manufacturer who has been in business for many years. He is a very hardworking and honest person. He says, “Now, the most important thing for me is to pay my two sons' university fees until they graduate. After they graduate from university, I am planning to create my own shoe manufacturing workshop.”

Boldbaatar is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of materials used to manufacture shoes.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of materials needed to manufacture shoes

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el centro poblado menor Lives del distrito de Unión Agua Blanca, un distrito ubicado en la serranía de la provincia de San Miguel, en la región Cajamarca, ubicada a cuatro horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar desde que era joven brindando servicio de carpintería, el suele confeccionar todo tipo de muebles a sus clientes y vecinos de la zona, este negocio le ha permitido salir adelante durante todo este tiempo y gracias a el se ha podido hacer cargo de su familia. En la zona el es bastante conocido y recomendado gracias a que siempre realiza sus trabajos con calidad y total responsabilidad.

Marcelino gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza y le ha trasmitido ese gusto a sus hijos que ahora trabajan con el, ellos sueñan con tener un taller a gran escala y distribuir los muebles que producen en toda la región norte del país. Marcelino desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más materiales, de modo que pueda aumentar su producción, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Marcelino es un padre responsable y que durante toda su vida ha dado lo mejor de si para sacar a su familia adelante. El tiene proyectado realizar mejoras en su vivienda, la cual está construida de material rústico.
texts.en:
Marcelino, age 57, lives with his wife and their children in Centro Poblado Menor Lives in the Unión Agua Blanca district. The district is located in the mountainous region of the San Miguel province in the Cajamarca region. It is four and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has worked providing carpentry services since he was a young man. He makes all types of furniture for his customers and neighbors in the area. This business has allowed him to get ahead during all of this time. Thanks to the business he has been able to care for his family. He is well known and recommended in the area thanks to the fact that he always does quality work and is completely responsible. Marcelino likes the work he does a lot, and he has transmitted this enjoyment to his children. They now work with him. They dream of having a shop on a large scale and of distributing the furniture they make in the entire northern region of the country. Marcelino wants to expand his business by purchasing more materials so that he can increase his production. That is why he has requested, for the first time, a loan for 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternative. This will help him achieve his objective. Marcelino is a responsible father. He has given the best of himself during his whole life in order to get his family ahead. He plans to make improvements on his house, which is made of rudimentary material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to increase production in his carpentry shop

location.town: CPM Lives - Unión Agua Blanca - San Miguel - Cajam

loans.name: Yadira Esther

texts.es:
Yadira Esther V. R. es una señora que vive con su cónyuge e hijos en  la municipalidad de Malambo, área metropolitana de Barranquilla. Ella tiene 7 hijos en las edades entre 12 y 30 años, trabaja en la fabricación de fritos y también vende  mercancía variada. Yadira se inició en el negocio de almuerzos desde hace 10 años en Santa Marta, la capital del Departamento del Magdalena, y cuando su esposo fue trasladado a la ciudad de Barranquilla ella decidió irse con él y continuó con su negocio, porque ella siempre ha contado con su respaldo y el de sus hijos;  por eso fue capaz de volver a empezar en un nuevo sitio, donde permaneció por dos años hasta que obtuvo un subsidio de vivienda en Malambo, donde aun tiene su casa y continuó con su negocio de fritos. Como es una mujer emprendedora y empezó a conocer mucha gente, comenzó a vender bolsos, calzado, y artículos para el hogar y también se compró una máquina de coser para poner una clínica de ropa. 
Yadira siempre ha trabajada independiente lo que le permite manejar su tiempo y estar pendiente de sus hijos, junto con su hija de 21 años, aprendió también a trabajar manualidades en foamy, con las que hace figuras decorativas  y obtiene ingresos adicionales cuando hace decoración de productos para fiestas o  embellecimiento de espacios familiares y fabrica artesanias que vende por docenas. 

Se enteró de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y vio una oportunidad para mejorar su negocio, ya que antes cuando necesitaba recursos, buscaba paga diarios, pero aunque les quedó muy bien, se dio cuenta que estos eran bastante costosos y decidió no volver a acudir a estos prestamistas.  Este es su primer crédito con esta organización, por valor de $ 1.000.000 COP, con los que  piensa comprar  25 bolsos, 4 docenas de sabanas, 4 docenas de toallas, 7 docenas de ropa interior y materia prima para los fritos. Su meta es continuar apoyando a su esposo para continuar sacando adelante su numerosa familia, mejorar su nivel de ventas e ingresos para aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Yadira Esther R. V. lives with her spouse and children in the city of Malambo, in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla. She has seven children between the ages of 12 and 30 years old. She prepares fried dishes and also sells various merchandise. Yadira started preparing business lunches 10 years ago in Santa Marta, the capital of the Department of Magdalena. When her husband was transferred to the city of Barranquila, she decided to go with him and continued her business because she has always had the support of her husband her children. For this reason, she was able to start in a new location, where she remained for two years until she received a housing subsidy in Malambo, where she still has her home and continues her frying business. As she is an enterprising woman and she started to meet many people, she started to sell bags, shoes, and household items. She also purchased a sewing machine to open a clothing store. Yadira has always worked independently which has allowed her to manage her time and to care for her children. With her daughter of 21 years, she also learned to create crafts with foam, with which she has made decorative figurines and obtains additional income when she decorates items for parties or creates home furnishing and sells crafts by the dozen. She learned of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and saw an opportunity to improve her business. Before when she needed resources, she looked to the daily pay; although the resources were good, she realized that they were quite expensive and decided not to take part in these lenders. This is her first loan with this organization, amounting to $525, with which she plans to purchase 25 bags, 4 dozen sheets, 4 dozen towels, 7 dozen pairs of underwear and ingredients for fried foods. Her goal is to continue to support her husband to continue to help her large family, increase her sales and income to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for fried foods and raw materials for merchandise, such as 25 bags, 4 dozen sheets, 4 dozen towels, 7 dozen pairs of underwear

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Luisa Emilia González, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos, fricciones, y repuestos de bomba inyectoras, es casada y habita en el barrio san Agustín no tiene hijos a cargo pues ya todos son casados y son independientes, su esposo tiene un taller de fricciones y reparaciones de motor de vehículos.

La señora Luisa Emilia González, lleva ya 3 creditos con CEPRODEL,  y ha sido excelente cliente, con estos financiamientos ha logrado crecer su negocio y ha salido adelante, pues no le gusta depender de su esposo.
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa Emilia González is a merchant who sells automotive parts, brakes, and spare parts for injection pumps. She is married and lives in the San Agustín neighborhood. Luisa does not have children in her care since all of them are married and independent. Her husband has a workshop where he fixes brakes and performs engine repairs on all types of vehicles.

Sra. Luisa Emilia González has already had three loans with CEPRODEL. She has been an excellent client who used her loans to increase her business and get ahead since she does not like having to depend on her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Tita Jainga Group

texts.en:
Tita J. is from the village of Libertad Alto in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Tita is the leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by PMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tita J. Group.

Tita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Tita raises and sells pigs. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10400 PHP a month from these activities.

In 1006, Tita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. Tita is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be Tita's eighth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
Edita es conviviente y tiene un hijo de 1 mes, Edita se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, los ladrillos los vende crudos sin quemar a otros productores, Edita compra la tierra para la fabricación de sus ladrillos. 
Edita es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía hace 6 meses y solicita un crédito de 900 soles para la compra de tierra.
Edita vive en la casa de sus suegros y desea comprar un terreno para su casa, además de comprar un terreno para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Edita lives common-law and she has a 1 month old baby boy. Edita makes bricks and she sells them prior to being baked to other producers. Edita buys clay to make the bricks. Edita has been a member of the Community Bank Los Ladrilleros de Compania for the past 6 months. She is requesting a loan of 900 soles to purchase clay. Edita lives with her in-laws and she wishes to purchase land to build her own house. She would also like to buy land to have a brick factory.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clay.

loans.name: Aisaada's Group

texts.en:
Aisaada S. is the leader of this group. She is 33 and divorced. She has a seven-year-old daughter in school. Four years ago, with the initial investment of 7000 soms, Aisaada rented some land and began to cultivate strawberries. Selling the strawberries she makes 10000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to purchase a cow. Now she wants a loan to continue her business activity. In the future Aisaada plans to purchase a house and save money to pay for her daughter’s education.

Kymbat K. is the treasurer of the group. She is 30 and divorced. She has a son in school. A year ago Kymbat, took money from her relatives, purchased fruit and vegetables, and then resold them at a higher price. She started with an initial investment of 15000 soms and made a profit of 15000 soms. With the loan, Kymbat wants to purchase more fruit and vegetables to resell and make some money. In the future Kymbat wants to open her own grocery store.

Madi S. is 20. Two years ago, with the initial investment of 13000 soms, he started to cultivate strawberries. He made good profit and that profit made it possible for him to purchase twenty sheep for breeding. With money received from the loan, Madi wants to hire labor, which he needs for cultivating strawberries. In the future he plans to get married and then purchase a vehicle.

Raikan C., 50, is a widow. She has raised a son and a daughter; the son works as a security guard and the daughter is married and lives in Kazakhstan with her family. Raikan works in the public hospital. She applied for the loan because she wants to improve her living conditions and purchase household appliances. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Lubys Gertrudis, Lisset Carolina y Margarita conforman el grupo solidario Guadalupe. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Lisset se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio pues fue por iniciativa propia y así con el paso del tiempo es que le ha gustado estar con esta actividad que para ella ha sido muy provechosa esta experiencia ha sido maravillosa para ella al interactuar con sus clientes. En el caso de lubys se dedica a la venta de ropa. Otra integrante es Margarita que se dedica a la venta de golosinas hace mas de 3 años,  sus inicios fueron por cuenta propia pues no tenía un salario para ayudar a sus hijos, por lo que siempre ha sido una mujer muy responsable y junto a sus amigas han decido realizar un financiamiento para comprar la materia prima necesaria para sus negocios pues hasta los momentos tienen muchos encargos.
texts.en:
Lubys Gertrudis, Lisset Carolina, and Margarita make up the solidarity group “Guadalupe”. All of them have different business activities. Lisset has been selling cosmetics for more than five years. She started this business out of her own initiative and spends her time managing it. Lisset enjoys her business and finds it to be a wonderful experience because she gets to interact with her customers.

Lubys sells clothing, while the other member Margarita has been selling candy for more than three years. They started their businesses because they did not have a salary by which they could support their children.

Lisset has always been a very responsible woman, and together with her friends, decided to obtain a loan so that they could buy merchandise for their businesses since they now have many orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mr. Sophy U. (in the photo with his wife), is 47 years and his wife, Mrs. Thet Yun, is 42 years old. They have been married since 1995 and have three children-two sons and one daughter. All the children are in school. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mrs Thet Yun sells dessert in the village. 

Sophy has been driving a motor taxi for a year. He wants to change his business from motor taxi to Tuk Tuk or auto rickshaw because it could carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Hence he is asking for a loan of $800 to buy a Tuk Tuk.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk Tuk.

loans.name: Yinis Miliana

texts.es:
Yinis de 41 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Chinameca, departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera y vive junto a su familia y tres hijos de 15, 12, 8 años de edad, ellos dependen económicamente de Yinis y ella se dedica a la confección de ropa oficio que aprendió por su madre quien le enseño la sastrería, atiende su taller de lunes a domingo todo el día su mayor ventaja es que confecciona los uniformes de las escuelas cercanas. Yinis está solicitando un préstamo para la compra telas de diferentes marcas y colores así como las necesarias para confeccionar los uniformes escolares, este préstamo ayudara a fortalecer su taller ya que contara con el material necesario para realizar su trabajo.
Las proyecciones de Yinis son, obtener una nueva máquina para mejorar sus costuras, atender más clientes, ayudar a sus hijos para que se preparen con estudios superiores que les permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Yinis is 41 years old and lives in the municipality of Chinameca, located in the department of San Miguel. She is a single mother and lives with her family and three children who are 15, 12, and 8 years old and are economically dependent upon her.

Yinis works making clothing, a trade that she learned from her mother who taught her how to tailor. She works in her tailor’s shop all day Monday to Sunday, and her biggest advantage is that she makes the uniforms for schools nearby.

Yinis is requesting a loan for the purchase fabrics that are of different colors and brands, such as those needed to make the school uniforms. This loan will help her to strengthen her tailor’s shop since she already has the materials necessary to do her job. In the future she wants to get a new machine to improve her sewing, have more customers, and help her children prepare themselves with university studies so that they can improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora P. is 50 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. She is from the town of Lopez Jaena in the province of Misamis Occidental on the Mindanao islands. Teodora runs a store from which she sells animal feed and farm-related products to the local community. Teodora has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008 Teodora joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Teodora successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Teodora is requesting a new loan, her fourth from PMPC, of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional animal feed and farm-related products

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Khem S., age 40, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that she buys from fishermen and earns an average of US$3 a day. She has been running her business for many years. Khem S. is the mother of three teenage children, all of whom are students in public school. The main family income is from her husband who is 36 years old and uses his car to pick up passengers for a profit. Unfortunately, his old car breaks down during operation, and his income drops. To solve this problem, Khem S. wants a loan for her husband to replace his broken car.

loans.use: To replace a broken car.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis Angel B. Milán tiene 35 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.   Tiene 3 hijos.

Luis pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Luis  se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar tierras u un carro.
Le gusta  visitar a la familia y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Angel B. Milán is 35 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. He has three children.

Luis is a member of the Guantucoto Communal Bank, which is located a half hour from Guaranda. This group engages in farming and ranching, especially corn and potato production in the mountainous areas as well as in the coastal region where rice is grown. The Communal Bank has 25 members.

Luis has been farming for several years, growing potatoes and corn. He also raises and sells livestock animals. Luis buys his supplies in Guaranda and sells at the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing corn and potatoes. With the help of this loan, he will have the financial resources to acquire necessities for his family. The challenges he faces include pests and diseases that can impact his crops. His dream is to buy more farmland and a car.

Luis enjoys visiting his family and playing sports.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing potatoes & corn

loans.name: Karina Esmeralda

texts.es:
Karina, posee una tienda llamada Kevin, está casada y tiene un hijo D. 14 años, residen en Jiquilisco, departamento D. Usulután, ella comenzó con el negocio muy pequeño, eran pocas las cosas que ofrecía pero hoy han pasado 8 años y este negocio esta mucho mas fuerte con bastante mercadería para atender a los clientes,  pero ella quiere seguir progresando es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra D. una refrigeradora, ya que la que tiene ya le queda pequeña para guardar la mercadería que necesita refrigeración.
Este préstamo le ayudara a almacenar más cosas como bebidas ya que últimamente ha tenido mucha demanda. Ella sueña con generar mas ventas con los clientes, para ir fortaleciendo económicamente el hogar y puedan vivir mas cómodamente.
texts.en:
Karina owns a store called Kevin.  She is married and has a 14 year old son.  They live in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  

She started out small with her store, and only offered a few things, but eight years later, the store is much stronger and has enough merchandise to satisfy her customers.  She would like to continue improving her store, so she is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator.  The one she has now is too small to store all of the merchandise that needs to be refrigerated.  This loan will help her stock more things like drinks, that are in high demand.  

She wants to generate more sales to strengthen herself economically and be able to live more comfortably.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Marie Cecile

texts.fr: Cécile a 52 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien de profession. Elle a en charge 4 enfants. Pour arriver à participer au foyer, elle exerce comme activité la vente de produits d'alimentations générale et articles de mercerie.  Son Etablissement sis à Bè-Kpota où elle habite en même temps. A travers cette activité, elle a eu des prêts qui ont été remboursés.  Elle sollicite au près de WAGES un crédit pour faire augmenter son commerce.
texts.en: Cécile is 52 years old and is married to a mechanic.  She has 4 children in her care. In order to contribute to household expenses, she has a business selling general food products and sewing notions. Her enterprise is located at Bè-Kpota where she also lives. She has had loans for this business that have been repaid.   She is requesting a loan from WAGES to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food products and sewing notions

loans.name: James Ogutu

texts.en:
James O. is a single 28-year old livestock farmer in the Kibos area located on the outskirts of Kisumu City, along the shores of Lake Victoria. 

James rears goats for sale to butcheries in the city of Kisumu, and also for their milk, which is loved by many in the area because of its high quality. He enjoys working on his goat farm, which he has managed for the last three years with success. He makes a monthly income of 28,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) which he uses to support his siblings. 

He is requesting a third loan of 50,000 Kshs, which he will use to buy more goats as a way to expand his business and increase his portfolio. James will use the profits to further his education so that he can gather skills to manage his business. Specifically, he hopes to attain some educational levels in agriculture because this will give him new ideas and skills to manage the goat business. 

He hopes that a Kiva lender will help him attain his dreams and desires.

loans.use: To buy more goats for rearing.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Veronica La socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, la socia trabaja administrando su restaurante de nombre las Brizas, ella  trabaja directamente con los almuerzos, las extras y viendo todo el menú del día, la socia también apoya en las mezas y la atención directa de los clientes, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y viene siendo parte de este banco comunal desde hace 4 años, la socia aprendió a ahorrar y a producir ella ahora requiere el préstamo para así poder implementar su restaurante y comprar los productos básicas que salen a diario como es el aceite, el arroz, azúcar, harina fideos y otros y poder abastecerse y comprar al por mayor, la socia desea poder comprar los productos para continuar con su negocio de restaurante. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos básicos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the "NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA" (Urubamba's New Dawn) community bank which is located in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Veronica is 35 years old.  She lives with her partner and has three children.  She runs her own restaurant called 'Brizas'.  She works directly with the lunches, extra dishes and set meals.  She also provides support at the tables and deals directly with the customers.  Veronica is a very hard-working woman and she has been a member of her community bank for 4 years.  She has learned to save and produce.  She requires this loan so that she can keep her restaurant running and buy basic products that are used every day such as oil, rice, sugar, flour, noodles etc. She would like to stock up, buying her supplies wholesale.  She would like to buy products to continue in her restaurant business.  She is requesting the loan to invest in buying basic products.

Veronica is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in buying basic products

loans.name: Cristhian Gonzalo

texts.es:
Cristhian es un padre de familia muy dedicado al trabajo, así como al comercio para poder cubrir todos los gastos.
Hoy en día esta laborando en zona franca de operario en donde ofreces sus productos de cosméticos ya que tiene varios años en el negocio, y captado clientes en su área de trabajo, a si como el ingreso de una casa en la capital de Managua que alquila. Logrando poder dar a sus cinco hijo lo necesario en alimentación y estudios.
Hoy en donde habita ha hecho su casa de concreto con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado mediante créditos, lo que está contento por hacer posible una vivienda mejor.
 Con este nuevo crédito hará un cuarto, en donde tiene comprado arena y piedrín. Lo que comprara piedras, cemento, hierro, para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a father who is very dedicated to his work as a salesman to be able to meet his family’s expenses.
At present, he is working in a free zone selling makeup and has done so for several years and acquired many regular customers. Cristhian also has income from a house in Managua that he rents. He has been able to give his five children all that they need for their food and studies.
Cristhian lives in a home built out of cement with loans received from Afodenic (Kiva’s field partner) and he is very happy to have a better place to live.
With this new loan, Cristhian will build a room and he already has the sand and gravel. He will buy stones, cement, and iron to begin his work.

loans.use: To buy construction material to build a room adjoining his home.

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.es: El Sr. Wilbert vive en la localidad de la guardia, es nacido en los valles de Cochabamba, es de ocupación chofer propietario de moto taxi, trabaja en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, hace unos 10 años que se dedica a esta labor, su esposa se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir en uno de los  mercados mas concurridos de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, no tienen hijos por el momento pero es uno de sus deseos para mas adelante ya  que están trabajando para darle la comodidad necesaria; el destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción y así poder terminar de construir su vivienda, se sienten agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Wilbert lives in the town of Guardia and was born in the valley of Cochabamba. He is an owner of motor taxis and has been working in the city of Santa Cruz for 10 years. His wife makes clothes in one of the busiest markets in Santa Cruz. At the moment they do not have any children but they plan on having children in the future when they will have more to offer them. They are planning on using the money on construction material to finish building their home. They are very thankful for the help offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy construction material.

loans.name: Brisas Del Xolotlan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Brisas del Xolotlan  lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Magela del Carmen M. M. quien tiene una venta desde hace 8 años el cual inicio con poco vendiendo chiverías y gaseosas. Actualmente ella vende varios productos en su negocio y en la compra de mercadería es que invertirá el crédito. 
Las otras integrantes son Ana Rosa M. Montes quien vende ropa desde hace tres años y Juana R. vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The “Brisas del Xolotlan” group is composed of three hard working women.  One of them is Magela del Carmen M. M. who has had a grocery store for the last 8 years.  She started out with very little selling snacks and soft drinks.  Currently she sells a variety of products in her store and she will use the loan to buy merchandise.

The other group members are Ana Rosa M. Montes who has sold clothes for the last three years and Juana R. who has sold clothes and cosmetics for the last three years.

loans.use: For basic grains.

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es:
Elsa madre soltera, sus hijos son independientes y le ayudan con algunos gasto del hogar, desde hace un tiempo inicio su propio negocio y fue con ayuda de lo préstamo en la financiera que logro establecer su pulpería, se le presenta dificultades cuando se enferma se mira obligada a cerrar.
Sus planes son aumentar las ventas mediantes la inversión de nuevos y variados productos.
Con el préstamo comprara mercadería variedad como: golosina, refrescó, lácteo, jabón de lavar, abarrotes, granos básicos entre otros productos.
Agradece a la financiara por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y cambiar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Elsa is a single mother.  Her children are independent and help her with some household expenses.  She started her own business some time ago.  With the help of a loan she managed to set up a grocery store.  However, it is difficult when she becomes sick because then she has to close her store.

Elsa's plans are to increase her sales by investing in new and varied products.  She will use this loan to buy a variety of merchandise including candies, soft drinks, dairy products, washing powder, groceries and basic grains.  She is grateful to the financial institution for the support they have provided to her in making progress in her business and changing her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Eufracio

texts.es: El señor Eufracio, con el dinero del préstamo comprará los artefactos para un baño completo; su esposa es costurera y él es policía. Viven en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en la zona Alto Tacagua de La Paz. Tienen dos hijos.
texts.en: Eufracio wishes to buy a toilet and sink in order to complete the bathroom in his home.  His wife is a seamstress and he is a policeman.  They live in their own house located in the Alto Tacagua zone of La Paz.  They have two children.

loans.use: TO BUY A TOILET AND SINK FOR THE BATHROOM IN HIS HOUSE

loans.name: Green Apple Group

texts.en:
Mariam J., who is in her late thirties, is married with three children who all attend school. She has operated a fruit and vegetable business for three years. Mariam works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. Her dream is to one day open a wholesale shop for selling sodas only.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Green Apple", which consists of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mariam is in the bottom row on the right, wearing a blue and white scarf.

loans.use: to buy more items for her stock

loans.name: Jose Rufino

texts.es:
José, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 15 años de experiencia, trabaja todos los días y aprendió esta labor por medio de su padre.
Está en proceso de comprar lo necesario para la siembra y solicita un préstamo para adquirir abono y fertilizantes, dicha compra ayudara a tener los insumos necesarios y poder llevar a cabo la siembra de maíz.
José le gusta mucho su trabajo pues lleva mucho tiempo dedicándose a ello, esta labor la ha ayudado a mantener a su familia y cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
José lives in San Rafael Oriente, in the San Miguel department, with his wife and two children ages 6 and 2. He cultivates corn and beans, and has 15 years of experience. He works every day and learned this work from his father. 

He is in the process of buying the necessary items for sowing, and is requesting a loan for the purchase of manure and fertilizers. This purchase will help him to have the necessary income in order to go through with sowing corn.

Jose enjoys his work greatly, as he has done this for quite some time. This work has helped him to maintain his family and provide for their needs.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Walter Emmanuel

texts.es:
Walter, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel,  vive con su esposa y su abuelo, no tiene hijos y se dedica a la agricultura, el trabajo se lo enseño su abuelo y hoy día sostiene los gastos del hogar por lo ingresos que recibe, los terrenos que cultiva son propios  y no tiene un horario fijo para trabajar.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos, estos materiales son muy necesarios para realizar la siembra y uno de sus riesgos son las condiciones climáticas.
Aspira diversificar el negocio, crecer en sus cultivos, mejorar el nivel de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Walter lives in El Transito, department of San Miguel, with his wife and his grandfather. He has no children and works in agriculture. His grandfather taught him and today he meets his household expenses with the income he receives. The land he farms is his and he does not have a fixed timetable to work. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers and manure, materials much needed during sowing. Weather conditions can pose a risk. Walter aims to diversify his business, grow his crops and improve the quality of life of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es: Félix Alberto se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Tiene más 21 años en este negocio. Es una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su actividad, por lo que tiene que levantarse todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. El sueña con realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, el tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solamente 4 están a su cargo. el motivo del crédito es para la compra de redes, cuchillos, mejoras a su motor, gasolina, entre otras herramientas necesarias.
texts.en: Félix Alberto works selling seafood and has been in this business for more than 21 years.  He is a very hardworking person and enjoys his job, for which he has to get up every day at 7am and work until 6pm.  He dreams of making housing improvements and has he five children, four of whom are his dependents.  The purpose of this loan is to buy nets, knives, gasoline, and other necessary tools, as well as to make improvements to his motor.

loans.use: to buy nets, knives, and gasoline, and to make improvements to his motor.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 16 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Halima has a decorations sales business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Halima has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more decorative flowers for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Halima hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop.
Halima is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more flower decorations for resale.

loans.name: Dole Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 janvier 1997. Il est  composé de huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Aramata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (nourriture).
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on January 7, 1997. It is comprised of eight women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.

Ms. Aramata, who is at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's official. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She also supports three other children entrusted to her by her parents. She is active in selling vegetables. She has good experience in this business domain in which she has been working for several years. 

This loan will enable her to bolster her capital and to develop her business further. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (food).

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Jogie

texts.en:
Jogie is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Jogie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, noodles & snacks. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more snacks, beverages & canned goods to sell.

Jogie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce is a 49-year-old widow with eight children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a landlady for ten years and got her initial capital from selling sugar cane. Her main challenge is delayed rent payment. Her vision is to own another commercial (rental) house and to educate her family. Peluce is requesting the loan facility to renovate her commercial house.

loans.use: to renovate her commercial (rental) house.

loans.name: Estrudez

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ertrudes. Ella tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y fruto de relación tiene un hijo de 17 años, el cual está  estudiando el primer semestre  en la  Universidad Técnica de Manabí. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella se es una muy buena ama de casa que para tener sus propios ingresos se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño bar en donde vende bebidas como: gaseosas, aguas, enegizantes, cervezas y batidos de frutas, también prepara y vende empanadas, hamburguesas, entre otros bocadillos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que lleva 16 años dedicada a su negocio y que le va muy bien y además se entretiene  en el.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar: gaseosas, bebidas energizantes, aguas, cervezas, pan, carne y otros ingredientes. Es socia del Grupo de Crédito desde el inicio hace varios años y le gusta porque se entretiene con sus compañeras en las reuniones y por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. 

Su sueño es que su hijo sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
The “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother for a Better Future) communal bank meets every two weeks in 24 de Mayo Canton in Manabí Province known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, the variety of its fauna and for its kind, hard working residents who are farmers and raise livestock.

We met Ertrudes, 56, here.  She’s married and has a 17-year-old son who is in his first semester at Manabí Technical University.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She is a very good housewife who, in order to have her own income, is a merchant.  She has a small snack bar where she sells such beverages as: soft drinks, water, energizing drinks, beer, fruit smoothies.  She also makes and sells turnovers and hamburgers, among other fast food snacks.  She works every day from 8am until 7pm and she tells us that she’s been in this business for 16 years and does very well.  Besides, she has fun with it.

She will use this loan to buy soft drinks, energizing drinks, water, beer, bread, meat and other ingredients.  

She’s been a member of the communal bank since the beginning several years ago and she likes it because she has fun with her fellow members at the meetings and because of the help she gets from the loans.  Her dream is that her son becomes a great professional.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, energy drinks, water, beer, bread, meat and other ingredients.

loans.name: Tiessiri Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe TIESSIRI II sont de femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 36 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et qui vivent dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, un chef lieu de commune rurale dans la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, SALI, la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de main d’œuvre pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the TIESSIRI II solidarity group are married women who average 36 years of age and four children each. They live in polygamous families in Banco, country seat of a rural town in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali).

They have partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. Their crops include rice and groundnuts. This is their first time collaborating with the MFI.

With this first loan, SALI, standing first from the right, plans to purchase inputs and small farming equipment, and pay for the labor needed to maintain approximately 0.50 hectare of groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele composed of both men and women. The group members intend to earn an average profit of about 25,000 FCFA per season.

loans.use: to buy inputs and small farming equipment, and pay for labor

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh was born in 1974. She is married with two children who are going to school. Her husband is a soldier. He has a monthly income. Mrs Anh has a store at home where she sells various things to peopL. in her village. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Since 2010 she has participated in SEDA. 

The last time she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This time, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to repair her store. She is the leader of 4-member group loan in SEDA.

 About other borrowers in her group:

 Ha is 30 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy groceries.

 Linh is 30 years old. She has two children. She is a tailor. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy cloth.

 Lan is 24 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to repair her store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia  de 61 años de edad tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 31 a 35 años con los que sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas. Ella tiene un salón de belleza idea emprendedora que inició cuando se separó de su esposo hace 28 años, y decidió capacitarse para ser autosuficiente y genera bienestar a sus hijos. En su negocio ofrece como servicios el mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional de todos los géneros y en todas las edades, pues sus líneas son corte de cabello, manicure, pedicure, maquillaje, desrizado, peinados y su asesoría es su principal valor agregado. Desde hace 18 años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante 17 créditos, con los cuales  ha logrado mejorar sus instalaciones y ofrecer espacios confortables a sus clientes y sobre todo tener productos en existencia, que vende a sus clientes que lo soliciten. Su credikiva es el financiamiento # 18 que hace a esta organización, con él panea, hacer mantenimiento de sus muebles, como silletería giratoria pues han aumentado sus clientes y requiere otras más, y va aprovechar  las que tiene guardadas, igualmente comprará insumos en volumen para atender su demanda. Su meta más adelante es lograr nuevos puestos de trabajo y estabilidad sostenida, para lograr la apertura de otros puntos de servicio. Mientras esto ocurre, Sonia maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 34 días y desde allí planea su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 61, has three children ranging in age from 31 to 35.  She dreams of seeing them become successful people.  She has a beauty salon.  This enterprising idea started when she separated from her husband 28 years ago.  She decided to get training in order to become self-sufficient and productive for her children’s well-being.

In her business she offers services to improve the self-image and professional services for both genders of all ages.  Her services are cutting hair, manicure, pedicure, make-up, straightening, and hair styling.  Her advice is her main value added.

She has been connected to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through 17 loans.  With the loans she has managed to improve her business location and provide comfortable spaces for her customers.  Above all, she has the actual products on hand, which she sells to her customers that request them.

This is her 18th Kiva loan.  She plans to use it for maintenance on her furniture like the styling chair.  She has more customers, and she needs more of them.  She will make good use of the ones she has stored.  She will also buy supplies in volume in order to meet her demand.

Her goal for later is to get new work stations and sustained stability.  She wants to open other beauty shops.  Meanwhile, Sonia manages an accounts payable turnover of every 34 days.  From there she is planning her growth.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to her furniture like her salon chair and to buy supplies in volume.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine  is 47 years old. She has six children who are ages 3-20 years old. She sells fresh milk and she has been selling milk for the past four years. This business has enabled her to meet her family's needs. She needs a loan to buy more milk for sale in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy milk for sale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with one child who is still young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity bit not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated an electronics shop business. Neighboring community members are her customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase electronics for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase electronics for resale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old and is married with six children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Helen has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan request. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from computer games.

Helen aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Dervina

texts.en:
Dervina is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Dervina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Dervina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Dervina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with seven children, six of whom are enrolled in school while one is still too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanarusi has operated a poultry selling business for the past five years; she operates her business from home and her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of lack of enough capital to invest in her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 55-years-old. She is married with 5 children. 

Esther has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Esther has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Esther hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta nació en la  ciudad de Ollantaytambo y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Asunta tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Asunta desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo.   

Asunta se dedica a la venta de comida y tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado. Ya son cuatro años dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad Asunta requiere el préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas. 

Asunta se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Asunta was born in the city of Ollantaytambo and lives in the same city where she was born.   Asunta is 38 years old, married and from the fruit of this union, she has two children.

Asunta works at her daily and economic tasks in the city of Ollantaytambo.  Asunta works in food sales and has a food stall in the market.  She has been working at this business for four years already and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business.  For this opportunity, Asunta requires the loan to purchase tables and chairs.   

Asunta finds herself grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium and likewise she promises to complete with the payments according to the timetable .

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Angayu W G Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Angayu W.Group in Western Kenya! Everlyne is the facilitator of the Angayu W.group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Everlyne takes care of one child at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a very good maize yield, harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Everlyne will educate her child and invest in business and livestock rearing as future savings.

In 2012, the members of Angayu W. group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Everlyne with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members. Faith has a business selling tomatoes.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Faith sells her products at the market, retail.     

Faith has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes. The main business challenges for Faith   include transportation, perishability, and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and start selling wholesale only and also start growing tomatoes herself           

 Faith   lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Angela Maricel

texts.es: La señora Ángela a sus 34 años de edad se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y productos de papelería en un pequeño local que acondicionó con los pocos ahorros que tenía en la sala de su casa hace aproximadamente un año cuando vio esta necesidad en los habitantes de la vereda en la cual vive. Desde entonces a beneficiado a toda una comunidad la cual antes tenia que hacer un recorrido de 2 horas para poder conseguir lo que necesitaban. Con el ánimo de seguir brindando comodidad y buen servicio a su comunidad, la señora Ángela necesita de la compra de surtido de útiles escolares con los que pueda complementar su papelería y seguir siendo una líder positiva en su comunidad.
texts.en: Ángela is 34 years old.  Her business is selling school supplies and stationery products from small premises that she fitted out in her living room, with a small amount of savings that she had.  She started her business approximately one year ago when she saw the need that existed among the people living in her district.  Since then, her business has benefited an entire community who used to have to travel for two hours to get what they needed.  With the aim of continuing to provide convenience and good service to her community, Ángela needs to buy a stock of school supplies which she can use to complement her stationery products and continue being a positive leader in her community.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
Cliente de de 44 ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant , a l'arrêt de ses etudes en classe de terminale, elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie en 2000. 
Ses potentiels  clients , les gens du quartier et les passants .Ayant deja bénéficie de plusieurs prêts de Hope  elle va de nouveau prendre un autre prêt et renforcer la capacité de son activité en ajoutant des ballots  de marinières, des habits pour enfants et des adultes,  Elle rembourse ses prêts sans trop de difficultés et a des épargnes considérables.

Tres célèbre dans le quartier,elle tient a aller loin, elle s'occupe valablement de son foyer et aide a payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Josephine is a 44 year old client. She is married and has one child. After her studies in secondary school, she began selling secondhand clothing in 2000. Her customers are people who live in the area and passersby.

Having already received several loans from Hope, she is now asking for another loan to grow her business by increasing her stock to include bundles of long-sleeved shirts as well as clothing for babys and adults. She pays back her loans without much difficulty, and she has considerable savings.

Very well known in her part of town, she wants to go far. She takes great care of her family and helps pays for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un joven de 25 años, está casado y vive en una casa construida a base de adobe. Juan se dedica a la producción de cacao y café orgánico en el terreno que sus padres le heredaron donde viene trabajando hace más de 3 años. Se considera un joven muy trabajador ya que se encuentra en una edad adecuada para escoger un rumbo laboral e iniciar a trabajar buscando estabilidad económica. Considera que el cacao orgánico es una buena fuente de inversión siempre y cuando se aplique un trabajo adecuado por tratarse de una planta algo delicada teniendo que realizar tareas como retiro de maleza, aplicación de abono orgánico entre otros. Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es de adquirir un terreno y cumplir con el sueño de mejorar su vivienda esperando construirlo con ladrillos y cemento para el bienestar de su familia. Es el segundo préstamo que solicita a Kiva y espera contar con su apoyo para seguir adelante. En está ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la segunda campaña productiva con la compra de abono orgánico y contrata de trabajadores del lugar para las diversas tareas rutinarias.

loans.use: Comprar abono orgánico y contratar a trabajadores del lugar.

loans.name: Justin

texts.fr: Marié à une revendeuse du nom de Eugénie et père de quatre enfants,tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple, Justin est âgé de 28 ans. Justin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Justin subvient ensemble avec sa femme aux divers besoins du ménage. Justin a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Justin achète des noix de palme qu'il transforme en huile de palme et qu'il revend à son domicile depuis quatre ans. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer aux diverses charges de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son activité, Justin sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des noix de palme.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is a 48-year-old man who raises pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for four years. Roger is from the city of Baybay, Leyte. He is married and has one child who already grown up. Roger needs to work hard to provide for the needs of his family. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy feed as well. In the future, Roger aspires to augment his livelihood to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Ablavi A. is the mother of three children who are still in school. Her husband's retirement pension does not ensure that family needs are totally covered. So Ms. A. is obliged to contribute to their household income by selling corn and sodabi (a local distilled palm wine). Having a good handle on her business, she is doing well. But her capital funds are quite insufficient to develop her business. No longer able to meet the expectations of her customers with the funds that she has, she is therefore requesting a loan of $650 as capital to build a substantial stock of corn and sodabi. The loan will allow her to raise her economic and social living standard for the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Ablavi est mère de trois (03) enfants encore en scolarité. Les pensions de retraite de son mari n’assurent pas une totale couverture des besoins de la famille. Alors Madame A. est obligée de contribuer à partir des revenus de son commerce de maïs et de sodabi (boisson locale à base de palmier). Maîtrisant bien son activité, elle arrive à bien s’en sortir. Mais, son fonds de commerce est très insuffisant pour développer et accroître ses activités. Ainsi, ne pouvant plus satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle avec ses propres moyens, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce à faire un stockage consistant de maïs et de sodabi. Ce crédit lui permettra d’élever son niveau économique et social pour le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and stock corn and sodabi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Shania wants to expand her business by buying large quantities of beads of different varieties.

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en: Khuraman H. is 49, she is married and has two children. She has a very small business: she sells bath accessories. She is going to broaden her business and start to sell children's clothes. For this purpose she has borrowed $1200 USD.

loans.use: Mrs. Huseynova would like to broaden her bath accessory business and start to sell children's clothes.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid M. is a 50-year -old car mechanic. He finished engineering at the university and since that time he has worked in the car repair shop. Vahid lives and works in Imishli town, in the southern part of Azerbaijan.

Vahid is married and has 3 children. Most cars in Azerbaijan are Russian brands, but in the last few years, the situation has changed and many people prefer to purchase and drive foreign-made cars. Vahid has to adapt to his customers' demands. Three years ago he had spare parts only for Russian made cars, but he was going to lose his permanent customers because most of them had exchanged their cars for foreign-made ones. So Vahid got training in repairing foreign-made cars and is going to purchase spare parts for foreign-made cars so that he can increase his clientele.

Vahid is considered the best car repairman in the city and so as not to lose his reputation, he has applied for a loan of US$ 900 to purchase new spare parts for foreign cars. That will allow him to better serve his customers.

loans.use: purchase new car spare parts for foreign made cars

loans.name: Miguel Percy

texts.es:
Percy, who is 19 years old, has enjoyed financial independence for the past 3 years, since inheriting a small farm from his father. With his mother's help, he took over the farm and is now seeing the results of his hard work. He now has another challenge that he would like to overcome.

Because he's aware that hard work and hands on experience alone won't be enough to accomplish his goals, he has made the decision to attend a local university to study agriculture and learn to improve his planting and harvesting techniques.

He's seeking a loan of $100 to increase the quantity of products he will plant before embarking in his academic career. This way he will be able to rely on the income from his harvest while he attends school. Together we can make this motivated young man's dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Percy, a sus cortos 19 años de edad goza de independencia económica gracias a la chacra que heredó de su padre hace 3 años, después de cumplir la mayoría de edad decidió iniciar el trabajo en sus campos de cultivo gracias a la ayuda de su madre, hoy puede ver los frutos de su trabajo; sin embargo aún tiene una gran prueba que asumir. Consciente de que no sólo la experiencia podrá brindarle frutos más adelante se ha propuesto estudiar la carrera de agronomía en la universidad que acaban de instalar en su pequeña localidad , próximamente con el fin de mejorar sus sistemas de siembra y cosecha. Actualmente requiere la suma de 100 dólares para incrementar la cantidad de productos que va a sembrar de esta manera luego de la inversión que se propone hacer iniciará sus estudios en la universidad teniendo como soporte económico la suma de dinero que obtendrá por la cosecha de sus productos. Juntos podremos hacer realidad los sueños de este impetuoso joven.

loans.use: To purchase seeds

loans.name: Arlen Carolina

texts.es:
This young entrepreneur, head of a family, with a strong desire to get ahead, has set up her own business in the wholesale market. From the age of twelve, this young woman was working as a street vendor selling coffee and bread. As the years went by, the income she earned as a street vendor was no longer sufficient to cover her needs. The idea of starting her own business was born from that recognition.

Four years ago, Arlen started this business with 213 USD in capital, money that she had saved during a long time, with a lot of sacrifice. With her sales and effort she has succeeded in buying the stall where she runs her business and making improvements to it.

CEPRODEL has been working with Arlen for 3 years; she has received 16 loans. As an institution CEPRODEL believes that it is extremely important to support enterprising young people like Arlen, since their initiatives generally wind up creating jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Esta joven emprendedora, Jefa de familia y con grandes deseos de superación ha colocado su negocio propio en el mercado mayoreo. Desde los doce años esta joven ha trabajado de vendedora ambulante vendiendo cafe y pan, sin embargo al pasar de los años estos ingresos no fueron suficientes para cubrir sus necesidades, de ahi nace la idea de colocar su negocio.

Desde hace 4 años empieza este negocio con un capital de US$213.00 mismos que ahorró durante mucho tiempo y con sacrificio. Con sus ventas y esfuerzo logra comprar el tramo y acondicionarlo.

CEPRODEL trabaja con Arlen desde hace 3 años y su record es de 16 prestamos. Como institucion CEPRODEL cree de suma importancia apoyar este tipo de jóvenes emprendedores, cuyas iniciativas generalmente se vuelven generadoras de empleo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mary Brito

texts.en:
Mary is thirty-two years old, and she and her husband have four children. Mary runs a beauty salon in her house. She operates the business five days a week. She does not yet have a well-established clientele but is working hard to get new clients.

She has requested a $175 loan to buy a new blower and a chair hair dryer for the salon. Mary says if business is very profitable, she will buy a small generator to help deal with the frequent power cuts in her neighborhood. That way, she will be in a better condition to compete with other beauty salons in the neighborhood. Additional income will help her improve her family´s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for a small beauty salon

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is forty-five years old and runs a cafeteria in her community. She is also the mother of five children. Everyday, from early in the morning to late into the night, people in the surroundings visit her cafeteria to get traditional Dominican meals she prepares with love. Cecilia has been running the cafeteria for more than three years, and currently has a well-established clientele.

Cecilia plans to expand her business and hopes in five years’ time that she will have a big locale where she can operate a comfortable cafeteria. With her loan, she will make the purchase of raw materials to keep producing her delicious meals for her customers.
