loans.use: To buy raw materials and other materials to move a small cafeteria forward.

loans.name: Florence Ranti

texts.en: O. Florence Ranti is married with 3 children. She comes from the Okoko Area of Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and foodstuffs, a trade she learnt for six months. She has been in business for 4 years. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more foodstuffs and drinks for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village C(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nancy Z.. She is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase in bulk. Nancy is 36 years old and is married. Her husband has a hardware shop. She has 5 children ranging from ages 4 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Nancy makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Nancy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her clothing business and the loan was paid back on time.

Nancy is joined in her small group by Mariam N. and Winnie A.. Mariam N. has a business selling water and sugarcane and wants to add more stock and purchase a water tank. Winnie A. is currently operating a public pay phone business and selling clothes and wants a loan to buy another phone and more clothes.

loans.use: To increase clothing purchases

loans.name: Džemila

texts.en: Džemila lives in Lukavica, a small village near the town Živinice. She is married and her husband has a full-time job as a driver for a local company. His salary is about $300 a month. They earn another $300 a month by selling milk to a local dairy. Dzemila has applied for her second loan from MCO WWI, and plans to use this loan to buy another cow for her farm and thereby increase her family's monthly income.

loans.use: To increase her family's income by buying another cow.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has a small business selling shoes at a busy market in Kahovka, Ukraine. Her attractively arranged vending kiosk is well stocked with popular shoe styles. Anna has had her business for about five years. She makes about $300 per month, a lower middle income wage for Ukraine.

Anna has requested a short term loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to help purchase a new supply of shoes to sell. The change of seasons is a busy time of year for many market vendors like Anna. This loan will help her to meet demand and continue to make a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase new shoe inventory

loans.name: Yakubjon

texts.en: M. Yakubjon has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008. He lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan, a high mountain region where livestock and yarn businesses are particularly developed. Mr. M. is engaged in the commercial services and livestock sales businesses which are his family's main source of income. Of the two, he is particularly experienced in the livestock sales business. Mr. M. has now applied for financial support for his existing businesses, asking for a loan of US$625 for a term of four months. He plans to use the money for business development.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Tip

texts.en: Mr. Tip P. and his wife, Mrs. Soeurn Yem, are farmers in Sarekakeo Village in KamP. Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, Mr. Tip P. is a bed maker. They have six children, two of whom are attending school, while the remaining four are too young to work or study. Mr. Tip P. now faces an obstacle because he has insufficient number of cows to plow his rice field; therefore Mr. Tip P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy another cow to help him plow his field. Previously, Mr. Tip P. obtained a loan from Prassac Co., Ltd to buy a cart which he successfully paid off. His wife, Mrs. Soeurn Yem, is currently sick and Mr. Tip P. spends $250 for her health costs. For this reason, Mr. Tip P. does not have enough money to buy a cow to plow his field. Mr. Tip P. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy another cow to plow field

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry S. (53) is a widow with two children. Her first daughter has full employment in Phnom Penh, and the second daughter who is a weaver who is married and lives in the family. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ry S. has been a silk weaver for twenty-one years, a skill she learned from her neighbour. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Исматова Парвина жительница района Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 29 лет. Занимается бизнесом.Имеет магазаин , который арендует уже три года. Торгует продуктами питания. Парвина не замужем и живет в родительском доме , с родителями. Она одна  обеспечивает семью. Бизнес развивается  , и поэтому она планирует получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Parvina I. lives in the Jaloluddini Rumi district. She is 29 years old and a businesswoman. For three years already she has been renting a store where she sells groceries. Parvina is not married and lives with her parents in their house. She alone supports the family. The business is growing, so she decided to obtain a loan and increase sales. The loan will be paid back over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Metodio

texts.es: Metodio es un hombre entregado a su trabajo y a su familia, gracias a sus terrenos puede cultivar grandes cantidades de  plantas de café, plátanos y frutos cítricos, los cuales son un gran soporte en la economía de su hogar.  Adicionalmente, viaja regularmente a la ciudad de Pucallpa, parte de la selva, donde abundan las tortugas, las cuales trae a vender a su región, de igual manera distribuye pescado en los mercados.  Metodio no es de las personas conformistas, todo lo contrario, es de las personas que se proyecta, y está constantemente pensando en su la mejora de su calidad de vida.  Ahora desea incrementar su producción, para ello requiere de 1000 soles, cantidad que solicita en calidad de préstamo, para que siga creciendo como agricultor y en la venta de animales.
texts.en:
Metodio is a man dedicated to his work and his family. On his land he grows large quantities of coffee plants, plantain bananas, citrus fruit, all of which contribute greatly to his household finances. He also travels regularly to the jungle town of Pucallpa, where there are a lot of turtles that he transports back to his own region to sell. He does the same with fish that he sells in the markets. Metodio isn’t the conforming type, quite the contrary. He is the kind of person who plans ahead and is constantly thinking how he can improve his quality of life. Now he wants to increase production, for which he is asking for a loan of 1000 soles. The money will be used to expand his farm and to buy and sell animals.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in his coffee crops and for the buying and selling of animals

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Sophy P. is 27 years old and the mother of two children.  Her husband (located right in the picture), Kong Vanny, is a traditional healer who makes a small income to support the family. Sophy is a villager in the Ta Saom Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and a cow breeder. Since the cow breeding business is going well, she would like to expand it, and is asking for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding.

loans.name: Kazimoto Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid S. is a 35-year-old divorced woman with 2 children (ages 18 and 10). She has a business where she sells charcoal and firewood, which she started 5 years ago. She works on a daily basis from 7 am to 6 pm daily, and by doing so she is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $160.

Mwanaid has already received one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand and improve her business, and she proudly states that she promptly repaid that loan. Now, she is seeking a second loan to increase her inventory by buying more charcoal and firewood. Notably, Mwanaid would share the loan proceeds with her loan group, Kazimoto, which totals 24 members. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay his or her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. In the picture, Mwanaid is squatting third from the left.

loans.use: To further expand her business by purchasing additional firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man O., 55, grows crops for sale. She grows morning glory vegetable and sells in the market, and has been growing since 1995. She is married to Mr. Chuch Ie with five children, four of whom are married and one daughter is single, working in a garment factory. With much experience growing morning glory, her business is going well so far and can support her family sufficiently. Because of insufficient farmland to grow the crop for sale, O. needs to rent the farmland from her neighbors by paying rent annually. Hence, she now would like to request a loan to pay for renting farmland, purchase seeds, and to build a gate to protect her crops.

loans.use: a loan to pay for renting farmland, purchase seeds, and to build a gate to protect her crops

loans.name: Djonoro

texts.en:
Djonoro S. is 39 years old. She is a widow and has four children. Djonoro is running a catering business where she is providing meals consisting of the national cuisine. She’s renting her catering room which is located in the central local market which allows Djonoro to have many customers, the majority of whom are those making purchases in the market.

Every day she purchases the freshest foodstuff and cooks delicious dishes. Her daughters help her with the business. Now she is asking for a loan of 3200 Somoni with a term of 12 months in order to expand her business so as to earn enough to be able to send her children to the university next year. She will use the loan for buying flour, oil and other foodstuffs. She thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dreams become reality!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour, oil, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
Leopoldo inició el negocio  por la necesidad de salir adelante ya que lo liquidaron en una Agencia donde trabajaba y por su edad era muy difícil conseguir empleo así que decidió dedicarse a las ventas y empezar a trabajar por su cuenta para poder sacar adelante a mi familia. Comenzó el negocio en Abril de 2007 manejando un Taxi y no le iba mal pero su hermano vendía ropa y el veía que tenía muchos clientes y sus ganancias eran buenas, entonces platico con él y lo apoyó para que el también se dedicara a vender ropa usada. Comenzó comprando una paca para ver como le iba y la vendió muy rápido, por lo que  en corto tiempo ya tenía muchos clientes. 
Desde que inicio a la actualidad le ha ido bastante bien, tiene muchos clientes y a la vez muchos pedidos y ya esta acondicionando un local que le rentan para poder vender ahí también la ropa además de seguirla ofreciendo a domicilio como siempre lo he hecho.

El necesita un préstamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas que lo ayudará a comprar más pacas de ropa para surtir pedidos y tener una mejor surtido que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leopoldo started his business out of the need to get ahead since being let go from the agency where he used to work and because his age makes it very difficult to find a new job. For these reasons he decided to begin working alone in sales to help his family get ahead. He began a business in April of 2007 driving a taxi, and it didn't go too badly for him. Meanwhile, his brother was selling clothing and he saw that he had many customers and good earnings, so he talked about it with him and his brother helped him get started selling used clothing. He began by buying a bundle of clothing to see how things would go and sold it very quickly. In just a short amount of time he had many customers. From the time he began up until now things have gone pretty well for him. He has a lot of customers and at the same time many orders and is now working out of a rented spot to be able to sell clothing there in addition to selling it door to door as he has always done. He needs a loan of 5,000 MXN ($350 USD) that he will repay in eight installments (within 3 months) that will help him buy more bundles of clothing to meet requests and have a better selection to offer to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of clothing

loans.name: Kenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Kenia C. es una dama que se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora dedicándose a su negocio de venta de cosméticos los cuales son vendidos por ella misma en su localidad en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León.

Ella ha decidido mejorar su negocio y al habérsele agotado la mercadería ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de los cosméticos. Al habérsele brindado dicho crédito logrará mejorar su condición económica y saldrá adelante en la venta de los cosméticos.
texts.en:
Kenia C. is a woman who has distinguished herself through the hard work and dedication she has put into her cosmetic sales stand, which she runs in La Terminal market in the city of Leon. She has decided to improve her business by buying cosmetics in bulk, and is seeking the support of Ceprodel to cover the upfront costs. With this loan, she believes she will be able to further her business and improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Odalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Odalia del Carmen T. R. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Odalia tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Odalia es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica este negocio, por lo que su negocio surge por la necesidad de poseer una fuente de ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Odalia son de proporcionar a sus clientes la mejor calidad de ropa. 
Es por eso que solicita financiamiento es destinado especialmente para capital de trabajo por lo que viaja hasta Managua en busca de la mejor calidad de ropa. Es por eso que sus sueños son de mejorar cada día con su negocio para satisfacer completamente a sus clientes. La cantidad que solicita es de C$9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Odalia del Carmen T. R. is 36 years old, single, and has 3 children who all study. Mrs. Odalia's business is buying and selling clothing. She began this business more than 4 years ago out of the necessity to provide a source of income for her family. Mrs. Odalia's intention is to provide her customers with the highest quality of clothing. It is for this reason that she asks for a loan, which is specifically intentioned for labor capital. She travels to Managua to search for the highest quality clothing, and her dream is to improve her business each day to completely satisfy her customers. The amount she requests is 9,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Ifayatu

texts.en: Ifayatu sells drinks and plantain. She makes most of her profit from the sale of drinks. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more drinks to sell. She is 35-years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and plantain to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is 32 years old, and is married with a son and a daughter, both of whom are in primary school. She lives with her two children and husband in a rented apartment in the farming/commercial town of Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer and she works to support him financially.

Lydia is a trader in jewels of all kinds and childrenswear. She sells at her local market as well as trekking to other towns to sell on their market days. Lydia buys her materials from wholesalers in Accra. She has been in business for four years now, and is requesting a loan to purchase goods in bulk in order to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase jewels

loans.name: Issah

texts.en: Issah M. is a married 60-year-old father of six children. Currently two of his children attend school and the others are working.  Issah lives with his family in Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Currently he has a shop in the community market where he operates a corn and vegetable milling machine.  Lots of food vendors come to him for milling.  Unfortunately the machine has been breaking down constantly and preventing him from servicing his clients. This has reduced his profit margins drastically and he is therefore appealing to you for loan assistance.  He will use the loan to repair the existing milling machine and buy new ones. He would be grateful for your assistance. He belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means See What the Lord Has Done.

loans.use: To repair and buy milling machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of cement and construction supplies

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina Q. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through junior high. Celestina sells silverware and other cooking utensils at Zion in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1999. Her husband is a trader. 

Celestina uses her income to pay for her child's school fees, clothing, utility bills and other family expenses. Celestina will use the loan to purchase more goods, including silverware and cooking utensils for resale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Celestina plans to support her husband in saving towards a house they want to build for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods, including silverware and cooking utensils for resale.

loans.name: Ganiyu

texts.en: Ganiyu sells bottles and she has been in this business for a long time. She is 55 years old and married to A., who sells motor spare parts, and they have six children. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bottles to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more bottles to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia C. E. tiene 53 años. Es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos. Que ya no dependen de ella. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que fue una necesidad para proveerles a sus hijos el alimento y vestimento diario. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Por lo que lucho muy duro para alcanzar lo que ha logrado hasta los momentos con su actividad económica, con estos ingresos ha podido sufragar los gastos de su familia y le proporcionado lo necesario a sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y  gaseosas. Su meta es expandir su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Eugenia C. E. is 53 years old. She is the single mother of 3 children, who are no longer dependent on her. For more than 5 years she has worked in her business; it was necessary to provide her children daily food and cloths. She runs a general store. Because she fought hard to reach her achievements in business, she has been able to meet the family costs with her profits, and provide for the basic needs of her children. The loan that she is requesting is for working capitol to buy candy, juice, bread, and soda. Her dream is to expand her business to improve her quality of living.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capitol

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is fifty-three years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. Cecilia is a trader. She trades in sewing accessories such as thread, needles, linings, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She also hawks and treks to sell. Cecilia has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy sewing accessories in bulk

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio R. tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a la elaboración de muebles de madera y también en la construcción y reparación de viviendas.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia ya que tiene tres hijos pequeña y mediana edad, a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta material para terminar y empezar la elaboración de unos pedidos que tiene pendientes para entrega, pero Don José no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar los muebles que tiene que entregar. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar los pedidos y entregarlos a tiempo y así sus clientes estarán satisfechos y lo  podrán recomendar lo con otras personas 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que generar el negocio con está inversión.
texts.en:
Mr José Antonio R. has spent over six years making wooden furniture and constructing and repairing houses. This business is the source of income for his family. He has three young and teenaged children and he wants to give them the best. The business needs material to start and complete the construction of some pending orders to deliver, however José does not have enough money to produce the furniture that he has to deliver. Because of this, he is applying for a loan to fulfill the orders and deliver them on time. If he can accomplish this, his customers will be satisfied and could recommend him to other people. He plans to pay for this loan with the income the business will generate from this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in material for his business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the Lord of Cachuy village bank.  She is 27 years-old, married, and has two children.  The children, ages 9 and 10, are both studying in the public school. 

Patricia did not finish school because she became pregnant, and was then married.  After some time, she began to work for a friend who had a business with a market stand.  Since her friend frequently traveled to Spain, she sold her stand to Patricia.  Patricia started off month by month, growing little by little, and slowly supplied her business.  

Through FINCA Peru, Patricia has learned to be punctual, responsible with her payments, and she has learned to invest her money.  Patricia needs a loan of 800 Soles to buy backpacks and other items for her stand.  Her dream is that her small business grows to become a large business.

loans.use: Purchase backpacks and items for her stand

loans.name: Sar

texts.en: Sar T. is 39 years old and resides with her husband and her children in the Takeo province. Together with her husband are local teachers at state school. They typically make a combine around US$4 of profit every day. This couple has two children who are at school. To earn an additional profit, Sar T. is asking for a loan of US$600 to raise pigs and purchase the feed for them as well. This will help improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Raise pigs.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em T., 37, is married with three children living at home in Phnom Penh. She owns a grocery store, typically making US$1 each day.  Her husband, Chan Hoeun is a construction worker who  builds houses. He typically makes about US$4 each day. Em T. would like a loan of US$500 to reinvest in her grocery business.

loans.use: To reinvest in her grocery business

loans.name: Virginia Leandra

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia  es cliente desD. el año 2001, ella trabajo en grupo solidario "Olivos" durante 18 secuencias, actualmente se encuentra en su 11 ava secuencia como individual, ella se dedica la venta D. varios productos en su tienda y tambien como una sucursal en la venta D. huevos, el esposo es jardinero y albañil y muchas veces viaja, quedando ella a mando del hogar, tiene 5 hijos pero ya independientes, solo la última estudia en la Universidad, cubriendo su mamá con los gastos,la señora Virginia es una cliente muy responsable y puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Virginia has been a client since the year 2001; she has worked in the communal bank "Olivos" for 18 loan cycles. Currently she is on her 11th individual loan. She sells a variety of products from her store, and also has another business selling eggs. Her husband is a gardener and bricklayer and he often travels, leaving her in charge of the home. She has 5 children, but they are already independent except for the youngest, who studies at the University where his mother covers his expenses. Virginia is a very responsible client who makes her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mataiumu

texts.en:
Mataiumu L. is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga. She is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Mataiumu owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Mataiumu has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 180 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mataiumu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mataiumu is now requesting a loan of 750 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Mataiumu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou S., 51, is married with four children. He resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with his wife (pictured) and children.

Both S. and his wife are employed in a private company producing cigarettes, earning an income of approximately US$4 each per day. The family is also assisted by three of their children who are currently employed at different workplaces. These sources of income from S., his wife, and the children help cover the family expenses especially that of his children’s education in the future.

S. and his wife are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$900 to repair parts of his house to rent.

loans.use: To repair part of his house to rent

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito C. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 48 years old. Juanito is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Juanito owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Juanito has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juanito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanito is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juanito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a forty year old married mother of four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. She works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. Jane is a merchant who sells ladies’ underwear and children's clothes. She sells door-to-door and treks to nearby towns to sell. She procures the goods from Accra. Jane has been in business for eleven years and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk.

loans.use: to buy underwear in bulk

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: H. Hélène est née en 1975 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Hélène vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Houinmè dans le quatrième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Mariée à ALI Nassirou un chauffeur, Hélène est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Hélène vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure les charges de la famille. Hélène a très peu fréquenté. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Hélène vend divers produits (couscous, pâtes alimentaires, lait, sucre, papier hygiénique, sardines, amuse gueule, riz, etc.) à son domicile. Hélène vend également des produits de cheveux (mèches, pommades, défrisants, huile pour cheveux, etc.), ce qui lui permet d'avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. C'est au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, et à Kétou, dans le département du Plateau au Bénin, que Hélène se ravitaille. Hélène a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Hélène n’arrive plus à bien répondre à la demande de tous ses clients. En vue de renforcer son capital et d’élever le niveau de son activité, pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, Hélène sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Hélène was born in 1975 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She has been living for ten years in the Houinmè quarter, in the 4th district of Porto-Novo. Married to ALI Nassirou, a chauffeur, she is the mother of two children who are both in school. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple ensures that family expenses are covered. Hélène had very little schooling. To meet her different responsibilities, she sells a variety of goods (couscous, pasta, milk, sugar, toilet paper, sardines, tasty snacks, rice, etc.) out of her home. She also sells hair products, such as hair extensions, ointments, straighteners, hair oils, etc. This allows her to have several sources of revenues. She stocks up on supplies at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, and in Kétou, in Plateau county, Benin. Hélène once obtained an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid. She is no longer able respond well to the demands of all her customers. With regard to boosting her capital and raising her level of business, so as to satisfy her customers more, Hélène is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods (sardines, pasta, sugar, couscous, rice, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 30 years old and is still single. She lives in Nyarugenge, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Francoise has been in the business of selling a variety of goods, mostly used at home, for about two years and the hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Francoise is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing a variety of items used at home as the photo indicates. With this loan, she will purchase more items, especially those used for cleaning the house and washing clothes, as those goods seem to be highly in demand. Francoise hopes that it will increase her sales as well as her profits.

With these profits, Francoise will reinvest them in the business for the purpose of building her secure future.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her store

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn J. is from the village of BAYBAY, LILOY. She is 31 years old. Jonalyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jonalyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jonalyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately  PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jonalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Jonalyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jonalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. JADEE NOEMI, VIVE EN LA ZONA D. TRAPICHE, EN EL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO, TIENE 30 AÑOS D. EDAD Y TIENE DOS MENORES HIJOS. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "AMIGAS UNIDAS" JUNTO CON 10 PERSONAS MAS Y HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑERAS COMO LA PRESIDENTA D. GRUPO.
JADEE NOEMI, SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO D. COSTURA, TIENE UN PEQUEÑO TALLER EN SU DOMICILIO.
ELLA INICIÓ TRABAJANDO EN EL TALLER D. UNA VECINA, AHI APRENDIÓ A REMALLAR, LE AGRADÓ MUCHO EL TRABAJO Y PARALELAMENTE CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD EMPEZÓ A ESTUDIAR CORTE Y CONFECCIÓN.
CON EL FRUTO D. SU TRABAJO PUDO ADQUIRIR SU PRIMERA M ÁQUINA D. COSTURA CON LA CUAL CONFECCIONÓ POLOS PARA LA VENTA, LOS CUALES OFRECIÓ PRIMERO A SUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS MAS CERCANOS.
HOY EN DÍA TIENE UN TALLER EN SU CASA Y SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR POLOS PERO EN MAYOR CANTIDAD. CON ÉSTE TRABAJO ELLA HA LOGRADO TENER UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA, LO CUAL LE PERMITÉ PAGAR UNA MEJOR EDUCACIÓN PARA SUS HIJOS.
CON EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO, INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. TELA PARA CONFECCIONAR MAS PRENDAS D. VESTIR.
texts.en:
Jadee Noemi lives in the Trapiche zone, in the Carabayllo district. She is 30 years old and has two young children. She is part of the "Amigas Unidas" group along with 10 other people and has been chosen by her colleagues as president of the group. Jadee Noemi is a seamstress. She has a small workshop in her home. She started off in the workshop of a neighbor and there she learned how to mend. She liked the work a lot and at the same time started to study how to cut and sew. With the fruits of her work she was able to buy her first sewing machine with which she maD. t-shirts to sell, which she first offered to her family members and closest friends. Today she has a workshop in her home and she makes t-shirts but in greater quantities. With this work she has been able to achieve financial stability, which has allowed her to pay for a better education for her children. With the loan requested, she will invest in material to make more clothing items.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials.

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en:
"The following social metrics for Fialelei N. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

Fialelei N. is 64 and widowed with 11 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Fialelei has 5 years of experience in this business.  Fialelei needs a loan of WST $3000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 800 talas or US $333 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Fialelei joined SPBD.    This is her 5th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Fialelei's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of food products and basic necessities

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: Nergui B. is 56 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent) in Tuv province, Mongolia. All of his children are grown up and live separately from them. Nergui's wife, Tsend-Ochir, receives a pension from the government. Nergui earns his living by operating a taxi service business. He has been operating his business since 2005, and is an experienced driver.  He spends his earnings on his family. He has been planning to expand and renovate his winter house. Nergui is a very hardworking and honest person. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to repair the car that he has been using for his taxi service.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Raquel Francisca

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 5 años  de tener su negocio.  Aprendió el negocio de elaboración de pan y nacatamales desde que tenía 3 años.  Su papa antes tenía panadería pero fracaso y, luego, después de casarse y tener dos hijos Raquel inicio el negocio de nuevo.  Ahorra también hace y vende nacatamales.

Raquel a podido salir adelante ampliando su negocio gracias a préstamos que ella ha logrado en el pasado.

Raquel tiene 28 años de edad y vive en El Sauce.  Ella está casada y tiene 2 hijos en la escuela.  Su meta es llegar a tener una panadería grande para tener una base solida de ingreso familiar y construir un propio local para el negocio.
texts.en:
Raquel has had her business for five years. She learned to make bread and nacatamales when she was three years old. Her father owned a bakery, but it failed. After marrying and having two children, Raquel restarted the business. Now she also makes and sells nacatamales. She’s been able to expand her business and move it ahead, thanks to her previous loans. She is 28 years old and lives in El Sauce. She is married and has two children in school. Her goal is to open a large bakery in order to create a solid income base for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Magaly

texts.en:
As someone who has always enjoyed fashion, Magaly, a Venezuela native, decided to start her own fashion sales business in 2006.

Magaly has worked hard and sacrificed to get through the recent tough economic times. "I hope ACCION USA realizes how hard I worked to make my business a success," she told us. "Many of my clients have gone out of business, but I'm still here." She's negotiated better deals on the clothing she buys wholesale, pounded the pavement to find new clients, and made sure to keep her current clients happy. Her business has survived and is now ready to grow.

In order to qualify for lower prices, Magaly now has to place larger orders with her suppliers. To finance these larger orders, she needed extra capital. Fortunately, she qualified for a loan from ACCION USA. Using the proceeds of her loan will not only save her money, but it will allow her to offer her clients a wider range of sizes, expanding her business.

loans.use: To expand her clothing inventory

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred T. is from the village of Lam-an, in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Mildred is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Mildred owns and operates a Xerox copier business. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

 In 2010, Mildred joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional materials that will be use for her Xerox copier. This will be Mildred's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her xerox copier

loans.name: Dionisita

texts.en: To make a living, Mrs. Dionisita T. is presently engaged in a snack vending activity. She is 40 years of age, married but separated, and blessed with one child who is still an infant. She is receiving support from her live-in partner who is a driver named Ponciano Pilapil. She is from Barangay D. Fernan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Dionisita has been in this business for two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Just this year, Dionisita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Dionisita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP. This time she is requesting a loan of 5,500 PHP as her second loan to be used as additional capital for her snack vending activity. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family: specifically, to meet their basic needs, save for future use, make loan repayments, pay for insurance and her child’s education and for possible business expansion. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her snack vending activity

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is 34 years old and married with one child.  He sells cereals and animal feed.  His shop is called Jermu Cereals Store. He opened the store three and a half years ago.  He also does farming to supplement his income.  He previously serviced a loan of 40,000 KES.  He used the loan to renovate his business premise.  He has requested a new loan of 80,000 KES to buy maize and beans.  He hopes to purchase a lorry for transporting cereals in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Janylbu's Group

texts.en: Janylbu A. is the leader of the group. She is 54 and a widow. She has raised two sons and two daughters. The older daughter works in Russia, the second daughter is married and lives separately with her family, the first son is a constructor and the second serves in the army. Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Janylbu started to sell corn. She makes 5000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to improve their living conditions. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase corn in order to resell it at a higher price. In the future, Janylbu plans to expand her business and open a sales point in Bishkek. Eliza K. is the treasurer of the group. She is 31 and married. She has a son and two daughters, all of whom are at school. Five years ago, with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Eliza opened a kiosk near her house and started to sell convenience goods. She makes 6000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a variety of goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the near future, Eliza plans to purchase a vehicle. Duriyakan N., 52, is a widow. She has raised two sons and two daughters, all of whom are married and live separately with their families. In 1995, Duriyakan started to breed cattle and then she began to resell the cattle on the animal market. She made good money and since that moment, Duriyakan has been breeding cattle and reselling them after fattening. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase cattle in order to resell them, after fattening, at a higher price. Bulbulkan K., 46, is married. She has two sons and three daughters. Her younger son and the younger daughter are at school and the other children are married. Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Bulbulkan started to take orders and sew national clothing from dressmaking supplies. In this way, she makes 5000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a sewing machine. In the near future, she plans to open her own sewing workshop. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Ramula

texts.en:
Ramula is a 35-year-old lady and single mother to three children aged 10, 15, and 17 years old. She is the sole provider for her family and she has three other dependents. She lives in her own home in Masindi, Uganda.

She is a fishmonger and has been doing this for 14 years. She started with a small capital now it has grown to to higher levels. She faces a hardship of fishing laws which some times restrict her sales. She expects her business to grow in future and even to start supplying other markets. She wants the loan to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en: Melissa L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 36 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Melissa runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melissa also grows pigs for fattening and sale. Melissa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melissa is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy store inventory and pig feed.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy B. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Pateno, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fish-vending  business. Her husband, Jerry B., who is 40 years old, works as a fish vendor and driver. They have three children who are 14 to 17 years old. Mary Joy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Joy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her twelfth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save for the future economic security of her family. Mary Joy B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund fish-selling operation

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA sont  toutes  des   femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt passé à été bien remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers  tels  l’huile alimentaire avec ADIARATOU B., les condiments alimentaires, des poissons , des tissus et des boissons non alcoolisées.
ADIARATOU B. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 bidons d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso. L’huile est vendue en famille et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant, en détail et quelques fois à crédit  . 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont la totalité sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The ten members of the KOTOGNOGOTALA group are married women who average 30 years of age and two children each. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, a district of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is their second time collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. The first loan was fully repaid. 

They sell sundry items such as condiments, fish, fabrics and non-alcoholic beverages. ADIARATOU B. sells cooking oil.

With the loan, Adiaratou B. plans to buy 10 cans of oil. She gets her stocks at the big market of Sikasso. The oil is then sold within the family, and also at the market, at retail, to a clientele of men and women, for cash and sometimes on credit.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 40 000FCFA to be fully re-invested in her activities.

loans.use: To buy oil

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31 year old single man who lives with his parents. He has been working on air conditioning and ventilation projects since 2004. This hard worker has taken advantage of a previous Kiva loan to replace and repair his work equipment. This borrower is pleased with his decision to take a loan from Ameen and feels that his previous loan amount was sufficient for his business needs. He has been a reliable borrower with consistent, on-time repayments. 

Today, this borrower is requesting to $2000 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.A.. to increase his business capitA. and purchase new air conditioners in order to continue to expand his business and increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase new air conditioners

loans.name: Jose Ibaldo

texts.es:
José de 48 años, es vendedor informal de electrodomésticos (aparece en la foto con su esposa), vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar esta ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Por la necesidad de tener dinero para su familia el invirtió sus ahorros en artículos para el hogar y electrodomésticos para comenzarlos a vender a sus amigos y conocidos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y ayuda de su esposa quien lo acompaña a vender los electrodomésticos ha podido seguir con esta actividad, trabajando desde muy temprano. Comprar los electrodomésticos en una distribuidora a un bajo costo para así venderlos a sus clientes. Vende televisores, cocinetas, licuadoras etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar licuadoras, televisores para tener mas surtidas sus ventas. En el futuro quiere terminar de arreglar su casa, y tener un pequeño local par ala venta de sus electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
José is 48 years old and is an informal salesman of appliances (he appears alongside his wife in the photo). He lives in a semi-urban area with all the public services available. His home is located inside the Guayaquil perimeter surrounded by a salt marsh. 

In order to earn money for her family, he has invested his savings in household products and appliances to start selling them to friends and acquaintances. Little by little with hard work and help from his wife, who accompanies him when he sells, he has been able to continue this business. He purchases his appliances from a distributor at low costs and then resells them to his clients. He sells televisions, stovetops, blenders, and other appliances. 

With the loan he will buy blenders and televisions to have a better inventory of products. In the future he hopes to finish making improvements on his house and have a small store to sell his appliances.

loans.use: Appliances (blenders, televisions)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 06 hijos (04 dependientes), estudió educación primaria completa.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de animales en general.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá  para comprar animales menores.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener más capital y ser ganadera.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank "Punta Sahuacasi" located in the district of Azángaro, province of Azángaro, department of Puno. She is 44 years old, married and has six children (four dependents). She completed elementary school. 

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past year. Her first loan was for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, money which she used to increase her business capital for selling animals in general. 

María is requesting a new loan of S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, money which she will invest in buying small animals. 

Her dream for the future is to have more capital and to be a livestock farmer. 

What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings and the trainings.

loans.use: To buy small animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Marie-Claire

texts.fr: Marie-Claire K. a 53 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a 6 enfants entre 18 ans et 30 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour la réparation de l’immeuble d’habitation.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’éviter de locataires douteux sans ressources financières.  Elle voudrait améliorer le secteur agricole, construire d’autres maisons a louer, et ouvrir une activité commerciale.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait permettre a ses enfants de bien poursuivre les études jusqu'à université.  Marie-Claire est aussi agricultrice, et elle voudrait devenir un membre d’un coopératif.
texts.en: Marie-Claire K. is 53 years old, a widow, with six children between 18 and 30 years of age. Four of her children study. She is going to use her loan for repairing her house. Her strategy for growing revenues is to avoid unreliable tenants who lack financial resources. She would like to improve her agricultural business, to have other rental houses built, and to open a store. For her family, she would like to allow her children to continue their studies through university level. Marie-Claire is also a farmer, and she would like to join an agricultural co-operative.

loans.use: Housing repairs

loans.name: Nadjiba

texts.ru:
Nadjiba S.  45 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnoqo rebonka kotoriy uchitsya v universitete. On jivet v qorode Baku vmeste s mujem i rebonkom. 
Nadjiba seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit svoy magazin chtobi ona moqla pomestit tuda bolshe  raznix tovarov. Nadjiba uje 15 let kak rabotayet v etom biznesse prodaji pishevix produktov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey teti.
texts.en:
Nadjiba S. is 45 years old. She is married and has one child who goes to university. She lives in the city of Baku together with husband and child.

Nadjiba needs 2000 AZN right now to expand the space in her store so that she can include more produce there. Nadjiba has been doing this business selling food products for fifteen years now. She has learned this business from her aunt.

loans.use: То еxpand store space

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 55 años vive en compañía D. sus 3 hijas en su casa propia. DesD. hace 10 años tiene su tienda D. comestibles, actividad que le ayudo en su economía y a mantener sus otros trabajos, como la agrícola y ganadera. Trabaja todos los días en la atención a los clientes, en ocasiones sus hijos la ayudan en el negocio, y cada semana se abastece D. nueva mercadería para tener siempre su tienda repleta D. mercancía. Con el  en el paso D. los años le ha permitido crecer un poco más en su economía además que disfruta día a día D. realizar esta actividad comercial que se complementa a las demás actividades que ella realiza: como es la agricultura y crianza D. animales. A futuro desea seguir desarrollando esta actividad hasta tener una tienda más granD. y mejor implementada. Es su crédito numero 14 con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda y con otra parte en un nuevo negocio que ha empezado que es  la venta D. medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
Luisa, 55, lives with her three daughters in her own house.  For the last ten years she has had a grocery store, an activity that has helped her economy and her other jobs: farming and cattle raising.

She works every day taking care of customers.  Sometimes her children help her in the store.  Every week she stocks up on new merchandise so that the store will always be full of goods.  As the years have passed her economic situation has improved thanks to it and she enjoys this commercial activity which complements her other occupations, like farming and raising animals.

In the future she’d like to continue developing in this business reaching the point of having a larger, better stocked store.  This is her 14th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial help and she has always been responsible with her repayments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.

She thanks those people who will fund the loan she is asking for which will be very useful for her store’s progress.

She plans to use this loan to buy merchandise for her store and part of it for a new business she’s started: the sale of natural remedies.

loans.use: To stock her store with new products and to buy natural products.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel  tiene 45 años de edad; es soltera y que reside junto a su familia  en el distrito de Paiján perteneciente a la Provincia de Ascope ubicado en la región de la Libertad, que esta a más de tres horas de la cuidad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida.  Con estas actividades ella  solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda  de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Isabel ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Isabel es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Isabel is 45 years old.  She is single and lives with her family in Paiján district, in Ascope province, in La Libertad region, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Isabel has a small grocery store in her home.  There she offers her neighbors and local customers staple products, essentials and groceries.  Her business is very popular.  Through her business she covers her financial expenses and helps her family.

Isabel's store is experiencing growing demand so she would like to expand it, acquiring more products.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Isabel is a hard-working woman of very good character.  People who know her think very highly of her and are very fond of her.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis  vivía antes en la Sierra, el padrino de su esposa  tenía varias panaderías en Guayaquil  y le ofreció  quedarse y desde entonces viven en Guayaquil (hace 14 años aproximadamente). Su trabajo lo realiza el y su familia. Empiezan desde las 4:00pm hasta las 9:00pm. Unas de sus dificultades son los ladrones, la competencia que existe en el mercado  con respecto a la tienda, ya que en panes vende cerca de 900 diarios.

Está  casado y su esposa también lo ayuda en el negocio y tiene 3 hijos 14, 12, 16 y 2 estudian pero el mayor ya se salió del colegio pero no sigue la universidad. Con el préstamo  piensa comprar harina, huevos y manteca.  Sus metas es que su negocio prospere, y desea poner un cyber  y su hijo mayor y  que sus 2  otros  niños  sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Luis used to live in La Sierra.  His wife’s godfather had several bakeries in Guayaquil and offered him the opportunity to stay.  Since then they live in Guayaquil (about 14 years approximately).  The work is done by himself and his family.  They start at 4pm and go until 9pm.  One of the difficulties is robbers and the competition his store has in the market since he sells almost 900 pieces of bread daily.

He is married and his wife helps him in the business.  He has three children who are 14, 12 and 2 years of age.  The oldest has left high school and has not gone on to university.

He plans to use the loan to buy flour, eggs and lard.  His goals are that the business prosper and he wants to set up an internet café and that his oldest son and two other children continue in school.

loans.use: For flour, eggs, lard.

loans.name: Las Madres Group

texts.es:
El grupo las madres lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Darling del Socorro Dávila de 30 años quien se dedica al comercio de anteojos de sol y accesorios para celulares (carcasas, auriculares, etc.) Ella tiene cuatro hijos de 11, 10 y 9 amos y un bebe de 8 meses.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Fátima del Socorro Méndez de 21años vende cosméticos y perfumes y Martha Isabel P. se dedica al comercio de películas hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The group “The Mothers” is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women.  One of them is Darling del Socorro D., 30, who has a sunglass and cell phone accessory (frames,earphones, etc.) business.  She has four children: 11, 10, 9 and an 8-month old baby.

The other members of the group are Fátima del Socorro Méndez, 21, who sells cosmetics and perfumes, and Martha Isabel P. who has had a movie rental business for the past two years.

loans.use: Sunglass and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es:
José reside en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután, se dedica a  la albañilería, tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, José está dedicado a la albañilería desde hace 15 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana y en ocasiones debe acomodarse a los contratos, de 7:00am a 4:00pm, su ventaja es ser reconocido en la zona.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva para comercializarla, ya que su esposa se dedica a este comercio y por el momento necesita invertir en artículos de moda y temporada, este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, ya que de las ganancias de estas ventas él es apoyado en cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en su trabajo y apoyar a su esposa en el negocio y juntos ayudar a sus hijos en la educación, alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Jose lives in Santa Elena in the Usulutan region where he works in construction.  He is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children who are 8 and 10.  Jose has worked in construction for the past 15 years and works every day as he must customize his work schedule based on the contracts he has.  He generally works from 7 am to 4 pm and he is recognized in the region for doing good work.

He is seeking a loan to buy clothing to sell since this is the business his wife runs.  She needs to invest in fashionable clothing for the season.  This loan will help her to strengthen her business and use the income from the business to cover the household expenses.

Jose's goal is to continue in his construction work and support his wife in her business; together they will help to provide for their children to give them a good education, food, and health.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: El Camino Del Exito Group

texts.es:
Juana, 35 años D. edad, casada, 01 hijo; presidenta D. L. alcancìa comunal: "El Camino del Exito".
Juana vive en el distrito D. Mejorada, provincia D. Huancavelica, y se dedica a L. venta D. comida y da pensiòn a trabajadores D. L. zona. Su negocio està ubicado en una zona cèntrica; adicionalmente venD. frutas y golosinas.
Juana tiene el hàbito del ahorro, y con ello màs el crèdito otorgado se comprò una refrigeradora que necesitaba tanto para su restautante.
En L. fotografìa Juana esta vestida con chaleco color gris y esta en el centro D. todos los socios; y L. fotografìa fuè tomada en L. puerta D. su negocio.
L. foto pequeña D. L. parte superior derecha pertenece a Elizabeth I., quièn no pudo asistir por tener que atender su negocio que tambièn es D. comida y da pensiòn.
L. socia que no se encuentra en L. fotografìa es: Aracelli SobrevilL., y no fue a L. reuniòn por estar un poco delicada D. salud.
texts.en:
Juana is 35 years old, married, and has one child.  She is the president of the 'El Camino del Éxito' (The Road to Success) community bank.

Juana lives in Mejorada district, in Huancavelica province.  Her business is selling meals and running a restaurant, catering to workers in the area.  Juana's business is located in a central area.  She also sells fruit and candy.

Juana is in the habit of saving and she put together some of her savings with the loan she was granted in order to buy a refrigerator that she badly needed for her restaurant.

In the photograph, Juana is wearing a grey body warmer and is in the middle of all the other members.  The photograph was taken in the doorway of her business.  The small photo in the top right-hand corner belongs to Elizabeth I. who couldn't attend because she had to work in her restaurant business.

The member who is absent from the photo is Aracelli SobrevilL..  She didn't attend the meeting because she was feeling unwell.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Fernando Ernesto

texts.es: Fernando Ernesto se dedica al destace de res y venta de carne, lo inicia una vez que no tiene un trabajo estable que pueda generar ingresos para su hogar. Él cuenta que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ser una persona muy independiente. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de carne y así ofrecer lomo, hígado, hueso entre otros. Fernando quiere cumplir sus metas una de ellas es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios, también quiere que su negocio logre salir adelante con su medio de vida.
texts.en: Fernando Ernesto engages in beef butchering and meat sale. He started this activity when he found himself without a fixed job that could grant earnings for his family. He says he has always liked working and being an independent person. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy meat and to sell loin, liver and bones among other parts. Fernando wishes to achieve all of his goals, two of which are helping his children finishing their studies and succeeding in making his shop grow together with his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy meat and to sell loin, liver and bones among other parts.

loans.name: Blanca Yanira

texts.es:
Blanca, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután, es soltera y vive con sus padres, administra una tienda y venta de frescos, inicio hace 8 años con la tienda y hace 3 con la venta de frescos.
Actualmente necesita comprar un frisser y comprar mercadería para la tienda como: galletas, boquitas, bebidas y más, la compra de esta mercadería ayudara a incrementar el inventario y mejorar las ventas.
Su aspiración es ampliar el negocio y tener la capacidad de administrar dos negocios.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in Puerto el Triunfo, located in the department of Usulután. She is single and lives with her parents. She runs a store and sells drinks. She started the store 8 years ago, and she has been selling drinks for 3 years.

She currently needs to purchase a freezer and goods such as cookies, snacks, drinks, and more. Purchasing this merchandise will help her increase her inventory and improve sales.

Her goal is to expand her business and to be able to manage both businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and goods like cookies, snacks, drinks, and more.

loans.name: José Martín

texts.es: José Martín, habita en casa propia con su esposa, dos hijas y cuatro hijos. En un  hombre lleno de energía y sobre todo emprendedor. Durante toda su vida ha trabajado para dar a su familia una vida con lo suficiente para vivir dignamente. Posee una tienda en su hogar de residencia en la cual ofrece diversidad de productos de primera necesidad. Para Don José lo más importante son los clientes  por  lo que siempre trata de complacerlos en lo que puede y es por esta razón es que se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas y cada vez lo prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de abastecer su negocio con variedad de mercadería de tienda para siempre estar un paso adelante de la competencia. Para esto ha decidido solicitar este crédito y poder comprar variedad de artículos tales como: huevos, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal, pan dulce, café, bebidas, golosinas, detergente, papel higiénico, y de más artículos que sean atractivos para los clientes.  De esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia que es lo más importante para él.
texts.en:
José Martín lives in his own home with his wife, two daughters and four sons. He is a man who is full of energy and, above all, enterprising. His whole life he has worked in order to provide enough for his family so that they may live a life with dignity. He owns a shop in his place of residence in which he offers a diversity of basic staples. The most important thing to Don José are the customers so he always tries to keep them happy as best he can, which is why he has gained the trust of many and they prefer him more and more. 

He has made the decision to supply his business with a variety of shop merchandise in order to always be a step ahead of the competition. For that reason he decided to seek this loan so he may buy a variety of items such as eggs, beans, rice, sugar, salt, pastries, coffee, drinks, candy, detergent, toilet paper, and other items that may be attractive to the customers. In this way he hopes to improve his standard of living and that of his family which is the most important thing to him.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, beans, rice, sugar, salt, pastries, coffee, drinks, candy, detergent, toilet paper, and other items that may be desirable to the customers.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 18 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Angela has a poultry business, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Angela has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Angela hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Angela is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Née en 1973 au Bénin, Julienne est mariée à un Ingénieur hydropique du nom de Randolph. Le couple a six  enfants  tous scolarisés. Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité,  Julienne contribue aux différentes dépenses de la famille. Julienne a arrêté les classes au cours primaire et a appris ensuite la couture, une activité qu'elle mène depuis environs quatre ans. Dans son atelier, Julienne vend divers articles de merceries. A coté de cette activité, Julienne vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs accompagné de sauce. C’est dans le plus grand marché du Bénin, que Julienne s’approvisionne. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie, Julienne sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Julienne was born in Benin in 1973. She is married to Randolph, an hydrologic engineer. They have six children, all attending school. Thanks to the income from her activity, Julienne contributes to the various household expenses.
