She left school after elementary education and then learnt the dressmaking craft, which has been her activity for the past four years. Julienne also sells haberdashery out of her workshop. In addition to that activity, she sells food products, such as rice and corn pasta with sauce. She gets her supplies at the largest market of Benin. Eager to satisfy her clients and improve her living standard, Julienne came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for her second loan.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery (sewing thread, buttons, etc.).

loans.name: Eney

texts.en:
Eney is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married  and has 2 children. 

Eney  has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods, soap, noodles and juices. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 to buy for additional stocks to sell.

Eney has been a member of HSPFI since this year, 2011.   In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: El señor Alfredo es comerciante; tiene un pequeño snack donde vende comida rápida a sus clientes. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción ya que realizara la refacción de una habitación en su casa para mayor comodidad. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona 14 de septiembre de  ciudad de La Paz. Alfredo es divorciado  y tiene un hijo. Es cliente desde el año 2006 con un historial de pagos excelente. Esta es la primera vez que canalizamos su crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Alfredo is a merchant who has a small snack bar where he sells fast food to his customers. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy building materials so that he can complete the construction of a room in his house so that it will be more comfortable. Alfredo lives in his own home in the September 14th District of the city of La Paz. He is divorced and has one child.

Alfredo has been a client since 2006 and has an excellent payment history. This is the first time he is receiving a loan funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to complete the construction of a room in his house.

loans.name: Delia Esther

texts.es:
La Señora. Delia es socia del banco comunal Maluay, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, parroquia que tiene hermosos paisajes para admirar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña Delia tiene de 54 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos de 26, 19, 17, 14 y 12 años de edad, tres de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su hija de 17 años es casada e independiente y su última hija este año ingresa al colegio. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad, siendo el sacrifico de años de trabajo.

La Señora Delia labora como empleada domestica, trabaja 3 días a la semana de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cerdos y gallinas las que vende en su propia comunidad.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un becerro. 

Su meta es llegar a tener muchos animales para la cría.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Maluay communal bank.  She lives in Maluay that belongs to El Valle Parish, a parish with beautiful scenery to admire.  Its residents are merchants, raise livestock and are farmers.  Many go out daily to work at various jobs in the city.  Its people keep their culture and traditions alive.

Delia is 54 years old and lives in a common law relationship.  She has five children who are 26, 19, 17, 14 and 12 years of age.  Three of her children work and help her out economically.  Her 17-year-old daughter is married and her youngest will start secondary school this year.  Her husband is a mechanic by profession.  The house they live in is their property it being the result of many years of work and sacrifice.

Delia works as a domestic employee three days a week from 8am until 5pm.  At home she raises pigs and chickens that she then sells in her community.

She’s been in the communal bank for a year and she’ll use the new loan to buy a calf.  Her goal is to have lots of animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Pamela Nidia

texts.es: La señorita Pamela es una cliente nueva quien llegó a nuestra institución por recomendación de una antigua cliente quien ya no trabaja con nosotros, ella vive con sus padres  y sus hermano, vende electrodomésticos a facilidad de pago en dos a tres pagos, también por otro lado vende ropa juvenil o lo que el cliente le haga pedido como ser zapatos, pantalones, carteras, etc. Ya viene trabajando desde hace tiempo le fue bien así que continua con el negocio y actualmente solicita para comprar un electrodomésticos y otros pedidos que le hicieron de ropa,  también estudia por las mañanas lo cual nos indica que es una joven responsable quien ayuda  a su familia con los ingresos y se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Pamela is a new client who came to our institution recommended by a former client who no longer collaborates with us.  She lives with her parents and her brother.  

She sells home appliances on easy two or three payments.  She also sells clothes for young adults or whatever her customers order from her like shoes, pants, purses, etc.  She’s been working for some time now and has done well so continues with the business.  

She is asking for a loan presently to buy home appliances and some pending clothing orders.  She also is taking classes in the morning which indicates that she’s a responsibly young woman who helps her family with income and who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy home appliances and assorted clothing.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a determined 30-year-old businessman, is married and blessed with two children, one of whom attends school. To fend for his family, for the last six years David has been running a general shop selling various assorted items for household consumption.

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, David is now equipped with business management skills. He is requesting a loan of 40000 Kenya shillings to buy a water tank and kerosene pump in order to start selling kerosene. Within the next five years he hopes to open another retail shop.

loans.use: to buy a kerosene pump and water tank.

loans.name: Vilman Elisabeth

texts.es:
La señora Vilman Elisabeth es casada, tiene 45 años de edad, estudio hasta el nivel diversificado, tiene 4 hijos 2 los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa, inició este negocio siendo vendedor ambulante y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien dedica al mismo oficio. 

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para compra de mercadería consistente en ropa: playeras, lencería, calzado para bebés, sudaderos. En el futuro espera ver su negocio más grande con la inversión que está haciendo.
texts.en:
Vilman Elisabeth is 45 years old, married, and studied to high school level.  She has four children, two of whom are in school.  Her business is selling clothes.  She started this business as an itinerant street vendor and has five years experience.  She has the support of her husband who is in the same trade.

Vilman Elisabeth decided to request a loan that she could use to buy merchandise: t-shirts, underwear, footwear for babies and sweatshirts.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business with the investment that she is making.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is married and has 8 children. She sells kenkey at Abura. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more maize to enable her to make a large quantity of kenkey for distribution. With the new earnings from her extended business, Adjoa plans to save towards the university education of her children. Her left hand is placed on the pan with the soaked maize that will be milled into dough for the kenkey.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to make a large quantity of kenkey for distribution

loans.name: Mulombi

texts.en: Mulombi took a first Kiva loan which she repaid fully five months ahead of the schedule. She is now taking a bigger loan of 40,000 KES to expand her tailoring business by purchasing cloth materials and another sewing machine for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar is 26 years old and lives with her two sisters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the city of Ulaanbaatar in Mongolia. She just bought some land and a ger. 

She started her business in 2010 by becoming a member of Oriflame beauty product community. Her income and business activity have increased very well since then. She plans to expand her business and she is going to buy a skin-identifying machine. 

She graduated from Ih Zasag University, majored in accounting. She is a diligent and hardworking woman who says "I want to expand my business and improve my life. I did this somehow in the last year with Oriflame." She is requesting a 1,500,000 Tugrik (MNT) loan to buy the skin-identifying machine for her business.

loans.use: To buy a skin-identifying machine

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Sao.  She is married and has three children aged 18, 14, and 7. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they are her husband’s relatives.  

In 2004, Sao established her local foodstuffs business. She began her business because she wants to generate enough income to support her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Sao requires a loan in order to buy brown bulgur, white bulgur, and corn flour. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Sao plans to own a bigger house and to raise enough money to train her children.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy brown bulgur, Corn Flour, and white bulgur.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhjargal, aged 52, works as a janitor in a retirement home which is located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been doing this job for 6 years and during this time she has helped many elders. Enkhjargal is a widow and lives with her daughter in the slum district. Her house has become very old and uncomfortable, so it urgently needs some adjustments. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing some building materials that are needed to make adjustments to her house.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials that are needed to make adjustments to her house.

loans.name: Francis Elaine

texts.en:
Francis Elaine is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Francis Elaine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Francis Elaine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Johnna

texts.en:
Johnna is married with 3 children. Johnna is 29 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

Johnna sells ready-to-wear items to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month she earns 4,200 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase assorted clothing items worth 10,000 PHP.

Johnna has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tires, a mirror and an engine to help him in his business.

loans.name: Chiro

texts.en:
Chiro, 37, is single and lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers in the market. Chiro dreams of establishing other businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 5,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale

loans.name: Gladys Birmania

texts.es:
Gladys  Birmania tiene 39 años vive es casada, y vive con su cónyuge, un primo, y sus dos hijos, de 18 y 11 años. Vive en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el recreo  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya.

Gladys se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, criar gallinas así también se dedica a el negocio de un bar. De confitería víveres desde hace cuatro años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, semillas, urea y abonos  para poder  sembrar maíz, así también para la compra de víveres y confitería para su bar. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño es poder gozar de una buena salud y así poder estar unidos con la familia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y jugar fútbol con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys Birmania, 39, is married and lives with her husband, a cousin and her two children, ages 18 and 11.  She lives in the San Vicente Las Lomas rural community in the Ventanas Canton.

The communal bank "El Recreo" is located in San Vicente Las Lomas and the group members are involved in short cycle crop farming of corn, rice, beans and soy.

Gladys grows corn and beans and raises chickens.  She also runs a bar and sells confectionery and food products, which she has been doing for four years. She buys products in Ventanas and sells at the local market there.  The loan will be used to buy supplies, fertilizer, seeds, urea and compost for her corn crop, also to buy goods and confectionery for her bar.  The loan will help increase her income to support the family.  Her goal is to have good health and be able to be close to her family.

In her free time she enjoys going for walks and playing soccer with her children.

loans.use: To buy supplies, fertilizer, seeds, urea and compost for her corn crop.

loans.name: Yeremiah

texts.en: Yeremiah is a hardworking man who lives in the town of Fort Portal, Uganda. He has taken out previous loans and used them to buy goats to raise and sell. The main challenges he faces in this business are fluctuating prices, inflation and the high cost of labor. His goal is to open a second business which he can use to generate additional income for his family and pay for the education of his children. Yeremiah is applying for this loan to buy more goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Gicela Yaneth

texts.es: Doña Gicela tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada y se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la compra y venta de granos básicos, con más de 1 año de haber iniciado su negocio., la mayoría de sus clientes son los vecinos y las personas que transitan por la zona, Gicela surte a sus vecinos  y muchos la prefieren por la calidad de sus productos.  la Sra. Gicela utilizara el credito para la compra de Maíz Y frijoles, desea cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Gisela, 36, is married and a merchant; her main activity is buying and selling basic grains.  She’s been in business a year.  Most of her customers are neighbors and passersby in the zone.  Gisela stocks her neighbors and many prefer her because of the quality of her goods.  Gisela will use the loan to buy corn and beans because she wants to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy basic grains (beans and corn).

loans.name: Chuisuc De Pamaría Group

texts.es:
La señora Catarina de estado civil casada, tiene 39 años de edad, de escolaridad 3ro. primaria, tiene 9 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de tomates, inició este negocio con su esposo y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de semillas para el cultivo de tomates, espera en el futuro tener grandes cosechas de tomate y otras verduras. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades agrícolas y pecuarias.
texts.en:
Catarina is married and is thirty-nine years old.  She attended school through the third grade.  She has nine children, and three of them are studying.  She makes a living in agriculture, growing tomatoes.  She began this business with her husband and they have ten years of experience.  She counts on the support of her husband, who also makes a living in farming.

She organized a group and is requesting a loan that she will use to buy seeds for her tomato crop.  In the future, she hopes to have large harvests of tomatoes and other vegetables.  

The other members of the group make a living in agriculture and livestock.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her tomato crop.

loans.name: Dramane Sitan

texts.fr: DRAMANE SITAN est né en DECEMBRE 1974 à ZANTOUMALA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali .Mr DRAMANE SITAN est âgé de 41 ans avec 3 enfants. Mr DRAMANE SITAN réside à FAKOLA dans une famille traditionnelle. Mr DRAMANE SITAN s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de céréales (mais, mil, anacarde etc.) Sa vente se fait à FAKOLA. Fort de  ses 8 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  quatrième prêt. Mr DRAMANE SITAN compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 sacs de mais et 15 sacs de mil. Il s’approvisionne à FAKOLA et environnants. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Mr DRAMANE SITAN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat de céréales

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is 48 years old and a mother of ten children; four adults and six dependents who need their supports. Rosemarie has always been dreaming of a business improvement to have better means of living in the future. She also wants to give her children a good education, for them to have better lives. Therefore, she decided to raise pigs to help her husband augment their livelihood. Her husband is a farmer. Rosemarie’s biggest problem in raising pigs is to sustain their feed. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs and to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Mammadov

texts.en: S. is a resident of Beylagan town. He is 27 years old, married with two children. Since 2005, he has been engaged in cattle breeding. He built a shed in his yard where he breeds cattle and sells them. This type of business is usual in rural areas. Each season he sells or slaughters 2-3 cattle. He borrowed three loans from Normicro Beylagan branch since he started the business. Now he needs $700 to buy 15 sheep and breed sheep as well.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Nelofar

texts.en: Nelofar lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is still single and she lives with her father. She is an embroiderer and works at home. She took her first cycle group loan and bought new embroidery machines and extra materials. Now she wants to take anther loan to rent a shop and complete her purchase of all the materials she needs for her shop. She wants to work hard and make a good monthly income. She likes her work a lot and she hopes to make a better life for her and also for her father. She is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To rent a shop

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha works hard to raise and fatten her pigs in which she later on sells them to the people in her community. She is 41 years old and has 3 children and is a member of a group called Agua 1 together with Mrs. Arminda López Bautista (grocery store owner) and Ms. Martha Montoya Díaz who also raises pigs. With this loan, they'll work hard to raise pigs and buy food in great quantities, vitamins and medicines to avoid the fever going around the area and Mrs. Arminda will invest to buy merchandise to stock up her store.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha se dedica a la crianza y engorda de puercos los cuales posteriormente vende entre las gentes de su comunidad, ella tiene 41 años, 3 hijos y pertenece al grupo Agua 1, junto con doña Arminda López Bautista (tienda de abarrotes) y doña Martha Montoya Díaz (crianza de puercos) Con el préstamo las que se dedican a la crianza de puercos compraran comida en grandes cantidades , vitaminas y medicamentos para evitar las pestes tan comunes en la zona y doña Arminda invertirá en comprar mercadería para surtir su tienda con más alimentos.

loans.use: raise and sell pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Sóng, 41 years old, started her waste recycling business 10 years ago. In the beginning, it was just buy and resell. The revenue was not enough for her family of 7. Three of her children are still in school. So in 2003, she and her husband made up a business plan to expand her waste recycling business. Instead of just buy & resell, they would open a factory to produce goods made from recycled material. Determined to succeed, her husband had enrolled in classes to learn how to produce jute bags and plastic beads. Now 4 years later, they own a factory that produces good made with recycled material in Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn district. They have 7 emplyees working in the factory, each earns 45 USD a month. Their revenue after expenses is 950 a month. Ms Sóng is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to expand their operation.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Vân, 39 tuổi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2000. Bản thân là một người phụ nữ năng động chị đã cùng với chồng là anh Lê Văn Thu, cán bộ xã Tiên Dược, bàn bạc vay vốn để kinh doanh mặt hàng tạp hoá ngay tại nhà để phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của đông đảo bà con trong thôn. Tổng thu nhập từ cửa hàng trong 1 tháng là 180USD, cộng thêm tiền lương của chồng giúp gia đình đủ điều kiện kinh tế để trang trải cho những chi phí thường ngày và cho các con ăn học đầy đủ. 3 con chị hiện nay đều đang học đến những năm cuối cấp, riêng cháu đầu đang học cao đẳng ngoài Hà Nội. Hiện tại gia đình chị có kế hoạch sửa chữa nâng cấp cửa hàng và nhập thêm nhiều mặt hàng để phục vụ cho dịp tết Nguyên đán sắp tới, nếu được vay thêm 1200 USD.

loans.use: buy groceries, etc drinks, candy ...

loans.name: Losivale

texts.en: Losivale is thirty-nine years of age and has four children, who are all attending school. She runs a small sewing business at her house in order to get money to support her children’s education. Her husband is also working, but because his salary is not enough to support their family, she decided to use her talent from God as her business to help out with their family needs. Losivale is pleased to have S.P.B.D. supporting her business in terms of money. She is hoping to develop more business, and because of that she is requesting another loan from S.P.B.D.

loans.use: To buy a new electric sewing machine

loans.name: Malickmansur

texts.en: Malickmansur S. lives in Mastchoh. Malickmansur S. has been a client of MicroInvest only since 2007, but he regards himself as a serious and strongly motivated client. Loan sums are permanently increased, which shows business stability and income increase. His business includes raising and selling livestock, milk production, and milk products. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and milk-sour production. He plans to add to the inventory of milk and sour products pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc. Now Mr.S. requires a loan of 1000 STJ for the horn pedigree bull and the pedigree milk cow purchase, which will allow him to increase significantly the family income and plan for further business expansion.

loans.use: Horn pedigree bull and pedigree milk cow purchase

loans.name: Ruzihol

texts.ru:
Ruzihol M. is 48 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 8 children. Ruzihol sells food products at the market in Tursun-zoda called “Dehkon.” Her main products are cookies and other sweets. Ruzihol will use her loan to purchase additional products to sell. She will purchase her products at the Dushanbe market. The loan will help local residents to purchase cookies and sweets for holidays and other days without having to leave their city. Ruzihol will pay back the loan over 4 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мустафокулова Рузихол, возраст – 48 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 8-х детей. Рузихол имеет торговую точку по торговле продуктами питания на рынке города Турсунзаде под названием «Дехкон». Основным её товаром, которым она торгует это печенье и другие сладости. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый ассортимент товар. Товар она приобретает в городе Душанбе. Данный кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать печенье, сладости в праздники и в другие в дни, при этом не выезжая за пределы своего города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 4 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase food products to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: N. Joy is 34 years old, married with four children and hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells Notebooks. She needs $600 to enable her buy more books to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy more books to sell.

loans.name: Chon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chon N., 46, is a widow with four children. She works as weaver and earns around $2 a day.

One of her children works in a restaurant earning a salary $60 a month and another is employed by a garment factory and earns around $2.50 per day. Her other two children work growing vegetables.

With this loan, Mrs. Chon N. will invest in her business and make some repairs to her house.

loans.use: To renovate the house

loans.name: Carola

texts.es:
Carola S. Cori lives as a caretaker of a home in the San Pedro area of La Paz, with her two year old daughter. Carola is employed as a flower shop delivery person in La Paz. The loan she seeks will be used to pay the security deposit for a home in the same area of the city, as the house which she is taking care of is going to be demolished. This is the first time she has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies her favorably to access this line of credit. In addition she needs this assistance in order to be able to live in a safe place.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Carola S. Cori vive como cuidadora de una vivienda en la zona de San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su hija de dos años. La señora Carola es empleada mensajera en una florería de esta ciudad. El crédito solicitado será destinado al pago de un anticretico (una Habitación) en la misma zona, ya que la casa que cuida actualmente será demolida. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito, además de que ella necesita esta ayuda para poder vivir en un lugar seguro. .

loans.use: Pay the security deposit in order to rent a home

loans.name: Miswati

texts.id:
The sales business Miswati is currently doing is already few years old. At this time business is good, although material price increases have affected her small kiosk, she is still entusiastic. Daily in the morning she has to go to Kumbasari market to shop for items for resale. Usuallly her child drives her there by motorcycle. Her sales includes soft drinks, coffee and also light food. Usually buyers are people who often pass her kiosk or live around the neighborhood. For this loan, she plans to use to increase business capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha jualan yang dijalani Miswati sejarang ini sudah berlangsung selama beberapa tahun. Saat ini usahanya cukup bagus, meskipun terkadang naiknya harga barang berdampak pada kios kecilnya, dia tetap bersemangat. Sehari-hari pada pagi hari dia harus ke Pasar Kumbasari untuk belanja barang lalu kemudian dijual lagi. Biasanya dia diantar oleh anaknya menggunakan sepeda motor. Adapun jenis jualannya seperti minuman ringan (soft drink), es campur, kopi dan juga makanan ringan. Umumnya, pembelinya adalah mereka yang sering lewat dikiosnya atupun mereka yang tinggal didaerah sekitarnya. Untuk pinjaman kali ini, dia berencana menggunakannya sebagai tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi H., 40 years old, joined TYM since 2003. Before joining the group, her family sources of income are raising cattle planting vegetables. After joining TYM and getting the first loan, she started to open a variety store. After 4 years with the club, with good planning and on time payment, her family's economy had risen dramatically. A tragedy happened in 2007 as her husband passed away so she have to handle everything by herself to pay for her children's schooling. Currently, apart from her variety store, she also are buying processed food, cooked and resell it for local people. Her children, although still young, are all very thoughtful and always tried to help her out with breeding cattle and taking care of the stores. She would like to borrow 15 millions VND this term to buy fertilizers as well as processed foods. Her monthly income is 2.5 million VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị H. năm nay 40 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2003. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu là do chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Năm 2003 sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vào công việc buôn bán hàng tạp hóa. Sau 4 năm tham gia vào Quỹ, do biết cách tính toán làm ăn, sử dụng, quay vòng vốn có hiệu quả thu nhập của gia đình chị đã tăng lên đáng kể. Năm 2007 không may chồng chị qua đời, chị đã phải cố gắng nhiều hơn trong công việc làm ăn để nuôi các con khôn lớn. Hiện nay ngoài việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa, bán lúa giống chị đã sử dụng vốn để mua thực phẩm sống về chế biến thành thực phẩm chín bán cho khách hàng. Các con chị tuy chưa đến tuổi trưởng thành nhưng cũng có ý thức giúp đỡ chị trong việc chăn nuôi, bán hàng tại nhà. Hiện nay chị mong muốn được vay mức vốn 15 triệu đồng để đầu tư mua thêm phân bón, mua thêm hàng để phục vụ nhân dân địa phương Thu nhập bình quân của gia dình 2.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Business and Raising

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak R. is 35 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her husband is a cook. Because her husband was not able to earn enough for the family expenses,  Muborak decided to open her own business. She began five years ago selling shoes for women. She is delivers the goods by herself. Muborak is working hard in order to keep her children educated and to ensure them with the best future.
Today she requests a loan  of $950  as she is planning to expand her business and to support her elder son who is entering the University. Muborak promises to repay the loan in 10 months and expresses her gratitude to everyone for trusting and supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for expanding the business.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn M. (51, not pictured) and his wife, Mrs. Yoeun Pok (pictured), who live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1981 and have four children; one son and three daughters. Three of her children have full time employment in Phnom Penh, and the other one sells grocery items at home.

Mr. Sorn has been a mason for eighteen years. In addition to his construction work, he also cooks for wedding parties. His wife stays at home and does house work. Sorn is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase one motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase one motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has six children, all between 3 and 24 years old. She works as a charcoal, firewood and food seller, on average, earning a monthly profit of about US$40 from the sales.

Currently, Rehema is looking for a loan to expand her business by adding to the stock of goods in her store.

loans.use: Purchase of additional charcoal, firewood and food for sale

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: Federico, de 32 años de edad es padre de un hijo maravilloso que lo ama mucho, y lo incentiva a seguir adelante, vive junto a su esposa Greysi quien lo apoya mucho, sobre todo en su negocio.  Él se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en su propio domicilio desde hace ya 7 años, gracias a este negocio, compró un motocarro, con el cual trabaja por las tardes brindando transporte de pasajeros, asimismo vende bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas). Federico mantiene abierto su negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas heladas casi todo el día, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y ver producir de una forma ascendente su negocio.   Trabaja para solventar sus gastos diarios, mantener activo su negocio y sobre todo para la educación de su hijo.  Ahora desea ampliar su tienda de abarrotes y ambientar con mesas, sillas y otros, su venta de bebidas heladas para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Federico, age 32, is the father of a wonderful son who loves him very much and motivates him to move forward. Federico lives with his wife, Greysi, who supports him a lot, especially in his business. He has been selling provisions and basic need items from home for 7 years now. Thanks to this business, he was able to purchase a motorcycle taxi, which he works with in the evenings providing transporation to passengers. He also sells cold drinks (beer and soft drinks). Federica keeps his general store open almost all day long. What he likes about his job is providing good customer service and watching his business grow. He works in order to cover his daily expenses, to keep his business active, and aboveall, to provide an education for his son. He now wishes to expand his general store and give his beverage business some atmosphere with tables, chairs, and other things in order to better welcome his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Liven up his beverage business with better furniture

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen O. is 30 years old and married with no children. She sells drinks and provisions. With the help of LAPO Microfinance she added the sale of lubricants, like engine and hydraulic oil. The demand for her lubricants is high. She needs a loan in the amount of N70,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. She is very grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Shade

texts.en: Shade makes a living selling clothes, shoes and bags. Demand for her goods is high, and she has been in this business for a long time. Shade is 36 years old and married with four children. She lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria, and is a LAPO client. She has applied for a loan to buy more clothes, shoes and bags to sell, and extends her thanks to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Evelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Evelina cuenta con 31 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr.  Osmar Pastor López Paredes de 29 años de edad,  la misma tiene 1 hija de 4 años.

 El  negocio lo tienen desde el año 2.006, los primeros tiempo comenzaron a vender tipo vendedor ambulante llevando mercaderías especificas y salía en moto acompañado de su marido, viajaban por los distritos aledaños del Guiara.

 La cliente tiene experiencia en el rubro aproximadamente 5 años, cuando comenzó a trabajar como vendedora de una casa comercial en ese entonces dedicada al rubro de electrodomésticos, durante 3 años  y fue donde le conoció al señor Osmar quien trabajaba en es entonces para otra casa comercial del mismo rubro. Hoy en día poseen  su negocio propio lo cual le esta yendo muy bien. Ahora tiene un local con muchos productos además tiene 2 vendedores lo cual salen  a hacer las ventas por la campaña con ellos comenzaron. 
La cliente solicito el préstamo para completar su capital para realizar compra de algunas mercaderías que le faltan, especialmente calzados para caballeros el cual tiene mucha demanda de parte de sus clientes, también dijo que haría algunas mejoras en su local específicamente modernizar con puerta de vidrio, ya que las mercaderías son muy azotadas
por el polvo y el sol.
texts.en:
Evelina is 31 years old, married to Osmar Pastor López Paredes, age 29, and has a 4-year old daughter. They have owned a business since 2006. Initially, they were street vendors selling a limited variety of merchandise and would go out on her husband's motorcycle to districts surrounding Guiara. This client has 5 years' experience from the time she began working as a salesperson in a home appliances business, where she worked for 3 years and where she met Osmar, who was working in the same line of business for a different company. Today, they own their own business which is doing well. They now have a store where they offer a varitey of products as well as having 2 employees who go out to make sales in the countryside, as they used to when they started their business. The client is requesting the loan to bolster her working capital in order to buy merchandise which they do not have in stock, specifically footwear for men, for which there is a high demand. She also told us that she will make some improvements to the store, particularly to modernize it with a glass door, as the merchandise needs protection from the dust and the sun.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's footwear and a glass door for the store.

loans.name: Eung

texts.en: Eung C. is 25 years old and lives with her parents (her mother pictured here) and brother in Battambang province, Cambodia. She earns income operating a small soup shop. On average, she is able to make US$8 per day. Eung C. would like to take out a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her brother, so that he can start a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a photographer. He also sells rechargeable phone cards to his customers. He now needs a loan for N50,000 in order to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and film. He is 24 years old and single. With the profits he makes from his business, Timothy hopes to further his education. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and film

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Rose Mango from Mwanza. She is single and has two children between the ages of 12 and 19. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because he is an orphan.

Rose has been running a pig and poultry business since 2004. The pig and poultry business is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. Nguruwe means pig in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. They can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide protein.

Rose works at her business for 12 hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by one employee. She currently earns about $150 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy more pigs. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Rose thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets: thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thereby enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more pigs.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua S. is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to six children. Currently, the last born is in the primary school while the rest are in the senior high and the junior high schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Mampong is mainly a business town.

Akua is a food vendor. She sells porridge in the mornings. Most people eat porridge for breakfast. She prepares the porridge with either maize or millet. Akua buys her raw materials from the wholesalers in the local market and, at times, travels to nearby markets to buy at more economical price. She also hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell the porridge in her community in the mornings.

Akua has been in this business for ten years. She wants a loan to buy raw materials in bulk so she can expand her business and increase her profit margin so she can care for her children.

loans.use: To procure maize, millet, etc.

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe is 41 years old, married, and has 5 children. She sells cooked foods. She started this business in 2004. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN (US$ 350) to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokim K., 37, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Aum, 39, live in a small village in the suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married for 19 years and have four children; three of them are in school and one stays at home. 

Sokim has been selling dried fish and smoked fish for five years. She buys them at the local market for resale in her village. Mr. Sokha Aum has been a security guard for three months. He works at Porsat province which is far away from his home.

Sokim wants to expand her business to become bigger so she is asking for her first loan of $400 to purchase more dried fish and smoked fish for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish and smoked fish.

loans.name: Vilma Maria's Group

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Vilma tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende abarrotes en general al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Vilma viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Vilma sueña con comprar un carro, una casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Ollantay Communal Bank. Vilma is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a stall in the Nery García market where she sells groceries wholesale and retail every day with her children's help. Vilma also travels to markets where she can buy grain. Vilma needs a loan for 1500 soles to buy grain. Vilma hopes to buy a car and a house, and for her children to get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of staple goods and foodstuffs

loans.name: Wayna Ccapac Group

texts.es:
Los socios son del banco comunal “WAYNA CCAPAC”, ellos son 10 miembros, residentes D. Urubamba, ubicado en pleno corazón del valle sagrado D. los inkas, en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios, alternas sus actividades D. costumbre con el comercio minorista, ellos desean solicitar este préstamo en razón a sus necesidades D. implementar sus pequeños negocios como el D. tiendas abarrotes, con productos al por mayor D. arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceites y otros y otro grupo D. socios utilizarán el préstamo para comprar todo lo referente a la venta D. chicha D. maíz amarillo, para esto ellos desean los diferentes montos.

Ellos se encuentran agradecidos con este medio. Por la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total D. sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the “WAYNA CCAPAC” Microfinance Institute resiD. in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, in the city of Cusco.

Our members alternate their traditional customs with their small businesses. They would like to request this loan so that they may restock their general stores with wholesale products like rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, and other goods. Some of the other members will use their loan to purchase everything related to chicha (a traditional beverage derived from corn) sales, such as yellow corn. This is why they need different amounts of money.

They are very grateful to this institute for the opportunity that they have been given, and they committed to repaying their debts within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store and chicha sales

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Thúy Nguyễn Thị is fifty years old and lives in the town of Đô Lương.  She is married and has one grown child.  To make a living, Thúy owns and operates a business serving breakfast foods to customers in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately $115 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Thúy joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.  Thúy is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be her second loan from TYM Fund.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha M. tiene 54 años. Es una mujer casada tiene 4 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de  frutas y verduras. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. Es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que desde muy joven le gustaba relacionarse con todo tipo de personas, ya que ofrece sus productos en comarcas y obtiene muchos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de tomates, cebollas, naranjas, repollo entre otras verduras. El deseo de Martha es proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio y a su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha M. is 54 years old, married, and has 4 dependent children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for more than 13 years. Sra. Martha is a hardworking woman who, from a young age, has enjoyed interacting with all types of people. She offers regional products and has obtained many customers.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tomatoes, onions, oranges, cabbages and other vegetables. She hopes to make improvements to her business and her modest home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Gauilepapa

texts.en:
Gauilepapa N., a 49-year-old woman living in the town of PitoN., is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Gauilepapa plants and harvests ta'amu (giant taro) to sell. Gauilepapa has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 300 WST a month.

In 2009, Gauilepapa (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gauilepapa is requesting her first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gaston Koffi

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est un informaticien ; il n’est pas marié et n’a pas non plus aucun enfant à sa charge. Il n’a pas pu trouver un emploi à son goût pour se prendre en charge. C’est pour cette raison qu’il a pris la décision l’année dernière d’ouvrir son propre cyber café dans le quartier de Cassanblaca à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet désormais de subvenir à ses besoins ; il gère lui-même le cyber pour le moment mais compte recruter une jeune fille dans l’avenir. Il pense donc acquérir de nouvelles machines ; c’est pour cela qu’il voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter au moins 03 ordinateurs ; le reste du prêt servira à acheter des fils et câbles d’alimentation. Il est persuadé que ce prêt apportera un grand changement dans ses activités.

loans.use: Achat de matériels informatiques

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. has been a member of ASHI for the past years. Business she supported with the loan she gets through ASHI all throughout her membership was managed by her husband. Because of the increasing expense of her family, Josephine is requesting for a much larger amount of loan which she will going to use in growing her fishing business. Through loan she is requesting she plans to purchase instruments and gadgets for fishing as well as repairing their fishing boat.    

Josephine’s fishing business is her family’s cup of tea and bread. Her dream of sending all her six children ages from five to 21 years old to college until graduation relies on the profit her business will be making.  Her hope of upgrading her family lifestyle anchors on the stability of her business. Above everything else, Josephine’s happiness and contentment in life being a mother and a wife depends on the success of her business.

loans.use: Will be used to spend for the fishing boat repair and for purchasing gadgets and gears for fishing.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma O. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Guillerma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Guillerma owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing vulcanizing/tire repair services to local community members. Guillerma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Guillerma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillerma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. Guillerma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Guillerma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to reinvest in her business and save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Koffi Nouwozan

texts.fr:
Koffi Nouwozan T. est un homme de 40 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, une ville située à 120  kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un conducteur de taxi-moto et avec ce crédit de Kiva, il voudrait acheter une moto en vue de faire un taxi. Koffi  prend les gens les conduit et les dépose à leur destination et à son tour prend les fais correspondant à la distance parcourue. Avec ce travail il voudrait épargner de l’argent afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. 

FECECAV is a cooperative union registered in 1997. It's mission is to serve the financial needs of local people who have been excluded from the traditional financial system. It serves more than 50000 members in the Plateaux and Maritime regions of Togo. FECECAV is a non-profit organization.
texts.en:
Kossi Biova T. is a 28-year-old man, unmarried, and without children. He lives in Lomé (capital of Togo), a city located 120 km from Kpalimé. He is a retailer of second-hand clothing and the like. With this Kiva loan, he would like to buy bales of used clothing and to sell them retail. In this way, he will be able to increase his customer base and to obtain a lot of profit. With the profits, he would really like to increase his purchases and to satisfy all his customers. FECECAV is a savings union created in 1995 and approved in 1997. It covers the region of Plateaux and Maritime. Its mission is to meet the financial needs of the people in the region who are excluded from the standard financial system. Today, FECECAV has over 50,000 members and plans on extending its activities to surrounding towns in the region. FECECAV is a not-for-profit organization.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Amparo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Solera, tiene 33 años y no tiene hijos.

Amparito, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios y se inició con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 y por iniciativa propia, implemento su pequeño negocio, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, donde vende sus comidas preparadas como juanes, tamalitos, arroz chaufa, arroz con pollo; dulces y golosinas; chifles, y en bebidas como: gaseosas, refrescos y jugos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de refrigerios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ms. Amparo belongs to the Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores” in the Morales District of the Province of San Martin – Dept. of San Martin. She is single and 33-years old with no children. Ms. Amparo is what you call a sweetheart; she is committed to selling snacks and with her first loan of S/. 300.00, with great initiative, she started a small business that was well maintained to attend to her clients. Today, she’s still at the same business, where she sells her meals and drinks like: sodas, refreshments and juices. With this loan for S/. 1,000.00 she will buy ingredients for food preparation like, sacks of rice, sugar, chicken and eggs, noodles and oil by the dozen. She’ll also purchase cooking utensils to provide quality service. She feels empowered to be able to continue selling snacks and she is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation of snacks

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita F. is from the town of Rizaluna Cordon. She is 45 years old. Juanita is widowed and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Juanita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.

In 2009, Juanita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Juanita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Heren

texts.en:
Heren R. is from the village of Nicdao, Baungon  Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Heren is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Heren owns & operates a business selling a la carte (grilled chicken parts) in the local community. Heren is just starting this business.

In 2009, Heren joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Heren is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Heren from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Doris works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a seamstress by profession, working in a shop by the roadside in her community. According to her, she has been in business for thirteen years and wants a loan to buy fabrics and other sewing accessories to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Dios Es Nuestro Amparo Group

texts.en:
Maximlliano is the coordinator of the Dios es Nuestro Amparo (God is our shelter) group, and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. His group is located in El Seybo, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.  He makes his home in a simple structure with his wife and nine children.

Maximilliano is excited to be taking his fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid previous loans to grown his business. He plans to use this loan to purchase more blouses to sell.  He will use the profits to construct a concrete house for his family.  He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Buy blouses to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells frozen foods, like chicken, turkey and frozen fish. She also has a business renting DVDs and VCDs. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. 

Esther is married and has 2 children. She is 32 years old. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home. 

She is hoping for a loan of NGN 160,000 to purchase more frozen food to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
Carina, de 24 años, vive en compañía de su pareja Edgar de 31 años, quien es agricultor y de su pequeña hija que estudia en el colegio primario de la zona.

Desde que era muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió las técnicas de sus padres y cuando formó su familia continuó trabajando junto a su esposo en la siembra de papa, olluco, maíz y alverja para sacar adelante a su familia. Ya han pasado 9 años y dice que le gusta mucho cultivar la tierra porque es lo que mejor que sabe hacer, aunque es algo sacrificado levantarse todos los días al amanecer para vigilar con dedicación sus campos, es gratificante recoger la gran producción en la temporada de cosecha. Todos sus productos, los vende a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona y con lo que ganan puede darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. Paralelamente a este trabajo se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, el cual comercializa eventualmente a los productores de la zona. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para aumentar su producción y tener mayores ganancias económicas.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito, el cual le permitirá continuar trabajando para alcanzar el progreso. Además, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que todos los integrantes son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes  para asegurar sus tierras en las siembras futuras.
texts.en:
Carina is 24 years old and lives with her husband, Edgar, who is 31 and a farmer, and with her little girl who attends the local elementary school. She’s been farming since she was very young and learned the techniques from her parents. Even after starting her family, she continued to work, alongside her husband, raising potatoes, root vegetables, corn, and barley, in order to help move her family ahead. They’ve been doing this together for nine years and she says that she enjoys working the land because it’s the best that she knows how to do, although it involves some sacrifice having to rise at dawn each day to care for her fields. It’s very satisfying to reap the large harvest. She sells all of her products to large businesses in her zone and the income provides a good quality of life to her children. At the same time she also raises cattle, which she eventually sells to the processors within the zone. Since she is a very enterprising woman, she plans to plant in larger quantities in the future, in order to improve her income. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is very thankful to all the people who make this loan possible so that she can continue to work and move ahead. She is also very happy with the work that her communal bank has done and its members are very responsible with their payments. She will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer to prepare her land for future crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and Fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
JESUS ELVIRA, TIENE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA Y ESTÁ A LA ESPERA DE SU PRIME HIJO. ELLA ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "MUJERES TRIUNFADORAS", RECIENTEMENTE ELEGIDA POR SUS SIETE COMPAÑERAS COMO PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO. ELLAS RESIDEN EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
JESUS ELVIRA, SE DEDICA HACE TRES AÑOS A LA VENTA DE ROPA EN UN LOCAL EN GAMARRA (LUGAR DONDE SE CONCENTRA EL MAYOR COMERCIO DE VENTA  AL POR MAYOR Y MENOR Y CONFECCIÓN DE PRENDAS DE VESTIR).
AL CASARSE, SU SUEGRO LA INCENTIVO A A DEDICARSE A ÉSTE NEGOCIO YA QUE ELLOS SE DEDICABAN HACE MUCHO TIEMPO A LAS CONFECCIONES Y LES HABÍA RESULTADO MUY RENTABLE.
HOY EN DÍA ELLA CUENTA CON SU NEGOCIO PROPIO DE NOMBRE "CONFECCIONES YOSELL"
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE TELAS PARA CONFECCIONAR PRENDAS DE VESTIR.
texts.en:
Jesus Elvira is 33 years old, is married and is expectig her first child. She is a member of the group 'Mujeres Triunfadoras', recently elected president by her 7 colleagues.They live in the Comas district. Jesus has worked for 3 years selling clothes in a location in Gamarra (a place where the majority of clothing sale and dressmaking businesses are concentrated). When she married, her father-in-law gave her an incentive to start her business as they had been working making clothes for many years and had found it to be very profitable. Jesus calls her business 'Confecciones Yosell'. The loan she is seeking will be invested in purchasing threads to make clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase threads

loans.name: Selepa

texts.en:
Selepa F. is 40 and married with 5 children (ages 4 - 18).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting cocoa for sale.  Selepa has 4 years of experience in this business.  Selepa needs a loan of WST $2250 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support extended members of her family.

In 2006, Selepa joined SPBD.  This is her 6th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Selepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yan Carlos

texts.es:
Yan Carlos U.,  es un joven casado y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad,  vive en el barrio Blas de Lezo de la ciudad de Cartagena y  es propietario de la Llantería El Yanky que es la  fuente de ingreso de su hogar desde antes de casarse cuando apoyaba a su madre y  mas ahora en el hogar que ha conformado. Para continuar fortaleciendo su  negocio está aplicando a un  crédito por valor de   $ 2.000.000  que será invertido en la .

Inicio su negocio con poco capital y como única alternativa para ganarse la vida, fue así como poco a poco fue creciendo y dándose a conocer hasta adquirir una  mayor clientela entre los vecinos de su barrio, empleados de empresas que están cercas del negocio y todo el que día a día conoce su trabajo, ya sea por accidente, casualidad o por recomendación de sus clientes reales. El ha obtenido Sus créditos anteriores con la Fundación  le han representado mayores ingresos y mayores cliente, pues pudo crecer en cobertura en su barrio y apoyar el sostenimiento de su familia actualmente conformada por su esposa e hijo y  de su madre cuando vivía con ella.
texts.en:
Yan Carlos U. is married and has a two year old child. He lives in the Blas de Lezo neighborhood in the city of Cartagena. He has a tire shop, El Yanky. It has been the source of income for his household since before he was married, when he supported his mother. It is even more so now in the home that he has made. To continue strengthening his business, he is asking for a loan for 2,000,000 COP, which will be invested in the. He started his business with a small amount of capital as the only way to earn a living. Little by little it was growing, he was becoming known, and he got more customers among the neighbors and employees of companies that are close to his business. Everyday people know of his work either by accident, chance, or the recommendation of his customers. He has had previous loans with the Fundación, which meant greater income and more customers. He was able to grow and cover his neighborhood better. He was also able to support his family, which currently consists of his wife, child, and his mother when he lived with her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy patches, tires, tar-worms for plugging punctures, knobs and rims to fix tires on vehicles and to buy new tires

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren S. is a 42-year-old widow who lives with her 15-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Byambsuren's daughter attends a local secondary school.

Byambasuren operates a tailoring business. She graduated from a four-month sewing training course in 1990. She has been operating her business since 1996, and has become an experienced tailor. Since 2004, she has rented a workplace to let her more easily provide her services to her many customers.

Byambasuren has been planning to grow her business and to improve her equipment. She is a very hardworking person and says, “I would like to grow my business and improve my family's standard of living by receiving a loan.” Byambasuren is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials and equipment.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials and equipment for his tailoring business

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Desde hace 10 años, Eduarda fue levantando su negocio de tortillas y ventas.  Con la ayuda de su marido, quien le ayuda en la compra de maíz y leña, Eduarda a llegado a vender frito de cerdo y buñuelos de yuca.  Ahorra ella tiene mejor ganancia.

Eduarda va usar este préstamo para comprar maíz, leña, y cal. Ella ha tenido préstamos en el pasado y los ha usado para ampliar su negocio.

Eduarda y su familia sueñan de sacar adelante sus hijos menores.  Ella tambien tiene la meta de ampliar su negocio a la venta de cuajada
texts.en:
For the last 10 years Eduarda has built up her tortilla sales business. With her husband's help, who helps her buy corn and firewood, Eduarda has managed to also sell "frito de cerdo" (fried pork dish) and "buñuelos de yuca" (fried donut-like, manioc-based pastry); this has produced higher profits for her. Eduarda will use these funds to buy corn, firewood and lime powder. She has had previous loans that she used to expand her business. Eduarda and her family dream with getting their younger children ahead. She also has a goal of expanding her business into the sale of "cuajada" (a cheese-like dairy product).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and lime powder.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma D., 53 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Emma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be the first loan taken out by Emma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn N. is from the village of Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old, married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a fish selling business. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month for these activities. In 2008, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and be used as working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Marilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital and inventory for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Candy Natalli

texts.es: La Sra. Candy se dedica a la venta de tucumanas, empanadas con relleno de carne molida y condimentos, acompañados de salsas, en el mercado de la zona de San Antonio Alto, y tiene también un puesto donde varios productos como juguetes, regalos, cosmeticos, y otros. Aprendió esta actividad de su mamá ya que ella vende desde hace muchos años. Ella y su familia son muy conocidos por la zona ya que viven en la misma zona. Vive en la casa de sus abuelos con sus papás y sus hermanos, que ya son independientes. El crédito será invertido en la compra de juguetes, cosméticos y dulces para el bazar.
texts.en:
Candy dedicates herself to selling tucumanas, empanadas filled with ground beef and seasoning, accompanied with sauces. She sells them in the market in the neighbourhood of San Antonio Alto. She also has a stand where she sells various products such as toys, gifts, cosmetics, etc. She learned this business from her mother, who has been a saleswoman for many years. Candy and her family are well known in the area where they sell their goods since they live in the same area. Candy lives in her grandparents’ home with her parents and siblings, who are independent. This credit will be invested in purchasing toys, cosmetics, and sweets to sell in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Anne R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gifts and toys to sell in the market

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa A. is currently in the business of selling books, boxes of pens and many other scholastic materials. She is requesting a loan to stock more exercise books and textbooks to sell.  Hawa is 39 years old. Her husband is a commissioner's secretary. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a supermarket.

loans.use: Stock more exercise books and textbooks to sell

loans.name: Formando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal“Formando un Futuro” integrada por 10 emprendedoras socias y un socio que gracias a sus esfuerzos dedicación y sacrificio logran sacar a delante a sus familias y asi darles una mejor calida D. vida.
   Ellas vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD hace un año y medio.Como es el caso D. L. Sra. Paulina(L. señora que posa D. pie en L. foto) que hace muchos años a tras vivía una casa prefabricada.
        En L. actualidad Paulina que se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes en un mercado cerca a su casa y con el apoyo D. su esposo que también trabaja  en una fábrica lograron construir una humilD. casa D. material noble gracias a los ahorros y pequeñas ganancias que elL. y su esposo tenían; pero aun todavía lo falta techar y terminar con algunos acabados interiores como terminar a tarrajear las paredes,colocar mayólicas a los baños  y unas puertas mas seguras.
               Paulina sueña con tener su casa terminada  para trasladar su negocio a su propia casa y dar una mayor comodidad para sus 3 pequeños hijos que están estudiando porque cuando sale a trabajar L. mayor D. sus hijas es quien se hace cargo D. sus hermanos pero gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio su sueño pronto se hara realidad.
   Paulina se siente satisfecha por los logros alcanzados hasta ahora; ElL. cuenta que nada D. eso  hubiese sido posible sin L. confianza que le dio EDAPROSPO al otorgarlo sus tres préstamos en estos 18 meses que viene trabajando.
