   El reciente préstamo lo utilizara  en implementar aun mucho más su negocio comprando todo lo necesario para tener un buen surtido en su tienda.
texts.en:
The "Formando un Futuro" (Making a Future) community bank consists of 10 women and one man who--thanks to their effort, dedication, and sacrifice--have been able to move forward and give their families a better quality of life. They have been working with the EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD microfinance partner for a year and a half. Such is the case with Mrs. Paulina (the woman standing up in the photo), who used to live in a prefabricated house for many years. Today, Paulina sells groceries at a market near her house; with the help of her husband, who works in a factory, she was able to build a humble house of good material using their savings. But the house still lacks a roof and needs some finishing, such as coating the walls with cement, putting tiles in the bathrooms, and installing safer doors. Paulina wants to finish her house so that she can move her business there and so that she can make life more comfortable for her 3 small children, who are students. At the moment, her eldest daughter takes care of the others while she is at work. Thanks to her hard work and sacrifice, her wish will soon be a reality. Paulina is satisfied with her achievements to date. She tells us that none of this would have been possible without EDAPROSPO's support; they have given her three loans over the past 18 months. She will use this loan to expand her business, buying what she needs to build up a good supply of products in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Joshua Obongo

texts.en: Joshua Obongo, age 31, is married with three children ages 1, 3, and 9.  He has been a welder for about six years. His business is busy with a constant flow of customers. His wife also works to help support the family. Joshua learned about KADET microfinance through a friend who is also a KADET client. He now requests his second loan, for 50,000 KES, to buy supplies for his welding work. Joshua hopes to expand his business and increase his income so he can adequately support his family.

loans.use: To buy welding supplies.

loans.name: Florelita

texts.en:
Florelita C., 58, is a married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: fishing/fish vending and pig fattening. She lives in Brgy. Pasil, Santander, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish-vending and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20000. Florelita is borrowing PHP 15000 to  purchase more  fishing gear and materials to use in her fishing activities. This will be her eleventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14000, which she paid off well within its term, was another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Florelita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and materials

loans.name: Kotognogonta Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Kotognogontala sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans  et 3 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali : Sikasso). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre prêts précédents. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce en générale et des prestations de service telle que la teinture avec KADIA D..
KADIA D. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 4 paquets de colorants différents +10kg de soude caustique + deux chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville et ses villages avoisinants.
Elle méne son activité à domicile au comptant et à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle compte avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et  pouvoir aménager un coin pour le besoin.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Kotognogontala are essentially married women averaging 43 years of age and three children.  The women live for the most part in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali:  Sikasso).  They are on their fifth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso after having properly repaid the four previous loans.  This group of women works in general commerce and provides services, such as the dying of cloth (in the case of Ms. KADIA D.).

KADIA D. plans to use her loan to buy 4 packets of different dyes, 10 kg of caustic soda, and two cart loads of firewood.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso City and from neighboring villages of hers.  She operates her business out of her home.  Accepting cash, she sells to a customer base composed of men and women.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 35,500 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be put into savings and used for family needs.  The other part will be invested in business.  She plans on obtaining more capital in order to satisfy her customers better and to be able to fix up the needed area.

loans.use: Buying dyes and the supplies to dye cloth

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny P. is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two young children in Takeo province. She sells sugar cane juice, making US$2.50 of profit a day, while her husband operates a moto-taxi. On average, he is able to make about US$4 a day. This family spends about US$50 on food monthly, US$6 on utility, and US$15 on other expenses. Ny P. is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase a motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Nelia Benita

texts.es:
Nelia es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 02 hijos, tiene estudios de educación superior incompleta.

Nelia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su  primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda.

Su sueño es terminar con su profesión y tener un Minimarket.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad y el respeto entre socias.
texts.en:
Nelia is a member of the "Azangarinas Valientes" Banco Comunal, which is located in the Azángaro province in the department of Puno in Peru.  She is 33 years old, married and has two children. She did not finish her high school education. 

Nelia has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles (500 Peruvian soles) and she used that money to increase the capital of her grocery-selling business.

Nelia is now requesting a new  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles loan, which she will use to buy merchandise for her shop.

Her dream is to end up owning a minimarket.

What Nelia likes most about her Banco Comunal is the conscientiousness and respect among the members.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery-selling business

loans.name: Maxim

texts.en:
Maxim is married. He is a businessman from Pavlograd where he sells fittings and accessories for water and sewer lines. He owns a big pavilion offering a nice selection of items for sale. The pavilion is located in the central marketplace attracting potential customers passing by. Presently, Maxim has 25,000 UAH in inventory.   

Maxim is seeking a loan of 11,000 UAH to purchase additional merchandise and to restock available inventory. Maxim recognizes a good opportunity to broaden the selection of goods he offers and increase his sales volume. As he meets the demand, he will be able to generate the necessary funds to adequately provide for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Crelia Gabriela

texts.es:
Crelia Gabriela V. S. tiene 55 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 8 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Crelia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es terminar la casa y estar junto a la familia en caso de enfermedad.

Le gusta pasear con la familia los domingos.
texts.en:
Crelia Gabriela V. S. is 55 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children. They live in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She has 8 children.

The LUZ Y PROGRESO ("Light and Progress") loan group is located 20 minutes away from the Chillanes office, in the canton of Chillanes. The office focuses on farming and other professional activities and has a total of 17 members. Crelia works in agriculture. She grows corn, beans, peas and lupin. She buys the goods in Chillanes and sells them at the Chillanes fair and on the premises. 

She request the loan to buy corn, beans, peas and lupin. The loan will help her meet her financial needs. They face challenges such as pests, diseases and the changes in the weather. Her dream is to finish her house and be with her family in case of illness. She enjoys going for walks with her family on Sundays.

loans.use: Seeds

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señorita Maria Mercedes C. Carballo, es soltera sin hijos, tiene un copetín en el cual vende minutas, golosinas, gaseosas y jugos, el local está ubicado en el predio del Hospital Regional De Villarrica. 
Es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta. La ayuda en su copetín su abuela.
Solicito apoyo crediticio para la compra de mercaderías como harina, huevo, leche, gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, para aumentar su stock y también para elaborar los alimentos como empanadas, milanesas, sandwich, etc. porque en esta época empieza a aumentar la demanda, tiene su clientela formada.
La señorita Mercedes agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad brindada porque gracias a eso ella podrá seguir dando a sus clientes productos de buena calidad, y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando el nivel.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes C. Carballo is single and doesn't have any children.  She has a small restaurant in which she sells fast food, sweet treats, soda and juice.  Her premises are located in the grounds of the Regional Hospital of Villarrica.

Mercedes is a very hard-working and honest person.  Her grandmother helps her in her restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as flour, eggs, milk, soda, juice, sweet treats, etc. to increase her stock and also so that she can make food such as empanadas, 'milanesas' (a breaded meat dish), sandwiches, etc. because demand starts to rise during this season.  She already has an established customer base.

Mercedes is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving because it will enable her to continue providing her customers with good-quality products which will, in turn, enable her to continue improving the standard.

loans.use: To buy flour, meat, eggs, milk and sweet treats.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio U. M. es casado y tiene tres hijos a su responsabilidad quienes  son: maría Angélica de trece  año, la  otra es Blanca Estela de  once años y el más pequeño Ignacio de siete años.

       El solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta  de becerros  y vacas para  luego venderlo en  la misma región ya que es un negocio de buen resultado  dejando buen ingreso en su familia

       Inicio por su propia creatividad ya que  para tener ingresos en su hogar tiene que tener de donde trabajar  algo que le dejara buen resultado  y con ello salga adelante.

       Con las ganancias que  baya obteniendo lo estar a  invirtiendo  en la compra  de mas veceros para seguir trabajando durante dios le preste vida y así logre realizar todos su sueños.

      Su sueño  es que sus hijos salgan delante  teniendo una buena preparación  y de ello puedan vivir en el futuro ya que la mejor herencia es que tengan una buena profesión.
texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio U. M. is married and has three children in his care.  They are: María Angélica, 13, Blanca Estela, 11, and the youngest, Ignacio, 7.

He requested a loan to invest in the purchase of calves and cows for subsequent resale in the same region since this is a business that produces good results consisting in income for his family.

He started out thanks to his own creativity since in order to have household income he must have a way of working at something that produces good results in order to get ahead.

He will reinvest profits as they are earned in the purchase of additional calves to continue working as long as God grants him life thus making his dreams come true.

His dream is that all his children succeed having a good preparation so that they can support themselves in the future since the best inheritance a parent can give is a good profession.

loans.use: To buy livestock, like cows and calves, for subsequent resale in the same region.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara, de 51 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposo y dos de los cuatro hijos que tiene en total, pues los mayores son independientes. Desde hace muchos años esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la fabricación de  manualidades en su vivienda, ahí confecciona muñecos que sirven como adornos para los ambientes de la casa y también adornos navideños; paralelamente pinta cuadros y elabora recordatorios para bautizos, promociones entre otros. Pues mediante esta actividad se genera sus propios ingresos con los que ayuda a  los gastos en su hogar. Desde entonces es muy conocida en su barrio, ya que realiza trabajos de buen acabado y a precios muy asequibles, es por esta razón  que sus vecinos no dudan de recomendarles, porque saben de su responsabilidad. Ella  siempre recepciona sonriente  los trabajos que tiene por hacer, ya que a veces  cuenta con el apoyo de otra persona, de ese modo es muy oportuna con su trabajo. En la actualidad  piensa estudiar manualidades en decoraciones de cintas, de esta manera espera ampliar los servicios que brinda. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y es un asocia muy puntual  con sus cuotas, además es muy  responsable con las obligaciones de su banco comunal. El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la  compra de cintas,  telas, esponjas que son materiales que necesitan para  sus respectivos rellenos y accesorios para continuar realizando sus trabajos de manualidades, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sara, 51, lives in her own house with her husband and two of their four children since the oldest two are independent adults.  For several years now this enterprising woman has been making crafts at home.  She makes figurines used to decorate homes and also Christmas decorations.  She also makes paintings and keepsakes for baptisms, graduations, etc.  Through this activity she earns her own income that helps her meet household expenses.

She is very well known in her neighborhood because she makes items that are well done at accessible prices so her neighbors always recommend her knowing of her responsibility.

She always welcomes the jobs she has to do with a smile.  Sometimes she has a helper so she is always punctual with her work.  She currently wants to take a ribbon decorating crafts course to expand the services she offers.

This is her 11th loan with MFP.  She is very punctual with her payments as well as very responsible with her communal bank commitments. 

She will use the requested loan to buy ribbons, fabrics and foam which are the supplies needed for her various fillings and accessories to continue making her crafts and improving profits.

loans.use: To buy ribbon, fabric, foam and other crafts-making accessories.
